1bax4MYXPKgQB_40dmTJtg.text: Today was pretty busy with a line at 6:30pm.  FYI - My folks tell me it's because Gold Coast gives more comps away on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.  Not long after we were seated, our drink order was taken and then moments later our order.  The food is served family style and comes out when it's ready (which typically doesn't take long.)  Today we ordered lobster ($70), Cantonese Princess Chicken ($14.95), XO green string beans add cod fish ($16.95 - they charge $3 for XO and $5 for the fish), spinach with fermented bean curd ($8.95), and live scallops ($8).   The lobster was delicious and fresh cooked hong kong style which is sauteed in a ginger scallion sauce chopped in pieces you can easily remove it's shell.  (Pic added) They don't charge by the pound which is weird.  They just charge one flat rate cost.  This lobster was a good two pounds.  Delicious.  Traditional Chinese restaurants will serve their food whole - meaning everything from the head to the tail.  It's considered bad luck to not serve it whole.  This whole chicken is served cold which throws people off.  My friends have told me they'd like it more if it was served hot.  It comes with dried scallops and a ginger and oil dipping sauce which I find myself dunking my chicken in and mixing it with rice.  Yum.  The green string beans is alone $8.25, but I love XO sauce and to add some fresh cod to it was a no-brainer.  This was cooked to perfection with the green beans crisp and the fish was fresh and delicate texture. (Pic added)  The spinach was low in flavor for me.  My folks liked it but they would eat spinach simply steamed.  The spinach itself was fresh, they just didn't add enough "foo yee" and when I asked for extra (pic added) and when I tried to mix it with the spinach something wasn't right.  It's unfortunate as you can't reheat spinach very well so the left overs were wasted.  The live scallop comes on a shell with rice noodles.  It's a small portion of two pieces for $8.  My mom likes it but I've had better.  They also have razor clams for $10 for 4 pieces cooked in black bean sauce.  I was first introduced this gem in Hong Kong and the flavor is close here but I shouldn't really compare it when they literally just pulled it out of the water hours ago in HK.  Other items I would recommend is their ma po tofu, gobo beef, lamb with scallions, walnut prawns, and their singapore noodle but add extra curry.  They usually have a house soup they provide complimentary but they didn't today - or maybe we just didn't ask for it.  Sadly, if it wasn't that we come here so often and they know my parents, I think we wouldn't have such great service.  I feel for the people that have to keep flagging down their server or constantly have to ask for more tea or napkins.  I do believe the servers and busboys are trying - I think it's just engrained in our old school culture that this is the way it's suppose to be. sigh.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of fermented bean curd. Wasn&#39;t enough cooked with my veggies. Something was definitely wrong with this &#34;foo yee&#34; - sad face
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh green beans and cod in XO sauce. Perfectly cooked.
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Hong Kong style. Ginger and scallion sauce. $70 for about 2 pounds but varies and NOT priced by weight. Delicious!

J37eXblkq_CyauibuMCENQ.text: Chinese is not my favorite cuisine but my boyfriend is Cantonese and I agreed to go with him to one Chinese restaurant on our trip to Las Vegas. We visited Chinatown and this restaurant was recommended by a couple of ladies working in one of the stores. One of the ladies said the food is very fresh because it turns over quickly, unlike the restaurants in Chinatown. I do like fried rice and I ordered mine with shrimp and pork. It was actually very well made and delicious. We couldn't take leftovers home because we were traveling but I surprised myself and actually ate the whole thing! My boyfriend had fish rice soup and some other entrees and enjoyed it all.

37z9r7SQK73CYREKg1nhyg.text: Surprising that I haven't tried more dim sum places in Vegas but most of the ones I've considered had some nasty reviews that detered me from going.  Ping Pang Pong is in the Gold Coast casino so can use Boyd comps and points, which is a real plus.  The dim sum we tried, mostly picked by Jane K., were really good.  Not sure if hot mustard (standard in Hawaii) is available but most diners were using chili sauce instead.

BVrTlsHnPBRk2BpIaIxsrg.text: Located in the Gold Coast Casino, this place is pretty good.  Enjoyed a wonderful meal on New Year's Day.  Had dim sum and the food was hot and very good.  Not too keen on the chicken feet but the rest was very good.  In addition we ordered a Dungeness Crab dish.  Deep fried crab was a first for me and it was very good.  The red peppers on top were hot!  Service was great and we were seated within 5 minutes of arrival.  I have only been there once but heard it was recently renovated.  It looked very nice and had dividers between side tables giving you a chance to talk without being heard by other guests.  Try it!

zxIn1uxqGndviKFL8c636Q.text: Fabulous food, authentic, hot tasty and good selection. Were going to another restaurant for dinner when we were told to go here instead, by a local, that it was much better. Thank you sir......great food - best potstickers ever. Waitress added veggies to my garlic shrimp and scallops so that I didnt have to order another entree to get veggies!! Just incredible all the way around Will definitely be back to try more

qggcKjRkXQTVwzrXRoYkdg.text: I don't know what people are talking about with the service, but it was top notch. My husband I came here for dinner and had the Honey Walnut Prawns and the Mongolian Beef and it was great! Also had the pot stickers for an appetizer and they where huge! Could have just had those and I'd be full. Our glass of water was never empty, someone would always come by to refill it without us asking. The only thing is if you want white rice, it's extra 0.75 cents. Other than that, food was awesome! Will absolutely come back to try other dishes soon!

u2BkV_u7VBOEsFjOMWL5tA.text: It's like having a meal in China, without the flight! Picture yourself sitting at your table, while carts of dim sum are brought over for your selection. (Everything from dumplings, chicken wings, shrimp balls and chicken feet!) This isn't your Panda Express for sure. Their menu items all have definitive flavor profiles, nothing tastes like the other! Try the salt & pepper fish or even the salt & pepper frog legs! Honey walnut shrimp, Singapore noodles, spicy green beans are also among our favorites!  Go at off hours, otherwise you'll have to wait in line, as this place is really catching on!

5nJKQMjcT7I8t_hT59j0AQ.text: My husband and I waited for almost two hours. The food was really good! My husband love the egg tart and he thinks it's very nostalgic and it was like the ones he had in HK. The dim sum was really good. Would definitely recommend people to go there.

FKIIOaFguS_d32DkiyYBgg.text: Great Dim Sum. You want to get here early because there is a line to be seated. Food is really good and the staff is all very nice. Only complaint I have is the food that's not necessarily dim sum (calamari, fried rice) could be hotter.

DCHNc0KFLobvE37TcNFP_Q.text: Yummy food especially their dim sum! Great service, too! Our group had a great time! Will be back again.

XtEiu7dvTv5qLyriLnMEmQ.text: Has been great since renovation. The service has improved tremendously as well. Food is nice and hot again woohoo!

zarBFQiOym0HfBVPZ5IBOg.text: I had tried Chang before.... but never felt welome or appreciated here. Bygones.  I tossed a coin and decided to give Ping Pang Pong a shot!  Every ecpectation wa exceeded!  First of all.... it is inside the Gold Coast Resort....one of those festive place this the locals frequent. So much more exciting as you face the casino floor. Who wouldn't LOVE that?  Dim Sum is just served at lunch and I arrived two hours early. It waa full but not crowded.  This was the best part.... limited cart service that day ONLY. Poor pitiful little me had to only order the dim sum favorites I live for!  , hicken feet were the largest I had ever enjoyed! I poued the fatty juices over the sticky rice from the THREE huge banana leaf rolls.  The braised oxtails were almost bone free and fork tender. Honestly.... each of the 15 or so man hunks waa almost two inches across.  I wrapped up this unforgettable feast with the mango puddig. Not overly sweet and mouthfulls of tropical flavour.  I can not wait to get back in February!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky rice....they must have known I was hungry.
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail....GLORIOUS gelatinous oxtails. The fatty juices made it on the sticky rice!
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spick and span interior takes me to  Vietnam

Vw259_Q_JG-S588mrGAFtA.text: Very famous Chinese restaurant in Vegas, yet not impressed. The foods here is average, nothing special. Great to share with your friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KUCrfIWET5aQZugzhd0YJw.text: This is the best Chinese restaurant I've been to in the US. Everytime I come to Vegas I come here at least once. Food is great and so is the service. Everytime I come here. Prices are very reasonable as well. Not to be missed!

BWYSkiLtdaXvjOu4yBAD3A.text: We like to eat here occasionally when we are here to play bingo. It's good Chinese food, decent sized portions, but terrible terrible service.   Open late hours so when I've come here it has usually been on the later end of the evening. They pretty much have a very traditional Chinese dining menu, but a small bowl of white steamed rice is 50cents which I was surprised with all the entrees we were ordering we were not getting a free bowl of white rice.   Tonight we had the Kung Pao Chicken, Dry Beef Chow Fun, Salt and Pepper Pork, BBQ Pork Fried Rice, Gobo Beef, and seafood mixed Soft Noodles which probably is their fancy name version of lo mein. All the food actually was pretty good.  Kung Pao Chicken - I enjoyed how tender the chicken slices were, and the sauce for this particular dish was just right, right amount of spicy and right amount of sweetness to it.   Gobo Beef - probably my new favorite dish to order when coming to this restaurant. Small thick cut cubes of beef sirloin, every flavorful and savory taste of beef cubes. could be more on the tender side, but otherwise very tasty.  Beef Chow Fun - average tasting chow fun, a little on the oily side for my liking, but chow fun is my all time favorite chinese food dish, so I normally will order this entree at any chinese restaurant i'm eating at.   BBQ Pork fried rice - it was a little on the dry side for me, but I guess it's better to be dry than oily. nothing unique or special, pretty standard dish for fried rice  Salt and Pepper pork - a little too much on the salty side  seafood Mixed soft noodles - this name of the entree to me is in no doubt that it's their fancy name for lo mein, very standard display and style of cooking for the seafood lo mein look-alike,   their hot tea was very very good, but their service overall sucked and some people (the hostess) really have terrible and rude attitudes and I know the customer can sense and see it. slow service, and just overall even if they are understaffed, they dont have to be sour faced or rude about it.   3/5 for pretty standard okay food and terrible service :/

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow fun, gobo beef, salt and pepper pork, mixed seafood soft noodles (lo mein) and BBQ pork fried rice on the far rt side
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family style serving
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Location inside the Gold Coast casino

bIddGulpZpGMgLdwywBbnA.text: I seriously thought it was a racial joke when someone suggested Ping Pang Pong for dim sum lol it's located inside a casino. There was quite a long line already and we arrived before opening. However, the restaurant is rather small. Very stuffy place for the workers to roll the dim sum carts. Dim sum itself wasn't memorable. Not much to choose from either.

g6V4zwIbj7L0TbNi38GTYA.text: The food was ok. Not great but ok. The place is nice, we were seated by the kitchen. Looks clean and we're able to see them in action. The server, we didn't see her at all to check on us, pretty much got our order and brought it to us and that's it! No customer relationship or whatsoever! Maybe she's so busy!! The resto can be busy, we waited for like 10 mins to get seated which is not bad. Their walnut shrimp is good, noodles not bad. They have the sea bass and it was just ok. They have boba and some Thai tea which is cool. Their guava green tea was pretty good! But 2 stars because the customer service is not good and the food was ok.

mYahJ_ZiRRaPQNxFyQ9k7g.text: I waited 45 minutes only to be served broken shrimps dumplings.  The food was tasteless and barely any food to go around.  We ate for barely 30 minutes and left.  I ate 2 dishes of shrimp dumplings and porridge.  The decoration was nice as they relocated but I did not go there to look at decorations.  I would not return or recommend.  If you are looking for dim sum try the one at rio across from this place.  Much better but can get crowded also.

VQbeGitwvoXVSTFGy6N3Kg.text: We went in a large group on a Saturday for dim sum. I didn't like that the tables didn't have soy sauce or chili oil. I noticed that we also did not get all of the dim sum rotations either. For the place being so large, I would expect much more variety. There was no bean curd, no shrimp balls, no shrimp rice noodles. I think part of the hustle of dim sum is selling as much as you can. I also thing the card that they use to stamp leaves a lot of room for counting errors. It was just a blank space with stamps all over the place. When you have two tables of ten, it can  get very dense with stamps. The taste of the food was nothing beyond any dim sum place in my opinion. It tasted cleaner than some of the hole in the wall kind of places but I wouldn't visit again. Unfortunately, my aunt had dinner here the next night and what we ordered was okay. We orders a shrimp soup, walnut shrimp, crispy egg noodle, fried rice, duck combo dish, fish dish, etc. I didn't think the food was worth the hassle of driving to gold coast and walking through the very smoke filled casino. Of note, the roast pork tasted so incredibly stale and hard that I felt like it was leftover from dim sum.

cNkKCUOXoeD-tOSAcvRfOA.text: Dim sum on Halloween. Hooray!  Ping Pang Pong never disappoints. They have all the usual dim sum suspects plus a few of their own creations. The cart pushers are always friendly and patient.   The 2 of us came in thinking "Let's just drink some tea and grab a couple of plates to snack on."   9 plates later .. No ragrets! Haha what's done is done. The damage came to $45 for 2 people before tip. Pricier than the places not in casinos but so much tastier. They don't hold back adding special little touches that make all the difference  -Beef balls w/ Worschershrdshire sauce - small but packed with flavor and bits of scallions -Shu Mai - has tasty orange stuff on top. Could be fish eggs  -Rice noodle rolls - moist and the noodle thickness was perfect -Pork spare ribs - black bean oil sauce with chilis nomm -Roast pork - stamped on the ticket under "special" and it was! Crispy skin, moist on inside without too much fatty part  In my book nowhere else in Vegas compares when it comes to dim sum.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check for two hungry people
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky rice
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese broccoli

n3RjFR6SqqYvbVxh81YvCg.text: I went there excited to eat! I was seated and 10min later I was given a water.  For someone who does not speak Chinese this is the worst - no one could tell me what was what -and it also too me over 30min to be seated - also VERY unorganized! Also as a free bee - I just got sick. This was the only thing I ate all a day.....

3ANaQnf9QwR7KvUXDQNmJQ.text: I've tried this place twice now for dim sum and both times it was excel. The venue is small with lots of people so be prepared for a bit of a wait or arrive early! Great selections, freshly made, the cart ladies are not pushy with their plates and dishes. Overall great food and experience.

M96YZQijmv7RYX3AeCpefA.text: I not a huge fan of dim sum but I have had my share. Been to San Francisco, San Gabriel valley and Vegas and thought ping pang pong was the best. Alittle pricier than the hole in the walls in Chinatown but quality of the food you could taste. Get there early on the weekends to beat the long lines and get a players card for 10 percent off.

bR-XEqfidq6olp55wPv-yA.text: This is a great restaurant to have dim sum in the morning. Very original taste from china and fresh as well. Really recommend everyone to take a shot!

KfeLFdH_J-JSug4RG0b9Vg.text: My family used to come here almost every weekend, now when it comes up we need to ask ourselves if we are prepared to deal with what comes with dining there. The food is always cold and if you ask for fresh they act like they dont understand or they will microwave it and say its fresh. I enjoy the coconut rolls, there is 2 to an order but one is always an old one and you can tell because the paper is baked on the bottom of the old one. Again if you ask for fresh there is confusion. Now for this next problem im just going to say it like it is...the worst tables in the place usually go to the people who arent asian. If youve been here enough you know its True. Also there is no way to tell what you are being charged for they use a stamp system and its not even in english. So if you like paying 60 to 80 bucks for cold, old, reheated food and like being mistreated and ignored this is your place.

G4pZZLIssTd1Nhr7LY8low.text: Best place for Dim sum. Always has been and my family has been going to ping pang pong for years. Quality and taste of the dim sum is the best in town IMO. I love the recent remodel. And seems like the customer service has gotten better too.

z8VL-HQKF19o03HBUlwLPw.text: I got to eat free dim sum two times while staying at the Gold Coast so I figured I would write a review of this place.  The food here is good.  I especially liked the shrimp balls on the bamboo sticks.  Choy sum with garlic was also good but the plate of choy sum was huge and I couldn't eat all of it. ( Good problem)  I thought it was funny they charge 50 cents for hot tea but I wasn't paying so i didn't care.  I had a soup with beef and mushrooms I think it was ok but the mushrooms tasted weird.  Egg rolls and charsui ba was good.  Service was soso, normal Chinese restaurant where they are pushy and can't understand how much your bill is until the end of the meal.  Overall good and I would go again if I have a comp again at the gold coast.

Le8AC48savSioBxQgb9daA.text: So I tried this place twice.... the first time I tried the food -  my brother and mom got take out for my dad and I for a late night snack - we had a bowl of Preserved Egg and Pork Porridge and a bowl of Wonton Noodle Soup. The porridge was okay - it was actually kind of bland and I wish I had salt. The Wonton soup was not any better - the noodles were stuck together and the wonton was also very bland.   So even after trying the food here and knowing its not that good- why would I come back again? Well my dad didn't think it was so bad so the next day he wanted to order the same thing - I really didn't want to but he insisted he wanted to eat porridge - so this time we went to order it for take out again.  This time I experienced the service -- and it was ridiculous - took 45 minutes for two dishes...on top of that the waitress was very unfriendly. The chef didn't even remember to make the porridge until I asked the waitress three times after 30 minutes - and she finally asked the chef - which was just standing around - to make it. It took him less than 5 minutes to make it but I waited 45 minutes for it. Then after that I asked her for an extra spoon and she didn't even want to give it. On top  Definitely not a place I want to go back to. Both the food I tried and the service I experienced was pretty bad. On top of that they were pretty expensive.

ka4Qq6y8KkfIb6K8cOSwbQ.text: Didn't want even leave 1 star- called earlier in the day to make reservations & said I didn't need one. Stood in line for an hour with parties in front of us (which were not happy either) Eventually gave up and ate elsewhere.

eW7-oDRO6Yl56UdBi1-aBg.text: I surprised my family by taking them here and pigging out at this dim sum place that I had discovered on my last trip.  The dim sum is surprisingly good and they have most of the stuff that we are familiar with whenever we go...  They charge 50 cents per person for tea which is what a lot of places do but I still consider that outrageous since I'm old school and such a practice was never used (*sigh*)...  Although it's not Alhambra/Monterey Park cheap, (2) $2.18 for dim sum type A, (11) $2.88 for dim sum type B, (4) $3.88 for dim sum type C, and $5.88 for (1) dim sum type D plus the $2 for tea still came out to be less than $60 -- A REAL BARGAIN considering where we are...  We were stuffed and happy for our return trip back to LA.  I would come back again...

Sk_M5ejbaG0Y9pu7h_khRQ.text: In all my years of coming to Las Vegas I never knew really good and authentic Chinese food even existed here. Like others have mentioned, this certainly is a hidden gem.  A couple of friends attending the jewelry trade show at the Mandalay had invited me to a nice quiet high end dinner at the Jasmine Restaurant at the Bellagio when , just as we were about to leave for the Bellagio, my friend received a business call saying their business contacts wanted to invite us for dinner instead.....and were too afraid to decline. All I knew was that I was asked to get in the car and just follow the leader.  Being the fish out of water, I didn't speak a or understand a word of Chinese and had no idea what the plan was. We eventually ended up off the strip at some big stand alone casino across from the Palms Hotel and Casino. As we walked into the casino from the parking garage, my friend whispered to me that the host was taking us to a Chinese restaurant, and if she eats hear you can bet it's going to be VERY good! The host has been living in Vegas for over 30 years so she should know where all the good eating spots are now.....ok, so in we go. This was a medium end casino, and as we walked through it we finally came upon this Chinese Restaurant called "Ping Pang Pong"..... yes, you got that right....just as I've spelled it. Flashbacks of the movie "16 Candles" flashed through my head, but I'll leave that one alone :)  Tucked inside the casino is this very casual, very Chinese looking, restaurant with an open kitchen concept where you can hear the burners blasting away and the woks clanging away. The place was quite crowded, but it appeared our host knew everybody there and I was told she is a VIP guest there. We came to the table and there sat 4 other of her elderly friends already seating and waiting for us. Oh boy.....there goes my hopes for a peaceful and relaxing dinner. Ok, lets cut it short and say that it was a very typical large table seating for a group of elderly folk who enjoyed their meals with loud talk.....the red wine they were gulping down didn't seem to help matters either. Anyway, I did not understand a single word spoken at the table all night, but no worries.....I had food to keep me busy!......good authentic Chinese food at that! And note, when I say this is authentic food, I mean authentic.....PF Chang's and Panda Express are NOT authentic :P  I pretty much left the ordering to the host and her friends since they seemed to know what good Chinese food should taste like. Needless to say they ordered all very authentic dishes that westerners likely wouldn't have known how to order. Without going into too much detail about each dish.....because I really can't remember the names of each one......we started off with lotus root soup which was very good....absolutely delicious, and coincidentally is my favorite Chinese soup! There was a roast duck dish, lotus root stir fried with celery and rice wine sauce, egg white fried rice with dried scallops, stir fried cubes of beef with a dark brown sauce, ginger and scallion lobster over noodles, farm raised chicken cooked with chestnuts and rice wine, some green vegetables with baby abalone and sauce, sea bass steamed with black beans, ............and I think that was it. It was ALL yummy, and I was really surprised at finding this quality and standard of Chinese food all the way out here! But yes, it exists. Yay! :)  All these delicious dishes for 9 people came to about $295 before tips, which was actually pretty good given the excellent quality of the food. If I should ever find several friends who'll join me for a good Chinese meal during future visits, I will definitely bring them here!

4Y4LLQax3tP_WoO6S8BbQA.text: So the service was bad for a half-full restaurant but he food quality was #1 in Vegas.  I recommend to those want good food and can tolerate the poor service.

mshaZ6nhF-B6_fE5qo1MEg.text: This place was packed for dim sum on a Friday morning. I thought the price for average for dim sum, nothing too expensive and meets LA price standards. I read someone else's comments about expensive dim sum, it was about 2.50 a bin. They have a good selection and you can order other foods too. I would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $29 total excluding tip

cpbRpCTR-LXxb5Ogxy9Peg.text: I am extremely picky with Chinese food and this place definitely meet all expectations! I've taken so many people here every time I'm in Vegas and this is the place I constantly try to visit when I'm in town! Their seafood is so fresh, their preps fresh and their dim sum offers a great variety! We all love having choices. I've eaten at the restaurant before and I've also taken it out. Both options great at this place.

4rzsthuzzPwnOYL4q0tc8w.text: New location is great...the line is long . But we're lucky to have EMERALD status friends so didn't have to wait and everything was delicious.

L5PAHiziSPdRWK_rLY939w.text: Five stars go out to the Manager Krysty. She was very professional and very customer service oriented. This is one of our favorite Places to eat. Food is always fresh and full flavored. We had a bit of a mixed up with our food and a delay took place but she fixed the problem and was very apologetic and wanted to make sure we were taken care of. She is amazing!

t--jKjKX4dSUCXFPwYqbYA.text: The Dim Sum is awesome here. I had 6 people in my party and everyone loved the food. The tripe cooked in the red sauce was out of this world. I highly recommend going to this hidden gem tucked away in the Gold Coast Casino.  If you want to be adventurous try the Chicken Feet.I tend not to order this stuff at the normal Dim Sum place, I usually get grossed out by claws still being a attached to the feat. But Ping Pang Pong cleans there Chicken Feet really well no toe nails. LoL. The Chicken Feet connoisseurs I was with swear this was the best feat they ever had.

J6yY1PlWOqAcvPdUeZyFFg.text: Despite the over-the-top cheesy name, the food is delicious! We ordered the shiimai dumpling, chicken feet, clams, and salt and pepper pork. Everything was GREAT and we cleared every plate! It's off of the strip and you have to take a cab to get to the dingy casino it's in, but it's well worth it. The service sucks but the food was so good that  I couldn't even be mad. Best part is that it's open till 3am so you can get your drunk-Chinese-food on!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shumai! Must order!!!
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams in black bean sauce.

ZDsrrLFIW4dmMVl0UOSroA.text: This is our family spot for dim sum. It's delicious and they have the most selection of dim sum. The pudding dessert is a must to finish my meal. You have to get there early or there is always a wait.

PZnsR5X1VtgLuqV6JXDTcA.text: This was some great Dim Sum! Everything was fresh, hot and delicious. Service was gracious as well as polite. We didn't have one bad dish. My biggest complaint? Because we arrived so early, they seemed to only have desserts ready & those kept coming around quite readily in the beginning. They didn't seem to start bringing out the savory dishes til about 15-20 minutes after they opened. My recommendations? If you arrive early, be patient & wait about 20 minutes til the dishes really start coming out. If not, then show up about 30 minutes after they open, just be prepared to wait. The challenge? Their Servers are all Chinese, which is great, however with all of the noise, hearing them through the noise & their accents was a challenge. Definitely a go to spot from now on!

D6-JGseLZ-3XkuVDOnHdyQ.text: Went to visit family in Vegas and we decided to give a try. And highly recommended! Food was delicious! Service and time to get our food was fast.  The portions were just right & precis was reasonable. Recommended to give it a try and your stomach will be happy!

Kbd-ym-dXGaoR9J8H-RxeA.text: Came here with my classmates during a break we had between our mental health meetings we had to attend. The place was pretty packed and if one of my friends weren't bossy or the other one didn't speak Chinese I feel like we would've been more ignored. But we were seated right away and at first the carts kept passing us by. We all were confused and kept saying hello we want some foods from there. Not until our friend spoke in Chinese did these ladies with the carts come by and were nice to us.   The food was good and cheaper than any other dim sum place I've ever been to in Vegas. We all paid $7 plus tip which wasn't too bad.   We were on a time crunch so we had to quickly get out of there but they didn't feel our urgency even as my friend got up several times to let them know we needed the check.   I'm not sure I want to come here without someone who speaks Chinese in peak hour. Maybe one day I'll be brave and have my parents come try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DTCwviSeK-3lxJgWujtVbw.text: Nothing wow but good enough for fast descent dim sum. Service is ok . There is usually a long wait line so heads up on that. I still love how they have the carts with all diff dim sum to pick on. 3 Star.

MQOsSuoogh9GUFiXdk4mLw.text: I like the food here, even though it's a bit more expensive than the places off strip. Understandable though. At times (weekends) the wait can be frustrating, but it's worth it. The quality of the food is... thumbs up!

c3DPXqVnOL2qcrJB-FGrRg.text: Horrible service. Dont bother if you are getting food by yourself. The table of 3 adjacent to me ordered their food after me and ate half of their meal before my chicken came out from the kitchen. I had to have 4 different servers/hostess take my order, bring my food, bring a check, and take my card. No question that nobody wanted the table of 1.  Didnt much care about how the food tasted by this point. Shame as I heard good things about the place.

nVzQqtdd5pp6IJaJmLO8dw.text: Highly disappointing experience. Everything was overpriced for the portions, the food was bland, and the service was reprehensible. Our arrival to collect a $70.00 order tonight was barely met with an eyebrow until the hostess snapped that our food wasn't done yet, 20 minutes past the promised time. As far as the taste, I've experienced more flavor watching a Charles Grodin talk show. The spare ribs, Wonton soup, lamb chops were hopelessly absent of any sort of redeeming flavor. Will not return.

NconPnWbzgmN2KU-Dt7nWg.text: I ordered to go last night. Then I sat by the door waiting for my order. I waited for 47mins from 5:13 to 6:00 clock. Another customer who order to go also waited there. We were both in front of the front desk.It was so long never happened in my life. The girl who work at the front desk passed us like 10 time.Never been taken care of.After all we saw our orders were behind the front dest. We shocked.Why don't they tell us. We literally just in front of them. The other guy complained a lot in politely way. When he got his order he even said thank you twice. But we got 0 sorry.As a Chinese I felt shame.SHAME ON YOU! People who work there.Never been there again.  47,640     ,  ......

ojB25hNjciaUy7h7_QU9zA.text: The food here is below average. And the service here really sucks. I was visiting Vegas from Cali... the food here is so bad compared to all the Chinese food we have in Cali. Skip this place not worth the money. The food was very bland and plain. The service was extremely bad. The dim sum cat never reach us. We try to order with the waitress but she said we will have to wait for the cart. We complained that we waited 30 mins not even one dim sum cart came this way. They just said wait... so it took us an hour and half just to get food.

dfkBTzlRM11rLvh_I5pslA.text: Although the availability of good dim sum in Las Vegas is severely lacking, I may have found a good substitute when I tried Ping Pang Pong this past weekend. Located in the Gold Coast Casino, I never thought I would find something close to decent within a casino. I wouldn't go too much off the fact that the casino boasts this place as one of the top 10 Chinese restaurants in Travel + Leisure magazine, but fresh off a remodel and redesign this past summer, the decor and location are nice enough to attract hotel patrons, and the food is authentic enough to attract locals.   Dim sum service runs from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm, but the carts start tapering off towards the end. They have all the usual classics such as siu mai, chicken feet, BBQ pork buns, and har gow. Although they started running out of some dishes, we asked the manager if we could order the fried crab claws shrimp ball and she got the chef to fry up a fresh batch, just for us. I was pretty happy with that and the service in general. Prices range based on categories of food (A): $2.18 (B): 3.18 (C): $3.88 (D): $5.88. It was pretty affordable for a place that looks much nicer than Yum Cha on Tropicana. The wait time for a table on a Sunday was roughly 10 minutes.

GRE45B-ojsHUwTSSGh9Eyg.text: Dim Sum on a Sunday Morning in Vegas?  Sure why not.  We've been to other places and wanted to give this place a try.    We were seated by the kitchen area where the food comes out however they keep missing us until the end of their rounds.  It seemed like their pathway needs to be improved somehow.    There were good selections and the food is mediocre.  I'll still come and eat here if I'm in the area.

544B80YpW8TXm4FdbMEHJg.text: Food was good to above average. Walnut prawns, Mongolian Beef and Sweet and Sour Pork were all terrific. Chicken Chow Mein was a little off the mark. Portions are good sized and price is reasonable.  Service is a bit of an issue. Had to wait a long time for drinks and refills. Also, food did not arrive together. Had to ask where two of our dishes were.  Still overall a good experience, will go again if there is an opportunity.

Yse2QwOrak3AA1pGYFCdUQ.text: Best Vegas dim sum! I absolutely love this place. It makes me feel right at home. This is a definite visit if you're in the mood for some good dim sum.

YzY5NOWrGdSnsWYfYrtp8w.text: My go to for siomai and yang chow fried rice.. but they have more than just dimsum to offer.. my husband absolutely loves the braised chicken feet..

ZpfBKamhTvGlZl9dXDdmgA.text: Came here for Chinese New Year dinner and it was NOT good! Waited in line for 40 minutes. Food was not delicately made. Taste of all my dishes were missing something. I ordered sticky rice with Chinese sausage which was decent but my Shanghai noodles were disgusting. They used skinny noodles which is not the correct type and the taste was off. The potstickers skin were super thick and tasted wrong. My black bean fish dish was mediocre. Overall poor experience. Probably will stick to this restaurant for only dim sum it at all.

MIiuT0FDAY4sYUZ1hSX7Bw.text: Have to confess, I wasn't expecting much from this place and its goofy name, not to mention it's in a casino. But it was actually really good dinner food. Our relatives brought us takeout from this place and it was pretty amazing.   Recommendations:  Chive and shrimp cake -- surprisingly crisp and fresh with plenty of shrimp.  Crispy shrimp stuffed chicken -- this was amazing. While it feels a bit like Americanized Chinese food, the meat was tender and had a light coating with a sweet garlic-based sauce and sesame seeds Night market Fried Rice -- Strong basil flavor, tomato based sauce. Unique and definitely different from any fried rice I've had. Yu Hong (Yu xiang) Eggplant -- pretty typical rendition of this sweet and sour eggplant dish, nothing too unusual...  this dish needs white rice on the side.   Cons:  Based on the menu, it's on the pricey side for what it is.   Can't say anything about the service or the dining experience since I wasn't actually there but the food was definitely excellent.

hXYaeb1y9GmDhqOoeyaKDQ.text: UPDATE:  Did they change their dim sum chef?  These past three times (May, June, and December) we were here, we can really taste the difference.  Not only is the food cold, it is bland and soggy.    I am going to agree to a previous review, they are terrible when it comes to the line.  They really need a better system.   Also, their price appears reasonable, but they switched up their dishes to a higher status.  HARDLY anything is an "A Dish."    This is NO longer my favorite dim sum place in Vegas.

DFfj6k6UqBeJFaVx2hxWnQ.text: New location inside the Gold Coast. I came in the evening at 915pm to see if they had dim sum all day. They don't. You have to order from a menu I assume after normal dim sum hours. I came for dim sum because I am at a conference for work and miss the normal dim sum window of opportunity. I ordered from the limited menu. The shu mai seems like it want hand made. Like it was store bought. Ordered Chinese sausage buns and they were as I recall. The baked cha su bao was like a dessert. Weird. Like an almond cookie was around the bbq pork. Not enough meat.   My old review at the old spot in here was a 5 tonight.....3. Sorry not impressed. It is kinda cool they have a boba bar in here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weird baked bao and my yummy Chinese sausage

hOn2wIm5Fx-yvGQolef7YQ.text: My favorite dim sum place in Vegas! Fresh, tasty, and full of variety. Their price and portions is on point. My only complaint is that they really have bad service. Waiters and waitresses are all unfriendly. I probably been here like 30 plus times and their service haven't improve at all. They're lucky that they have great foods!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum

4i8i4Z_nDZkVV5DurUVetA.text: Absolutely Delicious  ...Definently will be back. One of our new favorite places. Great Food, Great Staff, and Service.

CDaQ9qIy1GMhBtGfJMVxog.text: The noodle and the chicken was partly cold. And the bum is partly hard partly soft. It looks like it's brought from a Chinese's market and microwaved it. It is unacceptably. And they even include tips already. Like wtf.. your food is cold and how dare you to just put the tip without telling me.

BsqwBRAnVD3zb3XGv5qQyA.text: Real slow service, we were the first one in line and to order but 10 people got their food before ours, staff didn't really care... food was nothing special

ThvCO2SPfj35d2gON1CDAw.text: Love the upgrade, last time I was there it was small and plain, but good was delicious. Now along with the awesome food a beautiful atmosphere and great and friendly staff.

dQM2w2RAFVk8XDpNFUybrQ.text: This place is fast, delicious and consistent. For the price increase that happened last year, I suppose it's due to demand and well justified. They are always busy but it's worth the wait. This is a well oiled machine

oo3AxfFJzbzL8KxUk721Ug.text: Best dim sum in Las Vegas! The quality reminded me of New York city... which I haven't seen out here in the West. Carts are rolling around with so many choices to be made from them. I highly recommend!

d85BXMCm8n5qcDyVZza8aA.text: I took my parents and son after reading Best of Las Vegas report. Wow!!! Delicious!! I don't eat duck but my son insisted on trying it...moist and tender. Best Dim Sum...couldn't try everything need to go again. The noodles very flavorful. And their sweet tofu...mmmmust. It was pretty busy but the service was excellent. We are going back!!

JIxLvKLynx9iaiQMG8uhqg.text: We had a great experience for dim sum on a Saturday morning.  The carts came around quickly and had a great variety.  There was never a moment when the carts weren't making their way past us.  I was concerned about some of the low star reviews, but our group had a five star experience. Great atmosphere, food, and service.  I can't wait to go back.

7hvicGsZDOI-a1lKR1EJUA.text: This place easily has the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. I have heard good things about the food here, & my expectations were high.   So me & my family arrive, we were brought in. Not sure what to expect being my first time @ this place (may I add how I was excited & actually having a celebration lunch) & immediately they were wheeling around appetizers asking tables what they would like. So confused on how things work here , mainly because nobody told me. Several times I asked for entrees and each time they told me they had no more.   Never once was I presented a menu, so I literally had a appetizer lunch with no menu  at all, I have never felt so bamboozled & unsatisfied in Chinese food history. LET ME TELL YOU, a bad review from me is very rare, as a matter a fact? This is my first! I hate this place now & I will never recommend this terrible customer service to anybody.   Also, the manager at the time still wanted me to pay the full price for all the crappy little appetizers that were basically forced upon me. I tried to explain my dissatisfaction & how un pleased I was with never receiving a menu, & she told me the customer is suppose to ask for one!! Where do they do that at!? So I'm automatically suppose to know how procedure goes at this restaurant being my first time there!? Bull crap!!! Never again!! Actually , I'm discrediting this restaurant every chance I get in the future, their mistake for the bs service because I have a great network of people to spread a huge word. Ok, rant over. Screw you PING PANG PONG

4BgJVGJQPVF_4KcY0dZ5Bw.text: I been here a few times, the fried rice is so good along with the eels and abalone. These are excellent dishes if you into seafood. The bak Choy is very fresh. This has been the go to place for me since they open.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live eels.

QX4JVSETOnBsJUOcsCNPvA.text: Newly remodeled lobby...menu is still wonderful! Ginger mushroom chicken claypot, ox tail, salt and pepper pork chops. Again,  if you don't know or ENJOY authentic C H I N E S E food as in mainland China... don't come here b/c you will be disappointed. Broccoli beef, orange chicken, egg rolls no!  not here go to Panda for that. Otherwise, sit back and enjoy the trip without the airfair.

lcOPldQLKdipyvdtJzG_-w.text: The food has become quite mediocre.  The prices have increased about 20% and the service sucks.   I'm primarily giving them one star because of one particular employee.  I phoned in a takeout order of Singapore noodles.  They were not very good.   I show up 25 minutes after placing order.  The idiot cashier says its not ready yet and asks me to pay now.  I give her a $20 bill and she gives me back $5 & 99 cents in change.  The bill was $14.02.  In the real world and especially the restaurant industry you never hand back 99 cents in change. (It should've been 98 cents). Its a big insult, especially in a business that does such volume.  So here I am to publicly shame this very rude and unintelligent employee.  I think its a greedy cultural thing however we're in the US. In Europe they round to nearest 5 cents.  All principle here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $14.02 takeout bill. Hands me $5 and 99 cents in change. Employees like this are bad for business

nv2Kgoylay_oH3CHs8K-fw.text: we have been coming here since moving from nyc in 93.  we feel its one of the better chinese restaurant here in town.  the food is authentic and fresh. The new dining room is able to accommodate more customers so the wait time is not too long as it used to be in the old setting.  we had dim sum a few days ago and found it to be quite gd the dim sum was warm and fresh.   The servers were all very helpful.  It is the place to have dim sum

htHRr9bzdfsDtTp82TJlVw.text: Ping Pang Pong is has some of the best dim sum in Vegas. But if you're coming for a trip from LA, I would reschedule dim sum for a weekend back at home. The food here is delicious, but the place is small and cannot accommodate everyone that tries to come. If you are determined to visit, the line moves at a snail's pace, and you can expect at least a 45 min wait on Sunday morning.  That being said, they offer the dim sum staples, and execute them well: shumai, shrimp ha gow, cha shu buns, etc. It's a great treat if you are willing to brave the painful wait times.

otwYKGRInHy2JCTCuqGSRw.text: This is a great spot for dim sum. All the familiar dishes, plus some I have not seen. Good to fu fa, delicious steamed brown rice cake. Fantastic tofu with shrimp and my husband enjoyed the Singapore noodles. Everything was fresh. A favourite of ours in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mjjhv-lpU-eyXd-fniZhDg.text: The good is amazing, the service sucks.  It's really hard to understand the staff.  The dim sum is awesome, we also had chow main noodles, that were good. I especially love the walnut shrimp, it's the best!!! The wonton soup was amazing! Definitely one of the better Chinese places in Vegas.  A must try if you are i town!

Mg9ZjGF0d5YZ0eIwTAFrkQ.text: Food is good, serving is proportional but i find it still  Expensive. Service was fast though they were busy, they have alot of staff. The staff in general are not attentive to your needs, not friendly. We literally have to chase the host to give us our seats when we were just right in front of her. She didn't greet us, didn't even smile, like what the typical host would do. Server didn't bother to visit us if we need anything or ask us how the food was. Place was clean, says in front they're grade A. Except the host area's shelves have cluttered stuff in it.   Our cheque is already on our table yet we were not done yet, i feel rushed because they're starting to get busy.   Will go back again because of the food but hoping to experience good customer service

2m_GP27JcgHa9iIt7a8RaQ.text: One of the best Chinese dim sum but the price is out of control. 4 people $138 not including tips yet.  We didn't even eat that much.

KwuJ-ZdJYtDggeVOyvO10g.text: Review 30 for 2017!  Did someone say dim sum inside of a casino?! Weird right, but this one is worth a try! It's located off the strip at a casino called Gold Coast, but the drive isn't too far. A parking structure was available so plenty of free parking is provided. When we arrived around 11AM, the wait wasn't long. There were only a couple parties in line. But when we finished, the line was filled with people waiting to eat. So make sure you arrive early!   I'm that person who can eat dim sum anytime and everyday. So seeing all these carts made me happy! The wait for each one to come around was quick. The restaurant is divided into two sections with ten tables at most. Some of my favorites were the BBQ pork buns, the shrimp ha cao and the egg tarts. I especially liked the crust on them because they were flaky! At other dim sum places, it's usually like a pie crust and I'm not a fan of pie.   Service here is pretty good. The server always came around just in time to refill our drinks! Our bill for four people came out to be about $80 including tip which isn't too bad.   Overall verdict: I'll be back!

HL1l67XaIY22wi5LB0b4HQ.text: It's located towards the middle of the Gold Coast Casino towards the back wall. We came at about 2 pm on a Monday (Memorial Day) and there was still a long line (about 15 minutes). Get here early, they close at 3, but it looks like they stop making fresh dim sum at 2 pm. The carts had slim pickings and a lot of things they didn't have anymore, such as the shrimp noodle rolls.   I knocked a star off for the bad service here. The service was extremely slow and rude. After we were seated, no one introduced themselves to us as our server, so we didn't even know who our server was the entire time. Our drink order wasn't taken and tea wasn't brought to us until about 15 minutes after being seated and us having to flag someone down. They don't refill drinks here and they never made eye contact, so I was constantly waving my hand in the air to call someone, anyone over.   Surprisingly, most of the dim sum here was great!   BBQ pork buns - We loved the bbq pork buns, they make a great one here. The moist fluffy bao buns (the white ones that look like clouds) were stuffed generously with moist and tender bbq pork. 5/5  Chicken Feet - whoever butchered the feet, didn't do a good job and there were tiny shards of bone throughout. My boyfriend almost swallowed a couple of small shards. 1/5  Shumai (pork dumpling) - small, but they were moist, flavorful and had a nice texture. 5/5  Har gow (clear shrimp dumpling) - these were also small, but I loved these! Great flavor on the shrimp filling and the clear wrapping was delicate and had a perfect texture. We ordered 2 rounds of them. 5/5  Fried shrimp patty on sugar cane - comes with a sweet mayo sauce. The shrimp ball was very flavorful and went perfect with the mayo sauce. 5/5  Shrimp and vegetable meatball coated in sticky rice - I didn't like the doughy sticky rice on the outside. Also the filling's texture was odd with the soft shrimp ball and chewy bits of vegetable. 1/5  We also ordered a plate of stir fried beef chow mein noodles because we were all still hungry and they barely had anymore dim sum by 2:30 pm. The chow mein noodles were really bland. The beef was tender, but we all couldn't get past on the taste of the chow mein, it was lacking so much! 1/5  Come early, stick with the dim sum and you're golden.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place clears out quick! It&#39;s not even 3 yet but it&#39;s dead. Possibly because they stop making fresh dim sum at 2
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry and crazy bland beef chow mein from their normal menu - don&#39;t order it, stick with the dim sum
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 orders of shrimp har gao! I really enjoyed them, they were flavorful and the clear wrapping was tender and had great texture

y6cfIFvDTa03vchyWHAssQ.text: This place has the best dim sum we've tried since we've been in Vegas. Several of our friends recommended it and we were happy to oblige. Not to mention, it's right down the street from our home. It's best to go during lunch as they serve up all the best dim sum dishes. The prices are pretty good too. For two of us we spent less than $50 with tip included. Not bad for 8 dim sum dishes. I would recommend the steamed char siu bao, shrimp dumplings, shu mai, choy sum, and walnut shrimp. All the fried rice I've tried here has been good so take your pick.   This place is usually packed all the time so be prepared to wait or go early to get a good place in line. Service can sometimes be lacking as they seem to not have enough servers who can take your order. Many of the workers do not speak English and therefore will not take orders from customers.

m5FL_yN4wPZwFjaOvR42-A.text: The food taste great. Love the steam fish. Staff are friendly. They open late at night.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yw_CG3Fj0a74-y70I0e5SA.text: I really don't know if the name of this restaurant is catchy or annoying???  I'll let you decide that.  If you have been to Gold Coast in the past couple years, you'll find that the casino has been trying to attract more and more Chinese tourists.  With Ping Pang Pong, they are able to offer the locals as well as the visitors a taste of the mother land.  That means this place serves authentic Chinese food.  We thought the amount of food for the price paid was not equal; however, even to us Asians the food was quite tasty.

V6CI9KF1kaBrnW9O9U7h4Q.text: Here's the story-- I was in Vegas at a trade show, a colleague had this place recommended to him as 'great Chinese' so we agreed to try it for dinner. I had the opportunity to check out the Yelp reviews beforehand, so I could see that the general consensus was: don't come weekdays, come weekends for dim sum. We came on a Monday night. I'm a somewhat adventurous eater, so I figured, what the heck.  Bad idea. I have to say--- probably the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. And I'm a very forgiving person. So I DEFINITELY do not recommend coming for dinner on a weeknight. You can decide for yourself if you want to take the chance that it's so much better on weekends as others have noted.  The story: 3 of us got there about 8, the place was maybe 3/4 full during our visit. We ordered 3 dim sum plates for appetizers. These eventually came out, one at a time, about 15 minutes apart. The dim sum was really tasty, but the slow delivery was a bad omen.  Waitress eventually came back to take our entree orders. Colleague #1 got his entree approx. 30 minutes later. Colleague #2 got his entree approx. 30 minutes after colleague #1. Colleague #3 (me) got his entree approx. 30 minutes after colleague #2.  And I had ordered tofu!! During this hour and a half wait, we asked the waitress several times about our order, and she wandered off and came back with various excuses each time. It was clear the kitchen had forgetten entirely about my order. But even from the time they realized they had forgetten me, it STILL took at least 30 minutes to get the food out to our table.  Horrible. And just to make the night memorable for all, my colleague #2, who had ordered a scallop dish, came down with food poisoning that night which stuck with him for the next several days.  Oh, and if you haven't been to the Gold Coast before-- it's a dump.

ezrPRjy_7bYBBOXSd5kQxw.text: My comments are pretty much the same as everyone elses - excellent food... slow, methodical service. Take a patience pill and you will have an excellent meal

npWrqzGfJVUD1dGgYVwEUg.text: Went there on Fourth of July weekend and saw this place during my last visit in December but didn't try it then.  This time there was five of us and it was kinda late so was really glad to hear this place is open till 3am on weekends. We were sat within five minutes of arriving and waiter took our drink orders.  She was really quiet at times but really quick.  The menu has a good amount of choices.  My recommendations is get a bowl of soup as an appetizer.  A friend who like asian spots told me once to try start off with one of the soups on the menu.   If the soup is good, then the rest of the food will be good.  We decided to try a soup that had big chunks of pork and asian veggies with had an amazing broth. When it came time to order, we decided to get a bunch off dishes and try a little of each item.  Out of each item, I recommend trying the walnut prawns.  They are amazing!!! My brother enjoyed the roasted duck. The place has a nice appearance and its full of Asians coming with large groups.  The table next to us was complaining about something on the order so there was a lot of arguing in Chinese, I think.  I can't wait to come back and get those walnut prawns!!  Heard they have dim sum during the lunch hours so gonna have to try that some time as well.

bYksQMEZ2kto5IJQcJpvjQ.text: I had dimsum at Ping Pang Pong in Gold Coast Casino on Sunday 12/28/08. I was with a party of five adults and one child. We arrived at 11am and was seated at 11:40am even with our Emerald card, which gives us priority seating. Many people were in line and some just went to the front of the line to talk to the hostess. Most were confused as to which line to get in. Make sure you give your name and the number in your party to the hostess; she will then give you a piece of paper with a number that she will eventually call out. Most of the people were inpatient and kept going to the hostess and asking her questions. There were several who looked through the reservation book when the hostess stepped away. It was definitely crowded and as soon as we sat down, we started eating.  The food was great! We had the seaweed salad, BBQ pork noodles, shrimp noodles, pork dumpling, shrimp dumpling, spring rolls, crab balls, spare ribs, BBQ pork buns, BBQ pork pastries, Chinese broccoli, chicken wings, sausage in a bun, potstickers, sesame balls - the usual dishes that we order when we have dimsum. What we couldn't believe was the bill! It was $110 for five adults and one child! Then, I looked over the bill and noticed that they charged us twice for the Chinese broccoli ($8.95 twice!). They did correct the bill, but then we started to question whether the rest of the bill was correct. They charged us for 23 dimsum plates, but we didn't keep track and count our plates! They could have easily charged us an extra 2-3 plates and we wouldn't have known it. As regular dimsum customers, with a party of five to ten people that we usually have, we would pay any where from $10 to $15 per person at the most, including tip! But at Ping Pang Pong, we had to pay about $20 per person! Even though the dimsum was good, the higher price is not worth the wait! Next time, we'll go to Chang's or Orchid's.

W4PnPNgT3fG1mUq0KilTpQ.text: Tried the soup of the day (dry veggie soup), just like my ma's. The rice in clay pot dish is like how they make in Hong kong. Will be back for more

wT5uLtE3cudo9ObZXy-pLw.text: True Dim-Sum that I highly recommend when you visit Sin City. You know it's authentic when the place is filled with Asians. The dishes from the menu are excellent too! Can't wait 'til my next visit!

LQUtreMkS4_JH2yaVesPZA.text: Do not let the location fool you! Ping Pang Pong is a hidden gem. The dim sum was some of the best I have had outside of HK. The service was friendly and everything was very fresh and expertly cooked. Be sure to try the lor bak go and the beef cheung fun. Outstanding!

ZqwHX5DBz6h00CYeJ67Fww.text: My absoulte fave chinese restaurant is Sam Woo in Alahambra Ca, i give that restaurant 10 out of 10 in terms of taste, as I dont live there i have been hard pressed to find a good chinese restaurant  in Vegas, i went to PPP only cause i had a coupon, i will say the dim sum is good, but way overpriced, , today i ordered off the menu and was dissapointed the food just tastes average at best, out of 10 stars for tatse, i would give it 3.5, it will be a looong time before i return.

kQqcrAHloL2m0d46QMKDFA.text: Let's go to PING PANG PONG! Who would have thought this place is so good! This is seriously one of the hidden gems in vegas.  It's tucked in Gold Coast and it has really good dim sum.  They have the dessert - mango + pomelo which is so hard to find.  This is pure comfort food in vegas.  I love it!!!! It's clean and the decor is really nice.

4ZAd142rKZMh2p0ZPhhOwQ.text: Food was very good. Much more traditional than typical chinese take out places. Some very interesting menu options.  Big portions.

PIfDEu69dwcEDyvtvF-eWA.text: With many of the good reviews I found prior to visiting Ping Pang Pong, I was severely disappointed.  Upon arrival, the long wait, approx 25 min, led me think that this was some place good.  All the good places have lines right?  There were also many other Chinese and other Asian people there which would also be another indicator.  When I sat down and started getting food, I was a bit disappointed.  Some of the food that should have been hot or at least warm was rather cool.  Not the best sign.  Some of the food was good, but having spent over decade in San Francisco and about four years about 10 miles east of Los Angeles, PPP could not compare to any except the lower quality restaurants that I've tried.  If you want a view, this is the wrong place to go because the casino is right outside the restaurant and that is all you see.

OFyzisLQoTySr1Yg_ZIVPQ.text: best dim sum spot in vegas!  the wait can be long during weekends lunch or dinner and you have to walk through the cloud of smoke to get to the restaurant.  but their food is excellent.  my fav. is their bbq pork bun (served only after 5pm) and they ALWAYS sell out of it fast!  i call in the order a day ahead to ensure i get my fix for those buns =)

lg69C8wRojAGCxerZ8GJug.text: Supposedly this is one of the best dim sum in Las Vegas. We tried it. Nice decor. Decent service. But the food was below average for dim sum. At best, its mediocre dim sum. There's got to be a dim sum place better than this in Las Vegas, is there?

_euR9kz8W2IlnHopIeMhuw.text: One of the most authentic Chinese establishments in Las Vegas. Take a sharp turn off of Spring Valley Rd. and head here instead, you will not be disappointed.

a9CJCgVmX-FC7GPhAo4AZA.text: My SO and I hit dim sum at least 2 times/month  - funny thing is we hit triple - P for late nite dining but rarely for dim sum - after an 8+ month hiatus, we returned on monday for a taste .....very good  !! the shu mei and har gow ( did i spell that correctly ?!?! ) ...tasty...we both appreciated  that with limited exception, the food was served hot...although we still give higher marks to ORchid's for taste and selection...Triple P might give them a run for the casino chips ...they served these mini hot-pots that were very tasty...none of the other dim-sum places serve this !!  $25 later we were full  ( comparable to the other spots )

QcgA3_QaluEGspGiByIR_w.text: Best Chinese food that I could find in Las Vegas, and inside an (affordable) casino to boot!

F0g1KaLOKYdV_8-U1bnXwA.text: I have been to Ping Pang Pong for Dim Sum and it was ok.  I do not remember it being great as I love dim sum and will drive almost an hour to China Town in Los Angeles to have it.  And I have never gone out of my way to drive a few minutes to have dim sum at Ping Pang Pong.  Tonight my husband and I had dinner at Ping Pang Pong.  It was awful.  Not bad awful, terrible awful.  I had the Chilean sea bass which was deep fried in greasy oil.  Seems they deep fried it to avoid the fishiness.  But it did not take away the fishy taste.  My husband had the duck and it was not great.  He was hungry after the duck and we ordered the Gobo Beef dish.  it was so awful we both took a bite and that was it.  Left the entire dish.  We have eaten lots of meals and I have never seen my husband leave a full plate of food.  Service was not great but that never is an issue if the food is good.  The quality of the fish and duck and meat was crap.  The reviews for the dim sum were all pretty good, but having tried the food over dinner, there's no way we will ever go back there.  Still burping from that meal and I think I may be seeing it come back up very soon.

2PsINou3brKHCRYlcVcDLw.text: this review is based on dim sum experiences in Los Angeles (626 area), Chinatown Los Angeles, Chinatown San Francisco, Chinatown New York, and Asia.    if this review was based on only las vegas dim sum, this would be a 4 star easily.   the service is TERRIBLE.  i'm chinese and i live in a highly populated asian area and i must say the service is terrible!!!!  they need to hire about 5 more waiters/waitresses to handle all the business on holiday weekends or weekends in general.  they had at least 10 tables complaining and yelling at the manager, and the manager did not say sorry once.    the food is good for vegas standard, probably the best dim sum you'll ever eat in las vegas.  but compared to dim sum in general, it was just up to par with normal-los angeles dim sum standards, nothing spectacular or special.  price: most items are $2.88 a plate, some (but not many) dishes are $2.18 and then there are some special priced items.  WAIT:  do NOT come here with a big group.  most tables are meant for max 4 people and if u come with 5 person table...expect to wait over an hour without anyone giving you an estimate of how long the wait is.  also, if you have a gold coast member card, you get to cut, thus making the wait for other people even longer.  in short:  best dim sum in vegas, but not worth the terrible service.  just skip dim sum and drive 4 hours to LA for better dim sum.  -E

iyuoq9q0emfNxXYX3o0Xwg.text: We stopped here while on a booze run at the gold coast! The 4 of us ordered and shared our dishes. I ordered the Chilean sea bass which was not what I expected, It looked more like some sort of pancake but was not so bad it was breaded which I am not a fan of and a little to greasy. One of the group ordered a tofu dish that was great! I think that was almost the favorite of at least 3 of us! We also had some shrimp and if I remember right pork chops? We also had some hot and sour soup. Overall the food was pretty good but we were all pretty hungry also! I would go again and now after reading some of the other reviews I would probably try the Dim Sum...

KNBoEd1LD3K9DGOrjyo-Ag.text: Visited the restaurant while I was in Vegas because of a recommendation. I expected much much more. Food was very salty especially the mongolian beef. I find it hard to believe that this is the best Chinese restaurant in Vegas as people claim. I tried it and don't plan on going again.

1ATsy3Cf-Y5_ph-_D-SEhQ.text: My dad will sometimes take us to eat here and I must say that it does it's magic on my Chinese-American taste buds. When we're here for dim sum, I will get anything shrimpy and fried with the sweet mayonnaise. How can you go wrong with the combination of those 3? My favorite of which are the sesame shrimp rolls.   When we're here for dinner, we always get the Peking duck, walnut shrimp, and garlic snow pea chutes. At the sound of duck, my 4 year old will pounce for the legs and happily sit there for the next 10 minutes nibbling at them. The skin is crunchy and the duck is meaty compared to other restaurants that serve some starving ducks. Walnut shrimp are crispy fried shrimp with glazed walnuts covered in more of my favorite sweet mayonnaise. Snow pea chutes are ordered to get our vegetable intake for the evening and taste like almost any Chinese vegetable because it's always covered in a garlic, sesame oil stir fry. The snow pea chutes are just nice, tender. and really good at sopping up the garlicky goodness.  Overall, 4 stars because they have great food. I think it's a bit pricey because it's in a casino, but since I never have to pay for it (thanks dad!), the price is just right.

MN97k0IxTiFUtCkzqU0ACw.text: Methink not going back. No return. Horrible customer service. I have dine-in the afternoons & evenings, not busy times & I still waited for my food for 30 minutes. Here is what I noticed, the local chinese residents of las vegas order there food to-go. The cooks & servers will prepare the to-go orders first before they serve the customers who are eating at the restaurant. That is why customers dining in are waiting for 30 minutes. Almost all the food menu are served with lots of MSG & salted ingredients, yes am saying too salty. The touch of chinese cuisine has disappeared. The lady night manager needs to be replaced. She enjoys arguing customers at night. Messed up!

U8jzyIw2HSjEkO4TZcSVEg.text: Chinese American here, and this place has great food; some of the best dim sum I've ever had! I'm surprised this place has only 3.5 stars and bad reviews mainly about service: it's dim sum. The place is busy and popular, but if you call out they'll come to you.

Exn7VSqpSCL3hs576OgtNg.text: Worst Expierence ever! The food was horrible. The chicken fried rice was hard. The texture on the shrimp balls and bbq pork was inedibale. The calamari was soggy. I asked to speak with a manager ( which I rarely do ) and the response was not as one would expect. The manager and the server did not say anything he just simply removed those iteams and brought back the bill.

IzOIPjbnk0dnY2hK1ZS3-w.text: I think if you like seafood and dim sum you will like this place. Unfortunately I don't like either.  I ordered beef with broccoli and the beef was tough as was the broccoli but what really annoyed me is I could taste seafood in my food like they cooked my beef in the same pan as fish or some other type of seafood. I cannot stand the smell or taste of seafood and can detect the tiniest amount! Also the smell from the dim sum cart is appalling.

ujt5IcZQ1-AdMSnG_mwz6g.text: It's always a good sign when you go to a Chinese restaurant and the place is packed with Chinese people and the servers are Chinese and speaking the language.  And wouldn't you know it, Ping Pang Pong has some great dim sum!  So many options, and it's so tasty.  I can't review every single one we tried as there were so many. But they were all good!!  But go early, there is a long line at lunch time.  The line moves, but I wouldn't say it moves fast.   The dim sum place in Rio (KJ's) is a little more on the nicer side, but personally, having been to both I prefer Ping Pang Pong.

pzTSlW9lQYKCnazIfN2fww.text: Ping Pang Pong is one of the best dim sum in Las Vegas. As a Chinese, I love these delicious food. But i need say there are two problems. One is people take line outside too long, it waste too much time. I think restaurant should provide menu and tea for guest who take line. Secondly, service is too slow. Maybe there are too many people in restaurant, but restaurant should increase the speed of service.

a9YxqAV_O6rWVco1SPM5-Q.text: I came here for few times, the food quality never disappoint me. They have many varieties of dim sum and traditional Hong Kong style pastries. Nice place and I will come back!

TdZtWSHKNN3re_vOn7uMiA.text: Good food and Dim Sum was also good. I didn't like the customer service. The little boy that runs the line pissed us off we were next to be seated and passed us up a few times. So the minute they had a vacant table we barged in and seated ourselves after waiting 1 hour. From what I was told since there in a casino they let the VIP people go in priority. I didn't see one VIP person flash a game VIP card. So i felt people were just getting in at their power. SMH ! They need to run their resturant smoother.

MWOR9UfZSFBbYbPOecVYNg.text: The dim sum here is awesome! I love shaomai and shrimp Changfen. Nice place and good service. Enjoy my lunch here.

6CivtxJi27sLfLFcDYiyPw.text: Brought the parents here at opening time, and it was good that we made it almost on time, as a line quickly formed outside.  Very decent dim sum service, with the carts and everything.  Quality of the food was good, though the selection could have been a little better.  We are always on the lookout for slightly non-standard dim sum, and though there were rumors of some interesting things, what we saw was the basics.  Price to quality ratio was really good compared to anywhere on the strip.  It's not quite high end.  Service and food are on par with places in other cities with a big Chinese population.  I have no problem with the idea that this is the best dim sum in Las Vegas.

JtVUGlTzoVvFZWTfJaGWjA.text: the queue was too long; nontheless, it was the great dim sum so far compared to others in Las Vegas. Custard bun was soooooooo soooo good! I suggest you all to try one!!! But you will need to come on lunch hours since they will be out real fast!!

PXiFOujfglTV5plovMTizQ.text: I am giving this place a bit more credit, being in Vegas and all (which is usually a downer for me because I'm from the NYC area, food capital of the world!).    DIM SUM: Let me just say, the dim sum here surpasses any in the area.  I've been to KJ in the Rio, Chang's, and Cathay House.  Ping Pang Pong has the best variety, quickest service, and the food is actually served HOT, which is important to me.  Some of the other dim sum places will throw plates of cold food at you, which is unacceptable!  I am a huge fan of dim sum so we will be frequenting this place for just that.    DINNER: MUST TRY THE LOBSTER OVER NOODLES. Honestly, I don't know if I ever need to order anything else here. Their lobster is fan-TAS-tic. Best way to eat here is order "family-style"... just order a good variety of fish (the sea bass is great), vegetables, and meat.... and SHARE!  Overall, I enjoyed all of their food and their "standard Chinese service", meaning the service isn't usually top-notch at an Asian joint.  The pricing is higher than most places in Chinatown because it is located inside a casino (even though the casino is just Gold Coast). Hey, if they can get away with it, more power to them.

JQgE_hadll5Xd12e_e_a7w.text: This is the best dim sum in Las Vegas.   1. Open kitchen. I like to watch people cook and check if they are sanitary. They're doing it right back there. Clean for a Chinese restaurant.   2. The cart ladies can speak English. They don't just dump the dishes in my table when I point and ask, "what is it?"  3. Food is fresh. They don't give me old food that's been around and rejected by other people. If I want the new batch, they'll give me just that.   4. Rice is not free. Blahhh. I love rice. They come in a little portion bowl thingy. Their prices are typical for dim sum though.   5. Food is not as great as LA dim sum, but it still has all of the items I want from a dim sum.   I recommend you try.

JP8MMw8T14bs6NEPQx7xQw.text: Gobo beef used to be excellent. I guess there s new chef. I do not reccomend since every dish n dim sum we ordered was avg or below

nk5fRwMKScm2F9pPvXWCmw.text: My family always comes here for dinner, so unfortunately we haven't tried the dim sum. Here are my reviews for the entrees we order every time we go there:  Seabass hotpot: this is a hit or miss. Sometimes the seabass is awesomely delicious and sometimes I wonder if it is the same dish I ordered the last time. Overall, it's our favorite thing to order on the menu.  Shrimp fried rice: it's nearly impossible to mess up fried rice unless you tried really hard. In this case, you would dishona our famiry!!! The shrimp is big and not the small wimpy dried ones a lot of the other places give. Can't go wrong if you want a rice dish.  Roasted duck: the skin is gooey, not crispy as I want it. There is very little meat on it. I was a bit disappointed in this one..  Chow fun (dry): this dish is like Asian spaghetti. I like the fresh sprouts that they use and the noodles are always delicious.  Tomato onion scallops: yuck! I love scallops and decided to order this for the first time. There was so much sweet and sour dressing on it, it was like drinking that thing. Ugh... I expected it to be fried scallops with fresh tomatoes and onions, but i guess I was wrong on this dish. Just thinking about this dish gives me horrible flashbacks and makes me want to gag. No beuno!!!!  Service: usually really quick, but a few times we waited forever or they forgot our order.. The price is fairly cheap for the amount of food you get. I noticed that you get so much more food if you take it to go than eating there. :)

ow9OAV_I5zTgKtTLskyJOQ.text: Orchid Garden is a thing of the past. Ping Pang Pong's dim sum is far superior!  I would much prefer coming here because of the nicer ambiance and better quality food. Seems like Orchid is going downhill for my taste. They serve everything here for what is seemingly cheaper and better tasting. Word to the wise though, as with all dim sum places, come well before 1:30pm or else they'll be fresh out of everything. They refused to make any more dim sum items after that point.

vTkvdG_aV6yEGDjjbINlXA.text: Saw the signs that said they were voted the #1 best Chinese Restaurant in Las Vegas & they were right!  We all really enjoyed our meal.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

Bl_1aPOYsk2gsly8g39feA.text: The quality has gone down hill. This place tastes more like fast food Chinese...and not great fast food. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.   Pot stickers are too doughy. Service isn't great but that's nothing new.   If you're staying at Gold Coast, you can usually get coupons to use here.

bj2HNb1xDFfmT9I_iOUjyg.text: Kalamari was great! Beef+Broccoli was great! Pad thai noodles were wonderful! Diced beef was awesome! The sea bass was utterly ambrosial!

o9mceUb9QWqBduDAeFJ8QA.text: Dim sum (essentially Chinese tapas) is impossible to find in Dayton, OH.  As such, going for dim sum at Ping Pang Pong was a priority for me.  The wife and I had previously been to Ping Pang Pong before its recent renovations.  The renovated space seemed much larger, brighter, and more open to better allow the carts to move around the dining room.  I definitely thought the renovations worked out well.  We arrived at the restaurant on Sunday before 11AM, which was a smart move because by 11:30, the place was packed and a line had formed with people waiting to get in.    The dim sum came out of the kitchen fresh and hot at a regular frequency wheeled around the dining room on small carts.  While the restaurant may have been expanded and renovated, the food was as delicious as I remembered.  Pro tip:  Larger parties (4 or more) are more optimal for dim sum dining than a party of two.  However, I do think prices have increased by more than a bit since our previous visit.  Ping Pang Pong is legit and is my favorite place to get my dim sum fill when I'm in town.
