-ejNNGhljfrA5YvXkwWeCg.text: Update- the service is still bad. Can't say I'm surprised. I placed an order for an appetizer and the server never returned to take the order for my food until the manager was flagged down. It wouldn't have been a deal breaker if the food had at least been good as in past occasions, but the quality of the food has gone down since my last visit. The chicken dish was lukewarm and the shrimp didn't have enough sauce leaving it dry. I waited about 15 min for my bill and again no server. I approached the counter to pay and the young lady didn't acknowledge me for several minutes. Needless to say, I will not be returning.

a4s9-z9r2MoF5eQTh7c22Q.text: This place can get very populated during lunch and dinner hours so beware of the long lines! If you're looking to eat some authentic Chinese food, then this is the place to try! It recently undergone renovation in another area of the casino which made it way better. It is now more spacious with more tables and chairs. The interior looks extremely nice - modernized and brightly lit. I noticed that they started using a tablet to take orders which is a pretty neat transition. You can come here during lunch time for some yummy dim sum or visit during dinner time for authentic Chinese dishes. My family loves to come here all the day and it's reasonably priced for the food. The service was really nice especially since the host always made sure everything was okay and if we needed anything else. The food also comes out quick. There's A LOT to choose from in the menu.  I would definitely recommend this place to everyone!

gow-pJcmQtef_6DH1LiD-g.text: The Best Chinese Food in Las Vegas...The food is awesome and the prices are even better. The menu is filled many great choices to choose from!!! You will not be disappointed!!!!

Tc_-N9y2VYcinn2DrI8f9g.text: Very good dim sum, get selection, fast and friendly staff. Great egg custards, so fresh.

5v95BaqU4Gdp_Ejoyzj5Bg.text: Be careful when you order the dim sum, the waitress are not clear about the price. We ordered a beef tendon under the" strong" recommendation of her and was told it's 6.88 But it's actually 9.88! for just 4 pieces of beef ! It's a rip off! And when we talked about it with the cashier , they denied it ! Hehe, what a excellent service ! Damn. Never go again! The waitress are very aggressive and tried to sell you everything. The place is damn loud and noisy!  ! , 6.88, 9.88,! OMG,, , ! , , , , !!

DkO2rfbgnfYKpIr2e1-jFg.text: Coming from Arizona there isn't allot of places with that wow factor of Dimsum. This place was recommended by a friend and I'm very impressed at the variety of foods they have. It's definitely allot more than Arizona Dimsum. Located inside Golden Coast Hotel & Casino the restaurant itself is very nice. We came here on a Sunday around 11am and there wasn't any wait. Got seated right away and the food cart started coming. Order some basic dishes like Shumai and Hagow. Then we saw some dished that looked very different and good so we gave those a try (see pictures for details). I would say the dimsum here is quite good and the cart does go around often. But maybe it's a weekend so food options maybe more than week days.   Service was basic. They come and you choose your dish. Although they seem to treat the Cantonese speaker a little better than the English speaker. I'll be back to fully try other dishes on the menu.

3z_SwZafGlKMlAAED6U-ww.text: Fast service. Food tastes good. Price is really affordable and serving is good for 2 two. Definitely be back and recommend for family and group/friends gathering. Good food great price!

RKcWLuxVl52PD2hlWqYQHg.text: The newly renovated Ping Pang Pong not only looks great but they are serving up fresh and tasty dim sum. It's important to go during peak times to ensure the food carts are plentiful and replenished regularly. The food stays fresh which is key.   We cake with a large group which allowed us to get just about everything available to try. Service was good and the carts come around frequently allowing you to get to try everything that's available.   The new renovation is a definite step up from the previous space.

h--02TFxSWZ5scClBbHoHw.text: I love dim sum! The food here is amazing! Wonderful flavor and a very filling meal. The only downside was the service. I literally had to chase everyone down to ensure food appeared on my table. The staff wasn't very attentive. They never checked in much and the carts kept passing my table. Is our money not good enough for you or something? Go here for good food but only if you have time to kill because their service sucks. Asian really only care about the quality of the food not the service.

-bzKJz2cYJKzB9ByqutSeQ.text: Let me just tell you this was the best Chinese food I've ever had!! I started with the won ton soup. The broth and dumplings tasted like they were hand made. For my entree I had orange chicken. By far, the juicest. It had the perfect crunch as well. My bf ordered the Santa Barbara prawns and they were huge!! So sweet. I felt like I was eating fresh crab. I def will bring family and friends here!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8IEYhHO_m2kSoyoZP65AQQ.text: They have some really delicious desserts.  My favorite Loas salted egg custard buns are topped with pineapple bun crust.  I also enjoyed the mushroom stuffed tofu with corn and other veggies.  The flavors were infused into the tofu and the entire bite was so juicy.  They also have the notorious Portuguese egg tarts.  Chicken feet were a family favorite.    A couple dishes werent really for our tastes such as the shumai and pineapple pastry.  I think the comparison to traditional pineapple cakes was the cause of this, but overall the flavor was like a puff pastry donut filled with the usual pineapple filling you would find in a pineapple cake.    Some additional things to consider: the prices are slightly higher and there is usually a wait, as such with other popular dim sum spots.  Overall cleanliness and service was very good and worth your money.

jBy_QoDR8ZkTAofQiBEwwQ.text: Located inside the Gold Coast Casino.  This is where i stay when I am in Vegas for work.  Typically the majority of the clientele are Asian, and locals, so to me that is a good sign.  It is open late, too, which is nice. I can't give you my take on many of the menu selections, as I have only had a couple of items.  But they are so good I keep going back to them. 1)  The Hot and Sour soup.  This comes out in a huge bowl.  Plenty enough for two, possibly even three people.  It is full of good stuff and a fairly dense soup.  So good. 2)  The shrimp fried rice.  The SFR that you get at Ping Pang Pong is quite different from anything I have had....the rice is very light and fluffy, not oily.  The shrimp are good size, not baby shrimp that you see at many places.  I am usually there with my Dad and we leave nothing in the pan. We all know that great food can be ruined with poor service, but that is certainly not the case here.  The service is impeccable.  They are quick to greet you and get drinks, and the food arrives in a reasonable amount of time.  Like many large Asian restaurants, they use the team approach to serving which makes them more efficient.  A True 5-star in my opinion..

v2LFZeeQTjMoXWBBVqdoNA.text: Unfortunately, Vegas isn't known for its dim sum, but this place could be the exception. Located in Gold Coast. I know, I know, it's not the fanciest property you've ever seen, but it's definitely worth a visit.   First off, the food was good but the service was hit & miss. Stood at the front for a few minutes before being acknowledged even though there were 3 staff members standing there talking amongst each other (seemingly busy but who knows).  Anywho, once seated the service was only a little better. A few times the carts passed without stopping lol. Kind of awkward having to flag them down every time you want something, especially with this style of dinner service.   On to the food. Great options, yet they didn't have everything I was looking for. Started off with a hot pot of tea and the Chinese broccoli. Cooked perfectly, as was the brisket stew rice noodle (amazingly tender). Then we ordered the roasted duck, pan fried dumplings and s&p shrimp which were pretty good. The fried rice was on the sweet side, I'm not sure I'd order that again. The har gow, meh. Overall, the Chinese broccoli, brisket stew and pan fried dumplings were my favorite. I'll probably stick to those next time and sample some of the pork buns too.   *Extra points for ambiance and staying open late. Don't forget to check the hours before you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8gUmYUS-3pKuuLBf0FID8Q.text: During my Las Vegas Visit my parents brought me to one of their favorite places.  It's has a pretty funny name especially when my parents say it with their accent.    The restaurant offers a menu of items.  And they also have fresh dim sum.  My mom said that if you go early like lunch you will get to try everything. By the evening hours they start to run out of some items.  Since I have moved to Texas I have had great dim sum in a long while. Every item that I ask for from the cart was very tasty.  We ate family style.   I loved the coconut filled buns.  I haven't had that those in 12 years+.   Anyways I don't know what the names of the items we ordered off the cart but the ladies make stop every few minutes to offer their fresh choices.  I can't wait to bring my children here when we visit as a family.    Stars 1 star for food 1 star for service 1 star for facilities 1 star for overall experience.

RDlpUghGHOdQVNnTsMRH6g.text: Actually pretty good chinese joint off the strip near Rio hotel. Food was good and had some dimsum as well...didnt see a lot of dimsum choices but the usual choices were reallu good...i shall return...

kLObQGJ_I_f8cU8TMECEzw.text: Ummmmm......  food was good but ordering is a bit confusing, they set your food on a turn table in middle of table, u aren't really sure what you're getting as far as sides etc, the whole process could just be made a lot better as far as that goes, other than that, the food was good but service was lacking for a place of this caliber

UokntXCrgwAX_qyW1Gnlyg.text: Came here on Saturday around 12pm with my family. We called 30 minutes before arriving to make a reservation for a party of 11. When we arrived, we got seated almost immediately. The dimsum was delicious, very authentic! We ordered a variety of dishes: ha gao, shui mai, BBQ pork bun, chicken feet, eggplant, lotus wrapped rice, rice noodle, egg tart, and more!  My favorites: Egg tart, BBQ pork bun, Shui mai  I'm going to give this place one less star because it is on the pricier side for dimsum. But I guess you are paying for the better quality food at Ping Pang Pong. I recommended this place to all my friends, and will be coming back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. eggplant
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yummy egg tart! very flakey!

AkSwrz2bhxiGomnOv8IaFQ.text: Great food, fast service, real Chinese food is hard to come by. It's inside the casino in the middle. The dumplings and sea bass were the highlights for sure.

2tUYR6KiEQMU_ym6Tark8g.text: Very very disappointed.  Looking forward to getting some great food, but would have been better just going to a Chinese fast food.  Dimsum was cold, no choices.  Other stuff come out after we finish eating.  The manager pushed several cart past us and didn't even ask us.  Will be looking for new dim sum choices.

v3uWcsZ5Ndg_te0h22Lsww.text: An OK place to eat.  This restaurant had been recommended to me by multiple friends, so I was excited to try it. Maybe it was the hype, but I was expecting a lot more from my experience.  The food is good - no doubt. However, the service leaves a lot to be desired. There were 6 people in my party and we were sat at a table that had only 5 chairs and 4 sets of utensils. We saw our waiver maybe twice during our entire time, and the restaurant appeared to need more cleaning. I saw other parties around us also complaining from the lack of attention.  In my opinion, if this place doesn't change their customer service soon, it is at risk of losing many customers.   Give it a try and let me know what you think!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wish I would&#39;ve taken pics of the food, but we were hungry and ate it as soon as it touched our table. This is the front of the restaurant.

zLk9HU7iFXpHuKbfdtzxkw.text: Beautiful restaurant and definitely an improvement on decor from the previous location in the  Goldcoast Casino. Service was great and the presentation was nice. However, the taste of the food did not deliver.  We ordered the Lupcheong fried rice, Fried noodle with combination of ingredients, Honey walnut prawns, Ham ha Ong Choy, and Salt and Pepper Pork Chops. After ordering our food, the Honey walnut prawns and the Pork chops were both delivered in 5 minutes. It made me feel we were at a buffet because the food was luke warm and saturated in oil. I could tell it was precooked and under a warmer unit before we got it. We waited 20 minutes before the remainder of our order was delivered. That's a long time not to have rice with our main course. The fried rice was oily and so was the noodles. The noodles seemed like it was not cooked in HOT oil, instead it was saturated with oil. The Ong Choy was on point and delicious. I hope they return to fresh, cooked to order like a restaurant should of this caliber. We were disappointed and would not recommend to eat here for quality cantonese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious ham ha Ong Choy
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lupcheong fried rice,  oily
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried noodle,  oily n heavy

TOjSHqHBEubwoDipCphJAA.text: Hands down the best Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas. I've been here many times since they opened the spot in the middle of the Gold Coast and have always been blown away by the consistency of the food I have ordered.   The restaurant is typically busy - so the place is full and there is often a line outside the door. The hostesses dress in nice red Chinese dresses and seat you quickly.   Most of the dinners are between $15 -$20. They also have a page of market price items for fresh live seafood.   The wait staff is quick to take your order and then the food runners will bring your food. Yinnie is my favorite waitress. She is delightful and speaks great English. She has a unique way of using 2 spoons as chopsticks to box up your leftovers.   Noodles and rice dishes dominate - but there are plenty of protein items to choose from. I can't recommend the dim sum during the morning hours - although the restaurant is always packed. There are far too many carts making their way through the place and sometimes you see a cart parked for 15 minutes or so while the food runner takes a break. So - much lower rating for their dim sum service even though the food is great.

sNcwc-UyvTnk3cQo3ePvjw.text: Simply one of the best Chinese restaurants located inside Gold Coast Casino.  Highly recommended to tourists and locals. This place is good for both.  I've been dinning here at least twice a month and I must say it's a pleasant experience every time with the food and service. The star dish for me is the salt and pepper calamari, it's the best in town. Be sure to try the HongKong style seafood crispy noodles, the shrimp fried rice and many other yummy authentic dishes.  The staff is awesome!  They're all attentive and polite, especially the manager Kristy, she's absolutely exceptional.  She's always checking up to make sure that I'm happy with my dinner. I'd take my friends and family here every time we want Chinese food.

PQi8yTeWyxffpkZT9GEWoQ.text: Wow, probably one of the best dim sum restaurants in Vegas! This restaurant is located inside a hotel. We tried to call and make reservations beforehand because some of the reviews talked about having to wait a long time. However they only accept reservations for parties of 10 or more. For a group of 3, we only had to wait about 10 minutes on a Sunday afternoon.  The interior of the restaurant is clean, spacious, and looks new. Once we got seated, there were immediately 3 carts that came by, so we were able to get food right away. The carts consistently came by our table so we never had to chase anyone down for food. Tea is $1 per person. The food is great here, however the dishes are a little bit more expensive for dim sum. For example, we got a plate of egg tarts which cost $4.88 per plate. And the egg tarts had 2 per plate instead of 3. Overall, I highly recommend this dim sum restaurant if you don't mind spending a little more!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my favorite egg tarts I&#39;ve had! ($4.88 per plate)
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large variety!

jgmNp2GPC9NgiSTHUBHOwg.text: I have been coming here on and off for a few months. The service at this place gets worse every time we come.  We had to wait over 5 minutes to be seated several servers and the manager just walked by without saying anything.  I then asked the manager should we seat ourselves she said no and then a couple mins later someone came to seat us.    Once seated the busboy brought our beverages quickly but then had to wait for the server to come over took 10 minutes.   The appetizer we ordered came out quick, but the rest of our food took over 25 minutes to come out.. server had to many tables in her section.    yes this is a high volume restaurant but staff for it. stop cutting corners to make more money. more staff = better service   The food is awesome just bad service.

R6oNGBWdwdEFleeHJ3KkHg.text: On our trip to Vegas last week we stayed at The Rio. On Tuesday night they experienced a gas line break which effected all of the restaurants on the property. After a while we decided to walk over to the Gold Coast and try their buffet. While walking over I noticed the sign for Ping Pang Pong's and I remember seeing great reviews for the place. My husband was excited because he had been in the mood for Chinese food.   After arriving at the restaurant and being seated the server came and took our order. Mind you there were only 4 of us and we decided on just a few items: The Kung Pao Chicken, Beef and Broccoli and fried rice. After we placed our order we were brought the waters that we requested. An hour later we still did not have our food. We tried a number of times to flag down our server or anyone that could tell us what was up with our food...we were basically ignored.   We ended up just getting up and walking out....  So I can't really give a review on the food but their service get's an all time low for me.

w_wAYhzOYw_P3BZxVTt67A.text: This place has grown into one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in Vegas, for a couple dishes, entrees, and appetizers its a good $100 plate, the prices are reasonable and the food is mouth-watering. I enjoy the shrimp chow mein & the chicken fried rice has the perfect amount of salt & seasoning. The sauces with the Kung pao & honey walnut shrimp are out of this world! On weekends the kitchen closes at 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey walnut shrimp some of the best in Vegas.
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fried rice
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kung pao yo!

jyt_caeWogAK9rcIYKDhjg.text: There's no doubt my review has some bias because we're from LA and we have some of the best dim sum on the west coast. Anyway, there was a 15 minute wait on a Sunday around 1:30pm. Most items we had were not as warm/hot as we would like, bummer.

hZ0mwptjmvoLXlQSnVBr-A.text: Not a food snob when it comes to trying Asian, but I will not eat at PF Changs.  There is something to be said about Asian restaurants- they aren't corporate American. They don't care to know who you are, they just want to serve good food at a good price and get you the hell out.  I love it!  Walk in and find the cashier. She will show you to a clean table without even saying anything. The server assistant will come around and ask if you want a beverage. Tip: don't order the wine. It's served from a twist cap single serving 6 pack. My friend almost threw up. HAHA. The server comes by and asks if we're ready to order. We were. The food came out about 10 minutes later, if that.  The food is shareable so be careful how much you order. One plate of rice is good for 4 people and two entrees is good for 4 people. I looked at the cooks to notice none of them talking, they were just busting out the food. The server checked on us once and then asked if we wanted to go boxes. They brought them over, boxed up the food and we paid.  If you go to an Asian restaurant and it's full of Asians then they must be doing something right. This place is full of them.

_V1A0PIwb5b_5CvGK0JCng.text: Very authentic dim sum dishes serving in very authentic Cantonese way too. Dessert dishes could be better though. For those who is looking for great authentic dim sum or taking an adventure for authentic Chinese food, you can't miss this place if you are in Vegas. For those who is spoiled by "American Chinese food", skip this place and do not judge the thing that you don't have a clue.

aPFxFSnouibkQx5QrN4t8A.text: The BF had a craving for late night dim sum and so I went on a search to find who serves even a small selection throughout the day.   It's not on the dinner menu, but I was told you can order dimsum from the kitchen late night for $2.88 each. The selection is limited and depends on what didn't sell that morning. Hey, it's better than nothing....the only late night dimsum (Kan's) closed.   We ended up getting:  Shrimp Har Gao- the shrimp and wrapper was fine, but I think the wrapper is slightly too thick. Shumai- I did not like their version. Something about the taste just doesn't work for me and was just OK.  Shrimp cake- these were tasty. They were panfried so it was crisp and inside was dense cake, shrimp and green onion.   We also got off the menu:  Mapo Tofu ($7.95)- pretty good. The meat had a sausage like flavor to it which was interesting since most just throw plain ground meat. Tofu is always noms to me.  Salt&Pepper Pork Chop ($9.95)- the fry was light so the texture was nice. Funny that "salt" is part of the name, but it needed a tad more of that.   I was surprised by the prices. I honestly thought it would be more at a casino, but it's about the same pricing as some of the nicer Chinese restaurant on Spring Mountain Rd. I think it was very fair priced and the quality was good.   The service was friendly and pretty on it with drinks and checking up on us.   Will be coming back for daytime dimsum....one of these days we'll actually wake up early enough for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mapo tofu
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt pepper pork chop
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shumai, har gao, shrimp cake

kW_JvfQrrWZYwWAA2Q1wWQ.text: I know restaurant critics who have put Ping Pang Pong on their lists of "must eat" in Las Vegas.  After dining here twice, I'm not sure why, but I have a guess.  The food is fine.  It's not close to the best Chinese food I've had.  It's a bit greasy, at times overcooked, and occasionally a bit bland.  We sampled some meat dishes, vegetable dishes, and even some dim sum.  This left me wondering how this place gets such raves.  One thing, they serve some exotic dishes, dishes I don't see in other places.  I suspect this is one of the attractions.  The service is fine.  The place is often busy, and they do their best to hustle people in and out.  Overall, the place is a "a-ok", 3 stars.

e64IoriwOypqdAAF32GdxQ.text: The food is good. I like the idea of dim sum cart walking around. However if you wanna receive great service, this is not the place for you.

F0FZZzpBkc6BakJRxVrSqg.text: Great food , quick service, definitely will visit again soon.

-gg3G_UvgJ8speATca2Dtw.text: Ping Pang Pong is has some of the best dim sum i never try in Vegas. good service in there.

bYAHlgbZ_aT_25N4EAA8uQ.text: Ping Pang Pong is has some of the best dim sum in Vegas. I really enjoyed to have lunch with my friends and I really liked (Shu-mai) and (Tofu). Everything tastes good. Definitely I'll come back.

JZDeiedSqeNbH96g_C_JMQ.text: The best dim sum I have ever had in US. Even better than those in Bay Area, NYC and LA. Be prepared for long waits because seats are limited.

-ebc7M0MJ8p48_AWB6vFrw.text: Got a craving for salt and pepper calamari?  What about crispy noodles with seafood and vegetables?  For some reason, my friend and I keep ordering this same thing and we share.  The food is always cooked to perfection.  I like the jalapenos on the calamari and that there are smaller pieces and larger pieces too.  The seafood on the crispy noodles is so amazing.  How do they cook that white fish so perfectly?  I can't get enough of that mixed with the shrimp, scallops, broccolini and noodles.    The service is very friendly and attentive.  There's a nice atmosphere in the dining area.  I know we'll be back soon!

uu15b8K2gvNi5WK_iTlR2g.text: I've never been to Dim Sum in Vegas, but we tried this place based on online reviews.  It's hidden in the back area of the Gold Coast casino and when we walked up to it, there was a line of about 20 people in line which was a good sign.  We were a large party (12 people) and it took about 30 minutes to get seated.  There were lots of chinese people here which again was a good sign.  Once we sat down, it was on.  The quality of the dim sum was pretty high.  The dim sum dishes were all fresh.  I would consider them to be in the upper echelon if we moved this place to the Bay Area.  Would I go back?  Probably.  Prices were reasonable, food was good and it was authentic.

7_x3u4L2Oc7HPtpetgoYEQ.text: I must admit, I had high expectations of this restaurant, as I had read it had one some awards.  It wasn't bad, but it was nothing I would ever go out of my way for again.  The hot and sour soup was extremely bland.  My Thai iced tea was ok, but just average. My entree of Dragon Well Shrimp, was very good, and the overall service was very attentive.   By comparison, Joyful House, which is nearby, is far superior to Ping Pang Pong.  I'd give it 3.25 stars, if there was such a rating.

Dpk6q9QNsv2_APyE-M4afw.text: There's always a long wait.  Expect 30min to 1hr wait on Sunday. The shiu mai, spring rolls are great.  The desserts were awesome.  I come there mainly for the buns with sweet yellow egg custard inside.  The sweet rice wrapped inside banana leaf was also our favorite. Customer service was not good.  The servers always rush in and out.  When we want something they always act as if they cannot help us and we have to wait for the right  food carts to come.  It was frustrating. Even though I hate to come here because the service sucks, it is still among one og the best place for dim sum when we have a craving for it.  So we stop by maybe once a year.

C-Yy1m6-5hJ39C__8kGu4g.text: My favorite Chinese restaurant.I love the live lobster and Salt and Pepper Pork chops, so fresh and delicious.The servers are very friendly even the restaurant is so busy .Definitely a thumbs up .

0xofMWj59i-pQXFc2y9Fng.text: Love their dimsum! My fave is siomai, chicken feet, pork buns, and sweet tofu.  Good thing we don't have to wait long to be seated.

AHTjdnTOkb9crTGYlkqF5w.text: It is a great place to eat Dim Sum! Just tell your friends to go! The restaurant place is inside of the casino.

ojwhOgKr8xYJqFXnMw8DvA.text: I think they should take of soft turttle shells. I am really ANGRY!!!!, with that. It is just wrong. They are really almost in endangered. I think the food is great but just take it of :[

tqPBOoaZb8AM6mIIcWw2yA.text: There might be better Chinese food in Las Vegas but I bet it aint as cheap as Ping Pang Pong. We really enjoy this place and it wont break the bank

AHTrbxSX1o1bv9iHZB76Sw.text: Service was HORRIBLE!!!  How the hell do you serve the entrees WITHOUT the rice?  Or serve the adults drinks, and NOT the kids??  The food wasn't GREAT..but I'm from Cali, and know what GREAT Chinese food tastes like.  I'm NEVER going back there.

uBJmrwba6PY94ZxUHm381A.text: Great dim sums here. The 'thousand year old egg porridge' is quite good. Jin Sha Bao is good too, and they always run out of it fast.

J4QACyGXUwSJenRgCgugqg.text: Good food. Good experience. Good prices.  This place is pretty "authentic", in the sense that you will not immediately recognize 'Americanized" menu items. I do remember a Kung Pao dish but that is about it. The menu descriptions are weak and dont give the menu items the credit they deserve.  I bet everything on the menu is superb. You can watch the Asian cooks make your food.  Asian waiters are pretty FOB. Ask them for a recommendation if you arent sure. Thats how i discovered the Gobo Beef, love it.

VNYw_Wcp67LBgjibfvgO2Q.text: Sad to say, this is the best dim sum in Vegas.  I miss Seattle!  I have to tell ya -- the service (or lack of service) is why I gave this a "3 star".  The hostess is cute but she is completely an idiot!  Every 5 minutes while my mom and I waited in line, she would ask, "How many?"  I'm not kidding you -- There were only 4 of us in line (a couple ahead of us) -- and you'd think she would recognize four people, right?!  NOT!  Every 5 minutes, she'd ask, "How many?"   (Am I on "Seinfeld" or a candid camera?)  There were only 4 of us in line, and the hostess asked the couple ahead of us, "How many?"  They replied, "2" ... and then she turned to us and asked, "How many? 4?"  -- um,  helllooooooooooooooooo!!!!  My 3 year old niece can add better than her!  Anyway -- long story short, after 3 more times of "how many?" -- I finally lost my temper.  It's truly sad because the food is quite yummy -- it's just that the idiot hostess needs to get fired!  The funniest thing is, while I was enjoying my siew mai and har gow with mom, the idiot hostess sat a couple next to us.  Sure enough, the couple yelled at the hostess for her stupidity.  Wow!  I hope when I return, I don't have to answer to "How Many?"  10 times again.  LOL...

EnxeMc5vzf9hh3I6Oenl4g.text: I would like to say, I am not very picky about service. I am Asian and I eat at restaurants mostly for the food. So service and ambiance are just plusses for me, not a breaking point. BUT I HATE PING PANG PONG! I shrugged off the name and got ready with my friends to eat some recommended dim sum. It was in the middle of a casino, so it was extremely noisy and it smelled like cigarette smoke, but again, I was willing to overlook it for some good dim sum. First, there is no clear set way for me to get a table. At a typical dim sum place, you go up to a hostess, and you get a number, so I get ready to go up to the hostess, but there is a line blocked off in front of her. So I go and wait in line, the line does not move an inch for 20 minutes. So I think I must get a number and then stand in line. I approach the hostess again, and ask her politely in Cantonese, could I get a number for a table of 6. She proceeds to b*tch at me and say that I need to stand in line, so I start to walk away, and then she goes wait do you have a number, and I said no so she haughtily hands me the number. Completely un-phased, I ask how long would the wait be, she looks at me incredulously, like I am some sort of infant, and rudely tells me this place is very busy and there is no possible way for her to even approximate a wait and could I stand aside I was blocking her table. I hear people all around me asking the same question and everyone getting the same crappy answer to the point all, but two tables stayed to wait. Being a b*tch is inexcusable. I have eaten dim sum in Hong Kong where people get up and line up in front of the carts for dim sum and its the way it is over there. This place seemed to be conflicted whether or not it wanted to be a free-for-all or a place that carefully lines up and due to this confusion, NO ONE was getting served.

O02o37_EoxKQvInXP05jPA.text: ok first of all... lets just start out by saying I am from LA... and lucky for me we have Chinatown and the entire San Gabriel Valley a.k.a. China! Now maybe Vegas just doesn't have too many authentic chinese restaurants but damn this was the worst dim sum I have ever had in my life! My friend took me there 2 weeks ago and well the name kinda threw me off to begin with but once I tried the shu mai... damn it was over! I didnt want to try anything else. The simplest dim sum and yet they couldnt even get it right. The beefballs were too overcooked too!  Even the tiny little pork buns were to run from. How does this place stay in business? But then again maybe they are catering to a different crowd. What really struck me as weird was the fact the place was full of asians! I mean, is this suppose to be as good as it gets in Vegas for dim sum? If so, I'd rather stop by a trader joes and pick up a pack of frozen shu mais. You will have much better luck going to the frozen food aisle at a supermarket for good dim sum. Oh one more thing.. horrible service. The employees are literally fresh off the boat! I guess thats the only thing authentic about this place, their workers! hahahaha Trust me when I say I will never come back here or recommend this to another soul.. unless i hated them and wanted to waste their money! =D

teqxezy3DLiZssswtOp-xw.text: i went here w/ my family and the food was delicious. surprisingly coz most chinese places are dirty but this one was actually good. they have this really cool kitchen where you see the chefs cooking your food. it's great for a casino restaurant...you gotta try it. it tastes fresh and autentic.

x0hGD3W-4gLY-2JL9viNxw.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant by accident, and I am happy that we did.  The restaurant has an open, modern feel.  My friend and I took a seat at the counter, where we could get a good look at the chefs preparing the food.  I ordered the Honey Walnut prawns, and it may have been the finest Chinese food I've had in my life.  Practically orgasmic.  I was disappointed that I found this restaurant on my final night in town, or I would have gone back for more the next day.   It will certainly have a spot on my Vegas itineraries in the future.

4goOpTAOCdlA-u1TeZzYww.text: Delicious chinese food.  You know a restaurant is good when the majority of the customers are that nationality.  Not the best in terms of atmosphere, but who cares when the food is delish.

_IEiIzJNjd_AeBOZYnlaXg.text: I only bee here twice, both times at 2am... They didnt really have any dim sum left. The FIRST TIME WAS DEFINATLY BETTER THEN THE SECOND TIME. Not the worst Chinese food pretty tasty and most of the customers were Chinese so its probably not that bad!

_07SAZKrwKpEngZH7j87nw.text: We went to this restaurant early around 10 in the morning, we ordered har kaouw , shiu Mai, they are yummy, chicken feet was well cook and tender, bi tan congee delicious and fresh, put some soy sauce a little bit to make it perfect. The service is good, the waitress replaced my plates 2 times maybe because it was early and not many people. The price is reasonable considering this is in Vegas, 9 items for 25.90 even cheaper than the one in Denver. Two thumbs up, definitely it will be first place to visit next time to Vegas.

RQjV-T3lUhiY0cd3jdD3DA.text: You kind of get what you pay for here....don't expect a high end Chinese restaurant at these prices.  For the $, PF Chang's is much better food....but I recommend Pearl at the MGM which is really an experience with Chinese food.  The service here is abismal and it has a fast food feel to the restaurant....and of course, it is not very convenient to people staying on the Strip or Downtown.

eATBD0-GNcackw5aS1TuUQ.text: man! this place smokes about 1/2 the chinese restaurants on spring mountain!! the food is DELICIOUS here! very authentic!! chinese cooks, chinese waiters, and a bunch of chinese people inside the restaurant! you know it's good chinese food when you see a whole gang of chinese people in there chowing down!! besides the full menu, during the day, they serve dim sum! i've been here a few times and have always ordered the chinese sausage fried rice (which is made with egg whites and thinly sliced chinese broccoli steams) and salt & pepper pork chops! my boyfriend and i went on valentine's day this past monday and i decided to venture out and order the wonton noodle soup!! that was not a disappointment... the broth was delicious and the wontons were very plump with pork & shrimp. kind of reminded me of the wonton noodle soup in hong kong!! i can bet that 1/2 of the cooks came straight from hong kong! the style of cooking there is very very very cantonese! definitely will bring family there when they come into town next time.... sorry sam woo... i found a new joint!! PING PANG PONG! i love saying that name!! LOL hahahahhaha! OH! 1 more thing... they are open until 3am!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

_dJneS7xsmJxbHXC9CLEFQ.text: the name gets one star...the food, however, is great.  not as good as dimsum in la but it will suffice.  the dumplings (shhiu-mai and hargow) are tasty but the selection is minimal.  the baked goods are good as well.  one big drawback is the restaurant opens to the casino so smoke comes in from time to time.

trV3UzJZi2vUSMVrHaDIFg.text: I went for a Dim Sum lunch on a Thursday.  I got there around noon.  I wish I'd arrived earlier, say at 10 AM when they open, because I had to wait, and it was a little bit busy for my tastes.  Service was okay, although I had to flag down a waitress or wave over a cart lady a couple of times.  The porridge with shredded pork and thousand-year-egg was superb--light, fresh and like no porridge I'd eaten to date.  I also had shrimp in rice noodle roll (slightly spicy, and there was plenty of pepper sauce on the table to turn up the heat as desired) and custard buns--silky, rich yellow egg custard just barely sweeter than the dough (I have this thing against eating once I'm full), and wished I could have tried everything.  If those aren't the most imaginative choices, take heart; I'm slowly working my way through all the dim sum offerings in Las Vegas.  I simply order whatever I see first.  So far I've tried Harbor Palace and now Ping Pang Pong--I think that Ping Pang Pong is the better of the two.

BDDe3TV5vA12cYbF8WjN8w.text: My favorite Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas! I've lived here for 11 years before discovering this place... I can't believe I've been missing out. I ordered pan fried noodles, spicy pork chop, beef and broccoli, and fried rice. Everything was so tasty and extremely fresh.  I've also placed take out orders and the food is just as yummy!

wghwH0E2juOJWPGQfXFN0A.text: Conveniently located inside The Gold Coast Hotel and Casino. Food is always good. Place is always busy so plan accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Uu9aQZUttBGRzHr8YwC8fA.text: Food was good but service is bad when they busy they don't care customer anymore. Ask for ice water for 30min still didn't get it.

C7a031fXVnL8nUYy5kTWrQ.text: Delicious dimsum with lots of options. So glad to find a good dimsum in Vegas. Their egg tart was amazing. They have a big selection of dimsum desserts and they are all good.

wS63KmvmEDUlwyTaIvNZGQ.text: Nice chinese style restaurant. Nice food but gailan is not real pan fry. Service is not that good. Have to wait 10 minuts to order a pan fry gailan and another 10 for refilling hot water. Even got hitted by the dimsim cart 3 times...l

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_3bJqiDZ30b3ehiKaZEspw.text: looking for dim sum in vegas? go here. it's located in the gold coast hotel and is on point!

4vS-MelTrzw2SSpr23k-Cw.text: Came here with some friends on a Friday. Short waiting line outside of the restaurant. This place is located inside of Gold Coast. Between ping pang pong and KJs would recommend this place, but being from SF this place lacked the variety in dishes I'm accustomed to.  Food: (4 stars)- food was good. Most dishes were very hot. I enjoyed the beef and BBQ wrapped rice rolls. In addition the Chinese fried donut wrapped in rice paper and a lot of the more common Chinese dishes. What ping pang pong served was very good; however they just did not have a ton of variety.   Service: (5 stars)- servers and people were very helpful and delivered dishes quickly from the kitchen if we asked for them.   Good place I wouldn't mind coming back

AImIrjbpxv0Y7tgIj9chkA.text: Great food selection! I love the chicken feet, sticky rice and siomai and everything!

y7W04pjlfjZDgUcB25-UeA.text: After a late business conference, hubby and I decided to live on the edge and eat some dim sum at midnight. We never have the option when we're in San Diego, so we jumped at the opportunity.   We were seated quickly, and a server took our drink order. Food was served after a few short minutes, and everything was pretty good. No major complaints here!

d2ZxLyeO-2aRAqNRovvQhg.text: Such great food.  I've come to this restaurant a few times and really enjoyed it.  The dim sum and other entrees are great.

1c8rCp1m8yAT53WjHgFJxA.text: This place definitely is better than other Chinese restaurants. I came here for lunch to eat dim sum, and the only other place I've ever had dim sum in this town was orchard gardens. Comparing to them, this restaurant was much better. The shrimp dumplings were good, and everything else was also tasty. Only reason I can't give it 5 stars because the server was severely disorganized and she forgot my drink many times. Other than that, it's definitely good food

DyqLUIb6dPcstcXM5i6vzg.text: An L.A. native and I found my din sum spot and I'm freaking shocked it's not in the Chinatown area. #bestchickenfeet #bbqporkbun #porridge

Z6jyu4WOeJMX3amKp8GffQ.text: Food: dim sum. Surprisingly authentic considering its located inside a casino. They had all our favorites so I liked that (har gow, bbq pork noodle, baked custard bun, steamed rice in banana leaf, pai gu, etc.) I did not care for their lobo gao - it just didn't taste freshly cooked.  Service: pretty good as chinese restaurants go! Ha ha. Carts and our jasmine tea were brought around fast and our check was handled quickly. When I asked for soy sauce they brought it. Can't ask for more people!  Location: inside the Gold Coast Casino. Restaurant is a bit small so I would not bring a big group here. (i.e. 5 people or more). We went on a weekday around 11am and it was a full restaurant.

OhrSdHkiWaG1zsgxI_q3fg.text: Kristy is this amazing manager who treats us every time like VIPS!!!!! and Yannie Wang was just the best waitress ever. The 2 of them made our dinner so enjoyable. The food was absolutely delicious!!!!

JnmsfLKO0l6DuP_5nu8b7g.text: We called in advance to see how long the wait would be. They said they weren't sure but it likely would not be that long. We drove all the way here for them to rudely tell us the wait is over an hour long. As a business in such a developed city, this should never happen. Laughable. Get it together.

mEPDV_l4ZmS6O7HYt4Zz1g.text: This is disgusting food beyond belief. I wouldn't serve these lamb chops to my dog. Because it would be cannibalism. The food was really really bad, overpriced beyond belief and downright disgusting. If you have any respect for yourself don't eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7X37VSowrsYEZGp0alkiqQ.text: When you get to Las Vegas and you got that urge for a great dining experience head over to the Gold Coast Casino. Inside you will find Ping Pang Pong's fabulous new restaurant. Take a minute and watch the cooks do their thing it's amazing. At Ping Pang Pong you can relax and feel at home even though you are surrounded by a full house of hungry people. The nice part is the staff will bend over backwards to make sure your food and dining is just the way you would expect. If you have any special needs just ask for Krysty she will get it done. Oh don't forget about the fresh squeezed juices from the juice bar. Thanks so much!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mELIv1gfoPqnD422POBOZg.text: Great food good service they kept the tea hot and they serve real chicken not that fake swollen chicken and there fried rice was on point

sLwFypthcmmaqIrYy65BXQ.text: Nice ambience and clean Chinese restaurant. Fast service and affordable price. Food tastes great BUT one can taste the overpowering taste of MSG. If you are allergic or hate MSG, avoid this place. Several of my friends who ate there have the same complaint.

IObe-vUAEiswxjjHdQFoZg.text: My family loved this place! We're in Vegas for only 3 days and our last stop we've decided to hit this restaurant because my friends went here before and I wasn't able to come. Great food!

WpAfBNAJ6WOf53lgMattNA.text: The food is hot and good there.  I really like the tofu dessert.  It taste original like the one I had it when I was a kid.  You need to try it.

jtCgaZD-7b-q-7vG8nAVYw.text: You'll likely experience a good tasting, but perhaps slightly overpriced, meal served adequately in a higher-end feeling Chinese restaurant. The experience should be satisfying.  We stopped by on a Sunday around 5pm to have a light dinner. Inexplicably, even though the restaurant was basically empty, we had to wait 15 minutes or so before being seated. Not a huge deal, just would have been nice to understand why.  The decor is very nice. The service is barely friendly, but adequate.  We ordered some dim sum (they have a smaller selection to choose from for dinner) and a Wonton Noodle Soup. The dim sum (Chinese Sausage Roll, Shrimp Dumplings, Shrimp Chive Dumplings, Mango Pudding, and Macanese Egg Tarts) were all quite tasty. The Wonton Noodle Soup was definitely above average.  It's a slightly above average place to have some dim sum and/or Chinese food.

5xq4rXQDcC7cCJQBVuRr6A.text: Large variety of food and great service. I ordered the pineapple shrimp fried rice and I was pleased. The portion  sizes are massive. My husband and I decided, after we ordered of course, that we should have shared a meal! You'll definitely get your money's worth. On the way in, I heard someone say, "I hope you're hungry" to another person who was in line. Now I know what he meant by that. We went during the lunch rush and the line was very long, but we wweee seated pretty quickly considering  how long the line was.   The appetizers and single portion items are carted around to each table. My husband wasn't a fan of one of the items, and I'm not even sure what it was. It was some type of meat wrapped in cabbage. We also had sweet bread. If we had more time here, I would definitely visit again, especially now that I know what to expect, and the flow of things.

yVl_TRqlkn38oIihlzVe5Q.text: So since my last review I felt it was time for an update, since I have been here numerous times, being that I like this little locals casino it is in and partake in bingo with my mom here. A lot. (Don't judge lol)... =P  So they have moved locations since my last review, and it is now more central in the casino. Their decor is nice and updated. Also, they have greatly improved their service. They are a lot faster and efficient, even when busy. The food quality is still great like it has always been... my favorite dishes are the roast duck, honey walnut shrimp, and salted fish and chicken fried rice. Dim sum was good for the rare times I am awake early enough to partake.  But this restaurant has always been a reliable late-night, post-clubbing, post-gambling treat that I chose to bring out-of-towners arriving late who are looking for some quick yummy chinese food. Open til 3AM and easy to find? What's not to like? :)

EPlS_BzPb7_fDt6MA_Wu0Q.text: I travel quite a bit to Hong Kong so I have a high expectation when it comes to dim sum. So far, I like this place best compared to other places in town.   Location: inside the Gold Coast casino. Parking is free and easy. The only drawbacks about being inside the casino is since this is an old casino, I feel like the air is not well circulated. For that, I'd give 3 out of 5 stars.   Decor: They finished with the renovation couple months ago. The new place is next to the old one. It's bigger, brighter and more tables. They also have couple booth on the side wall. There is a section in the back to accomodate big parties. Overall, I like the new decor.   Food: They have shiu may, shrimp dumpling, congee, etc. We started with Crysanthemum flower tea for drinks. For the food, we ordered salt and pepper crispy tofu, lobster ball, chicken feet, sponge cake, special hearty chicken soup and sweet tofu for desert. I thought everything was delicious and tasty, except for the congee. The congee was watery today. I also wish they have a lot more unique dim sum dishes like in HK. One thing to point out, they are now offer fresh fruit and vegetables pressed juice which I love! I'd give 4 out of 5 stars.   Service is a 5 stars. They refilled our drinks and always checked on us, made sure we had enough food. They also made sure dirty plates were picked up timely so we had room for our upcoming dishes.   Price: Their prices are reasonable. Even though they are located inside the casino, they are not expensive. I'd give 4 out of 5 stars. It was 4 of us and we spent below $50 before tips.   I think dim sum place in Vegas can be improved. Especially in Vegas where we have so many casino high roller from Asia, there should be more options. But I like this place and the price are pretty good so I would definitely come back again!

HwK-0AwZktlFss5Cr4rOuw.text: Waiter is vey rude!! Food is not bad. If you just order 3 or 4 dishes, server will give you dirty look! All they want is big tips!

sJWqADfYeMLlgnzu-UD0gQ.text: Finally got a chance to visit after Ping Pang Pong's move within Gold Coast. I always thought the food here was good, but my big complaints about the old location were the terrible service and the invasive cigarette smoke that used to get drawn into the old restaurant. The new location of the restaurant seems to have mitigated both problems, as the tables are now set back much further from the casino floor and the better "flow" of the floor layout means that the servers can move around more easily and thus more quickly.  I also thought the servers were friendlier than before, but tough to draw a conclusion from just one visit. I'll update my review after some more visits and if the service remains improved, I think this could be a 5*.  As I mentioned, I always thought the food here was top notch and that hasn't changed. I did try one new dish, the jellyfish and roast duck with asparagus stir-fry in xo sauce, and that was killer. Old staples like the dragon well shrimp, lamb stew hotpot, and XO calamari with lotus root are exactly the same as I remember.  IMO Ping Pang Pong also is the best dim sum place currently open in Vegas.

d9yoezIFjjftqlAE3eibUg.text: Some dishes were I felt expensive, but except that a good place to try Chinese  Food: Good Price: Fair Service: Good Parking: Good

cD9gDU50fuJpR-Yi6hv5LQ.text: Went here Wednesday a.m. for dim sum. It's been a long time since I've been here, probably 6 years or so. Moved amd remodeled,  looks real nice , great service, no wait on weekday, food was pretty good. Had my usual steamed spareribs in black bean sauce,  chicken feet, siu mai, fried shrimp balls and found they also have spareribs and rice. SCORE. I had tea and wife had soda, they came back seversl times to refill her soda without being asked. Ladies with the carts can be a little pushy, but there just doing their job. Price has increased but still worth it. About $47.00 for the 2 of us, it used to be one of the  cheaper places to get dim sum in Las Vegas. Inside Gold Coast Casino on Flamingo.

Hr2lNspEnLR4g5gXS0QDEw.text: Good Chinese food. Haven't found a dish I dislike yet. Dim sum as well as food ordered from menu are really good

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum

4pXGyds7f40xfcHTsJ9__w.text: I love this place! I've been going to Ping Pang for years and the service is always great! Every time I come Cristy takes care of us and she is the best! Definitely my favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas!

K3xb5EYwRzVUzLHGKOWFtw.text: Came here last Tuesday for dinner, order preserve egg congee, beef ho fun and wonton noodle soup.  Comfort food at its best, fast and friendly service and real affordable for being in a Casino.  Been here at least 10 times over the past several years, never had a bad lunch/dinner.  Went there again the next day with some friends for dim sum.. For all those people who orders Orange chicken, Lo mein, Kung pao chicken and complains it's no good, next time just go to Panda Express and get your fix there.  I gave them 5 stars since there no one to compare them against.   YET...

WTiCGZ76x6eKnedHX_3heA.text: My first and last visit to PPP.  Overpriced, mediocre service, wait time on a non-holiday weekend was over an hour.  The waitress was abrupt with questions we had about less than popular meals, didn't seem interested in giving house recommendations and overall just seemed annoyed at human existence.  The food quality was basic.  The flavors didn't wow my palate nor my appetite. This place was a great disappointment considering all the rage I heard about it.  Go somewhere else unless you want that deep Chinese cuisine like jellyfish soup.

oYZTFI7j5BHeay6mqvAY9A.text: Possibly the best Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas featuring authentic dishes plus dim sum.  The new location inside the Gold Coast Hotel & Casino is definitely an upgrade with higher ceilings and apparently double the space of previous location.  Seems like the move eliminates the long lines of people waiting for a table.  Best dim sum in Las Vegas with fresh food served via tableside carts including the shrimp har gow and pork shumai...standards at dim sum.  Don't get seated in the big dining room with carpet because the carts aren't able to move in there which made it quite annoying to walk to the carts to pick food out.    I recommend ordering from the menu for dinner since dim sum ends around 3 pm.  All dishes are very flavorful and authentic, mostly Cantonese in my opinion.  Must try include the lamb chop appetizer, egg white fried rice, salt and pepper pork chops, green beans with XO sauce.  These are just a few recommendations but the menu has a dish for every palette!

s5U_ZYAqzVMLAblmnD-nNA.text: I am a Chinese and I have been to many Dim Sum places in the States. I don't even remember a dim sum restaurant being bad until I came here.  The sweet pork buns/rice cakes were okay. Everything else is horrible. So horrible that we only had one bite of three of the six plates and didn't want anymore. With tapioca duck egg, and beef balls we even spit out the first bite. Ugh. A waste of money.

5Vv29J9i1eQwA9nHXz_mTg.text: I love this place I've been going here ever since I moved here in Las Vegas and their food is always consistent, hands down the best Chinese restaurant here in Las Vegas.

HoWXMBFKp4nMVSS78jssXg.text: I order the egg fish.come out it is mixed.some is some is not. The big one is not. the slim and the small one is the egg fish They put the cheap other fish to mix up.make more profit

nza6XfHcdiVkQuGUdNaEFw.text: We came here for the dim sum, and it definitely did not disappoint. There was great variety to choose from and the food tasted great. If I was rating on food alone, it would be more likely 4 stars. However, what really detracted was the poor service.  My mom and I arrived first and we waited about 10 minutes in line when there was clearly plenty of empty seats. I got annoyed after I watched small groups of people bypass us in the line, walk straight to the hostess, and got seated before us. Whatever though, we eventually got in, and then had to wait another 10 minutes for our server to get to our table and set us up with silverware. We waited another 5 minutes until I was able to flag another server down and ask for drinks, and yet another 5 minutes for the dim sum carts to finally come our direction. I don't know, maybe it was the late afternoon and I was just hangry, but I was annoyed at the long wait for everything.  I wish that there was a menu available that we could look for reference as to what the different dishes were and what the price ranges were. The servers were abrupt when we asked what the dishes were, as if, come on, we're in dim sum territory, we should know what the hell we're doing. I felt that the servers took advantage of the fact that we weren't familiar with the language and the cuisine so they kept trying to ply us with every dish on their carts. I felt bad after having to say no very loudly multiple times, but I wasn't about to rack up a ridiculous bill!  Even then, after looking over the bill, I was annoyed that they charged for the tea!   Like I said, dim sum was good, but customer service was absolutely horrid, hence the 3 stars. Thankfully I'm only visiting family, but I won't waste my time coming back here in my return trips.

A8h7MCVRW1zIuangwuadrQ.text: This place is not good! The prices are too high. The service is too bad. The food is average at best. Do not come here. If you made it this far away from the strip, do yourself a favor and just go eat at a local place. I had lunch with my parents. It was not busy at all, but besides getting our water very fast, nobody came by to take our order. My mom went to the front to get the attention of the hostess. She was very kind and took our order. We got three dishes. Two were very average. The third dish was absolutely disgusting, and this is not an opinion. The pork chops and black pepper beef were okay. The pork belly was awful. The cook didn't even slice the meat against the grain which made it super dry and tough. The sauce it was cooked in was way too sweet. We couldn't even eat it.

L2717ty8yAHMVE_McemChw.text: We don't have favorite because everything they make is great. There is always a long line but it moves rather quickly, so it isn't a problem. Long line is a good sign.

r4-QUzcSEN13ikPqvivkZw.text: This is my go-to dim sum restaurant. I always go about a half hour before they open. The food is fresh and tasty. It's not as good as what you can find in San Francisco, but it is the best one I've been to in Las Vegas.   I've never ordered off their regular menu, so I can't comment on that.

BrQT8iTS9jpmrFlJ5MQX5Q.text: The wait was crazy long, went around 1:30pm on a Saturday. When we finally got seated the dimsum we wanted (popular stuff) wasn't on the cart, the ladies kept saying 'next time, next time.' When we finally got what we wanted the dim sum was very flavorful and tasty. Although the service was definitely a disappointment. 3 stars for taste, 1 star for service.

rHYwBFQa-UwWu0qNdMEcUQ.text: I had the chance to try this place out on one of my first trips to Vegas several years back.  I remember it being my first trip to the Gold Coast casino.  It appeared tucked away near a little food court, and the long waiting line made it recognizable.  I went with the standard dim sum fare available, soup was great, chicken wings were a little rubbery and way too greasy.  A few pushy people outside, as some other reviewers have mentioned.  I'd definitely go back, just haven't been on that side of town in recent Vegas trips.  I remember regretting not going back the next day, as the little snack bar beside it was terrible.

HxH1oORybr_ksSIFAsnK6Q.text: Overall good dim sum. Nothing crazy or over the top, but definitely a solid place to get dim sum while you're in Las Vegas and don't have a car.

fZGEShEAVKoK0s4doJoe4w.text: No matter how badly I rate this sorry excuse of an establishment, it won't make a difference because it has a cherry location and will always have customers no matter what.  That being said, the food was mediocre and the customer service was the worst I've encountered in this city.  I can't go into details about my experience without sounding like a bigot, so I'll just say this restaurant is a disappointment.

CFs1dEE2nLuOv_Q051zY9w.text: How the hell are Asians supposed to convince everyone else how offensive the term "Ching Chang Chong" is when we go off and name one of our own restaurants "PING PANG PONG"?   My Hong Kong-hailing real estate agent was visibly horrified when he found out in casual conversation that my parents and I had not yet been privy to the local dim sum experience at Ping Pang Pong (how is anyone supposed to take me seriously when I say this aloud?) in the Gold Coast casino. So while showing us detailed French doors, luxurious hardwood flooring, and expansive high ceilings, he kept peppering home features with "shao mai" and "cha shao bao." I was sold - on the food, not the house - so not long after that, it was off to Gold Coast we went.   The casino is not the most convenient to navigate, but the restaurant sits pretty much smack dab in the middle of it, and that's where my biggest issue with it lay. The restaurant is open to the casino pits with hip-level pillars that whisper, "Smoky Smokerson! Enter, please." On the flip side, however, the dim sum is solid. Every dish we hailed off the cart was well-prepared and got a stamp of approval. The xia jiao, chicken feet, congee - all good in the hood. It's just that this hood carries a bit of an eau de FUMAR!

xW5ITQI2fi_MOHIQl00K1g.text: My mom took me here so I can try this place out. She said they have more dim sum selections and what not.   I did not like the place at all. Seating sucked (if you're right at the entrance)  Not a lot of dim sum selection at all either. All the carts that came around were the same thing that passed us earlier. So a lot of the food I normally eat, they don't have.   Their portion is smaller as well. As in, most places give you 3 egg tarts and this place gives you 2. Same for other dishes like the rice wrapped with leaves.   Compared to DJ Dim Sum in Rio, this place has a major thumbs down in food and in service for sure. Don't think I'll ever come back.

4WdMtAyoqGqjCwRT04jY4w.text: I and my husband go there for dinner,I like this place, service is very fast,the food is good,we will come here again...

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck bbq pork ribs....

0Kxn6Xk1CVEb7dDOHq_gmQ.text: I love the crispy half chicken from Ping Pang Pong.. Only thing is every second time I come here it's been sold out! We've had to eat the half roast duck instead (also tasty), Kung Pao Chicken (yes I'm dating a white guy ;) We've had pretty good service everytime we've been here and also manage to get a table straight away. Most of the time we eat between 12 and 3am so they usually run out of the crispy chicken by then. Once we came at 7pm and the crispy chicken came out 5 minutes after we ordered it but it wasn't even crispy. The other 3 times it's been great. We like it spicy.   Dishes we don't like: hot and sour soup. It's not hot or sour... Just big. Wrinkly string beans - sounds exactly like what it is - wrinkly string beans, not the yummiest vege choice!   Dishes that are average: won ton noodle soup - it's also massive and has lots of veges, chicken feet - flavour is ok.   Dishes that we like - crispy chicken, pepper beef medallions,roast duck, Kung Pao chicken, Singapore noodles, prawn dumplings, Chinese brocolli.   Will we be back?  Yes!

xie4hf1XQkPzJAAzoubfVQ.text: Ping Pang Pong is a go to place for when some of my friends want to get together for crab. Their style of spicy and salty is probably the best. It is all about getting well rounded flavors and plenty of food. Their razor clams and scallops on the half shell are a steal. At $8 for four and two respectively is a steal. I could eat those all night. Just be warned that your breath will be kicking. So much fried garlic goes on top of both dishes.   PPP is a hit or miss. The green tea smoked duck was not something we enjoyed. I ended up just wanting Peking duck and was sad to see that they don't offer it. The sweet and pungent lotus roots are always a must. Add that with the three dishes I list above and you don't really need anything else.   The dim sum here is good. It is just pricey compared to other places.   Just be prepared. Don't expect great service. Just know something might go wrong during the meal and just move on. The food is good.

2o8CYk_Iis2UNFi01GZQKA.text: Service was good.  Dim sum was tasty.  The main courses were ok. For a casino restaurant,  it worked. However, why make the special trip?  If you like dim sum, I guess.

L4Gdlndy7aQ0OmPGbwIEiA.text: Ping Pang Pong is best dim sum place in Vegas except Jasmine in Bellagio. I've lived in Los Angeles for 15 years and I am telling you this is a really good dim sum place but you have to come here early. You have to come here before noon time (they open at 10am) to have most fresh and tasty dim sum. My fav dishes are sausage bao, custard tarts, porridge, pearl rice balls,har gow,scallions and chicken feet.  The only reason can bring me to gold coast hotel is having dim sum at Ping Pang Pong and hot pot at Noodle Exchange. Otherwise I would never step into this hotel because the environment. However I keep coming back here for food twice a month. Now you can figure out how much I enjoy their food :)

KG3NqQNvfVLb7LEuPuOzkA.text: Authentic food, but service was mediocre.    Dined with two friends on a Saturday evening.  Between the three of us, we ordered 7 entrees, 5 of which showed up promptly, but the final two -- ma po tofu & vegetable chow fun showed up 25 minutes after all the other five had been sitting at our table, and even then, only after we'd flagged-down a waitress to ask about their status.  Another example of waitress Ellie's inattentiveness (she didn't seem overly busy) was my iced tea glass would sit empty for about 5 minutes before she or someone else would refill it.  Chinese restaurants aren't exactly known for their great customer service.  I guess that's part of the authenticity of this place.  Another thing that I though was nice is that unlike many Chinese restaurants here in the US, this place didn't go overboard with all the Chinese artwork & other nicnacks that most Chinese restaurants feel obligated to put up.  Once my food did show up, it was good, but not good enough to make me want to go back.

q0-ULQHmG9bMhWX45YeugQ.text: I enjoyed it here.  Much more than I was expecting. Had a great brunch with my friends and we all got to pick all sorts of fun dishes.  Didn't see my chicken feet but oh well, other dishes to feast on!

RsdvxBU8b1TCUEz674JLtQ.text: I was determined not to give a single star for this restaurant but it wasn't an option. Tried 5 dimsum dishes and hate them all.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice noodle soya sauce was dry and tasteless.

xnlE200lIg2L-sAK2GTe0g.text: First time here... came for dim sum Prices seemed very reasonable for Vegas... most of our dishes were the medium price of $2.88. We liked most of the dishes, except for the siu mai- too many orange fish eggs on top and it didn't look appetizing, nor did it taste all that great.

Gh5E22HwGWTGu1F4X2Ib9w.text: Verdict: Awesome food and finally, some decent service!*  *service is unheard of at most dim sum restaurants.   The food is delicious here and definitely one of the best dim sum spots in town! Everything tastes as it should and nothing is overly salty or overpowering in anyway. Shrimp ball, beef ball with and without tofu, shrimp dumpling, shu-mai, tripe and pork ribs... everything was perfect.   The amazing thing here is that, not only is there service, but the staff is friendly as well! The carts come around more often than not and if you ask for something in particular, they will either bring it out to you or let you know if and when that cart is going to be making it's way back around to you.   Try doing that at any other dim sum place here in Vegas! Not going to happen.

8eqItcZZSXQXt36eunea5w.text: Good food at a good price. The amount of food is also very generous. Always get seated quickly and attended also. The honey walnut shrimp is the best. Hands down. Fried rice is good. The food is really tasty. It only sucks because depending on the table, you could smell the smoke from the casino. I don't understand why they didn't just built walls around it. It's good tho. Try em out.

jwLa6abGdNRpP0W-MKZToQ.text: When it comes to the dim sum: Har gow, shiu mai, sesame balls, chicken feet, pai guat, mango puddng, and all that other stuff of deliciousness, this is probably one of the cleaner, more efficient places I've been to. It's small so it's not chaotic. Plenty of food to go around and order.   For a chinese restaurant, the service is pretty decent. People are attentive enough to notice that a cart moving around isn't enough to meet all your needs... If you want to order off the menu, they got some pretty decent choices too.  For food, convenience, service, cleanliness, 4-stars.

baQQBerkkLPz-rOolCTbew.text: Its inside the Gold Coast hotel. Good food. Free bus from/to the strip.

6_fPxlNNiXsLSpSywukjeQ.text: Thanks to my parents for introducing me to this cool spot located in the Gold Coast Casino. Beats all the dim sum places I've ever been to in California! I heard this place can get pretty crowded but we went with a party of 9 at 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon (prime time for dim sum) and surprisingly, we walked right in.   There were plenty of carts full of food being pushed around the entire time we were there. We ordered the full gamut of dim sum dishes and all were full of flavor. The shrimp and chive dumpling was the best I've ever had. The shrimp was plump and fresh. The fried dumpling (hom sui gok?) was so tasty and not greasy like many of the other ones I've had. I didn't eat it but the only dish that I heard was was not a hit was the jelly fish.  Prices were reasonable, especially for a casino.   They also have a full cook to order menu but I didn't get to try anything off the menu. Maybe next time.

nbaq5xftX0iuIIrhsm_rOQ.text: A must if you're craving AUTHENTIC CHINESE food!!!!! My family was able to enjoy the delicious food and have a great customer experience. Their customer service is superb!!!

zyyHTEs5CGuoQsRf-HbvrQ.text: Food was horrible! Ordered $200 in take out food. Sold out of traditional roast duck at 10am? Shrimp with Walnut sauce very bland tasted like shrimp and mayo. Couldn't ear it! Rice 3 types, all the same- dry and boring. Pork belly was dried out. Chicken hot pot again bland and no taste. The only thing excellent is the war wonton soup. The spring rolls bland and very greasy. Satay beef tasted like Panda Express! Pork buns were dried out. Hardly any shredded pork inside.  The Noodle Exchange in the Gold Coast is owned by Ping Pang Pong. Same bland food. Not sure what all the fuss is over the dim sum. Way over priced and the wait service is horrible. Won't go back!!!!!

GYD0yLdbAEHNKIzqms3EvA.text: Ping Pang Pong is located in the Gold Coast Casino, which is on West Flamingo next to the Rio and across from the Palms. This Chinese restaurant was excellent and reminded of the Chinese restaurants back home in Hawaii. Excellent tasting food with good portions. We shared between 5 people 5 dishes and we were all stuffed after we were done. The Chinese tea was too light in flavor for me, but the 2nd pot brought out tasted better. We met family from Hawaii for dinner. Everyone loved the food. Well done! My husband is hard to please, local Hawaiian boy, he is so picky and he can't wait to go back. SO the food is GOOD!  And the service was well done as well. The service team worked together as a team to take care of us.

S6wzVFv4Jk_fTDQsweqGKw.text: Talk about a popular dim sum place! My family has loved this restaurant for a few years, but this was my first time trying it, so I was excited. We tried to get here by 9:45am so we could get in for the first seating at 10, but unfortunately we missed it so needed to wait 45 min or so as groups started to leave. And there continued to be a long line.   Haha, I'm impressed by the efficient design! The tables are arranged in a circle so that carts can go around to the tables and then replenish at the kitchen. Unfortunately since we were at the beginning of the second seating, there weren't many items we often like (chicken feet, har gao, siu mai) since they ran out. Fortunately, we got them as we were finishing up.  I really enjoyed something that seemed like shrimp tempura wrapped in funn. It was delicious! I also liked the eggplant shrimp (generous amount of shrimp inside) and roast pork. I also love gailan, and I appreciated that the sauce was on the side so I could control how salty I wanted it.  The baked char siu bao could've been softer, though, and filled with more meat. The butter buns were filled with lots of butter, though they could have been warmer and softer.  The service was generally good and some of the servers even smiled. If you're family with dim sum restaurants, you know that's rare.  I enjoyed Ping Pang Pong and would return again. Most of the customers were Chinese and other Asian, so you know the experience is really Chinese!

V5HI6BUfBjG5mPuNg5VzIg.text: This restaurant has the best Dim Sum in the country. Well worth the wait everything is fresh and the service is fantastic. I will return

vrBZoouTwNb4GMxWWuLWGg.text: We were craving dim sum for dinner and heard from friends this place was one of the best in town. Their dinner dim sum menu is limited to 8-10 items and char siu bao is not on it. We were disappointed about that but the dim sum did have was really good. I recommend the baked Bbq pork bun. The bun was flaky and fresh out of the oven.   Since most of our dim sum favorites were not on the dinner menu, we ended up getting the walnut shrimp and the yang chow fried rice. Both were really good and we left happy.

ngHQ7QK-jY5yssUHnbWQ8w.text: The Jasmine tea was perfect along side the Dim Sum!! Every food I tried was fresh and well prepared. It felt as if I were dining in Hong Kong. That is wonderful! Many other restaurants in town fall short on authenticity. This is a great restaurant and the service is very attentive!! I also loved the egg noodles, really crisp. The spring rolls were nice and the orange beef was superb. I admit, I ordered so much food that I had to take quite a lot home in a couple to go boxes. Hey, but that's a good thing!!! :))
