EHenhvgGwMgAxz5thQRjpg.text: Really enjoyed ordering different dishes family style and sharing. We liked the pork belly in clay pot, and an interesting dish with something called "wood ear mushrooms".    There are always a lot of chinese people here, just like their other restaurant Noodle Exchange, which is a good sign that the food is authentic/good. Just do not order the dim sum.. it was not fresh and seems like an afterthought.

KnIKch_tA4Ix4mxfA1GCJQ.text: Ping Pang Pong is one of the older Dim Sum joints in Vegas, they are located inside the Gold Coast casino, and decor was about as old as the casino.  The name sounds like a game of Ping-Pong with an odd tongue twister word in between, or a slang way to call a Ping-Pong ball in Cantonese.  If you park on the southwest side, you can access the restaurant quicker.  They are the second closest place you can get "edible" Dim Sum from the Strip area.  I visited here for Dim Sum on multiple occasions, and the quality was decent relative to everything else in town.  Selection seems limited though when compared with other Dim Sum joints.  Price was somewhere in between the residential area and the one next door.     Dinner was meh, everything seems a little off on the flavor, we got a few seafood dishes, tofu pots, and beef chow fun.  The food came out very slowly and their seasoning left you with a bad after taste in your mouth.  Not sure if I will be back when there are so many other opinions in town, and service was not the best either, they got the same poker face servers you see in most Asian restaurants...

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. XO rice roll

rl451XYmX4NE-B2-i8Nkug.text: We were looking for a Dim Sum place in Las Vegas and we found this one.  Yes it's inside a the Gold Coast Casino and it's a hike (keep that in mind if you have older dim sum guests with you). We arrived later than we normally do for Dim sum so I really think our choices of the little bites of food were limited. They close at 3:00 pm and the last rounds of food were the repeated rounds. Nothing new was added. We asked for a new dish and it would be a 15-20 minute wait, so note to self arrive at the usual time to receive the grand selection of dim sum.  Yes we will visit this dim sum restaurant again, but around noon next time.

ErVOv8d9HMQrUmi19VnoAw.text: Im been here a lot.Food is good.But this time I come late.Almost close to the lunch.One food lady is super mean!

H8FwcN2mIQl_Pvf-BpLb4A.text: Some locals told me this was the place to go  for dim sum in Vegas, so I went during lunch with a friend. There was a line at 12:30 on a Tuesday and lots of Asians. Pretty good signs. We were seated pretty quickly, and the carts came around regularly.  They had a good selection of dishes. We had buns with BBQ pork inside along with calamari, two kinds of dumplings and roasted pork. Everything was really tasty and it all came out to roughly $30. I wish they served soup dumplings, but they don't. There's a place in Paris that does. All in all, a good experience and value.

gX89ojAvSxey0AOJSNboxg.text: 1st off the decor of the restaurant was nice and the staff was friendly. The restaurant itself was smaller than I thought it would be and had 2 main dining areas. It was pretty busy when we went but didn't seem overcrowded like in most Dim Sum restaurants.  The food at PPP is decent. We had the dim sum staples like Har Gow, Shaomai, Beef Balls and fried shrimp balls. Nothing really stood out from the dishes we had. In addition there didn't seem to be too much variety in the dishes. We had asked the servers if the Chinese Broccoli and Sesame Balls were coming out and they said soon. 3 passes later with the carts and those 2 dishes were MIA. And this is at 12 during the middle of lunch? I didn't get it.   One other thing that was a turn off is the fact that it is located in the casino and is open where you are exposed to the smoke lingering from the casino.  I have to say that I was a little disappointed after eating here. I had heard such good reviews on it but in the end I would have rather have eaten at Orchids Garden. It was a nice change but I would have to say that I will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining Area
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

I2fOvuneTursjSdRaeKm9A.text: Newly Renovated. Good food. Went here for lunch. The place is packed. Line gets really long. Paid about 20 bucks for 10 sets. Amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Y-aTsiFTY3on27RztfKUg.text: Ping Pang Pong is in the Gold Coast Casino Waiting in line is part of the price. So go earlier than  normal dinner time The food in very tasty and everything that I have had there is good Prawns with walnuts great, Market Fried Rice um, wrinkled green beans good, visit this place every time I go to Vegas Its 4+  Price good, service after you get in good  You get in quicker if you have an Emerald Casino Card

RBThOiUM8V2a_NCMqHc4YA.text: Very good Dim Sum. We had the typical fare...shrimp, noodles, chicken feet, tripe and potstickers. They were friendly enough with very good service. We got there about 1:30 and for Dim Sum that's a bit late, because they start to run out of the good stuff i.e. Duck, roasted pork etc. Some of the dishes are were a bit cold but when we told them, they cooked us fresh plates. That is a big reason for the 4 rating. I'd go back it was done well

4jk9Glne9AHkBtxPRZSJ1g.text: My sister and brother-in-law are huge fans of this place.  They rave about it all the time and every time they are in Vegas they have to go here at least once. Thus, I was excited to finally try this place out.  However, it certainly did not live up to their hype.  Ping Pang Pong is located in the Gold Coast Hotel & Casino.  They serve dim sum from 10am to 3pm and reopen for dinner from 5pm to 3am.  We were able to catch dinner last Sunday.  Wait time was not bad at all.  However, service was not the best.  It was such a hassle to ask for anything besides placing our order.  We ended up ordering fried flounder fish, snow pea leaves with roasted garlic, and the satay beef with enoki mushrooms and pineapple.  Every thing was served family-style and arrived fairly quickly.  The fried flounder and pea leaves are things they always order.  It does not have strong flavors, but when paired with the dipping sauce it certainly hits the spot for a good home-cooked meal.  The satay beef, however, was beyond greasy.  I swear eating it can cause bad heartburns.  This place is definitely not a must when visiting Vegas, but not bad if you are in the area and want authentic Chinese food.

Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Satay beef with enoki mushrooms and pineapple

Ox6si8sI55qojYLLoR6m2w.text: I visit Vegas for trade shows a lot and always wanted to have authentic dim sum. As far as I know, this is the only Chinese restaurant that serves dim sum and its authentic Cantonese style. There're tons of Chinese restaurants along Spring Mountain Road but the food is mediocre at best. But not Ping Pang Pong. This place serves a good selections of dim sum. Recently relocated next door inside the Gold Coast casino, the restaurant underwent some remodeling and the decor looks inviting. Service was expedient but someone unfamiliar with the Chinese culture might find it annoying as servers keep rolling their dim sum carts repeatedly and ask you to order. Overall, this is definitely a gem in Vegas.

Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e0ZBTBf9__eGIg_cP4CzmQ.text: My fave dim sum place ever!!! All is good there. I haven't found any of their dim sum taste bad. My fave is their snail. Yummy!! I never found anywhere else sold it.  If you come after the dimsum hour, don't b sad. Their dinner entree is great too. I love their black pepper beef udon. It's my fave. The beef flat rice noodle is delicious. Roast duck, woww!! Super good. And don't forget, walnut prawn. Never get wrong. If you are vegetarian, they have this mushroom entree. Three mushroom in oyster sauce. I like it a lot.   Service? I don't expect much. But so far, I'm happy with the way they serve. Fast n alert.   I will always keep coming back here.

vQ5BtWcUpvd0bBw29HcwXg.text: As far as I'm concerned, this is the best Chinese food ever. It's Chinese street food and you know its good because the place is absolutely packed with people till the wee hours of the morning. Sometimes there is an hour wait in line, but its worth it. I haven't  had one thing there that I didn't like. We try and eat here every time we visit Las Vegas and it seems everyone else does too. Its not fancy, but the portions are huge and food excellent. It's as authentic as you can get without travelling to China.

XG2ejaFO3Ww-eINRi4aXrw.text: I love the rice!!!!  Very delicious food. The service mmm was okay, but I love the food!!! Everything  I recommend

ipnAnUDp7QKz-Qhqfbagpw.text: Craving for Chinese food at midnight? This is the place. Food are authentic , service are good ( not over the board) . Best,the price is totally affordable ( we end up ordering too much . Doubled what we can eat. Luckily we got a few team members who are in their room hungry. So all worked out.)

D1Kj21hzE4S4o42VsI3jyA.text: Not good. But cheap n dish size is quit big. Very crowded n don't know where the long line comes from.

0UbGUtbybsRLHUK9Ofm7kA.text: Maybe more like 4.25.  It did win some kind of top 10 award for Chinese Restaurants in T + L magazine but other than dim sum, I haven't been to PPP for their regular menu for quite some time.   About 4 or 5 years ago, my sister swore by this place for decent Chinese food. Now it has a lot of competition. So basically, I'm just reviewing their dim sum service.  I had to explain to my husband the difference between AUTHENTIC Chinese food and Chinese food. I've learned that some (not all) that call Panda Express and PF Changs Chinese food may not like AUTHENTIC Chinese food. They are not one and the same.  There is a definite difference in quality compared to other favorite dim sum joints I've been too. PPP is hot & fresh and definitely tasty. I must emphasize HOT because that's the biggest blow for dim sum lovers - cold food! I wouldn't recommend it for 1st time dim summers though unless you speak fluent Chinese. I'm half Asian and can decipher a lot of broken English, but I've had a very difficult time figuring out what the cart ladies say is on their cart. My husband and I are not as adventurous, so we are the types that want to know what we are eating before we eat it....  But once you can identify a food by looking at it, PPP is definitely on the higher end of the spectrum for taste and quality. Their shrimp dumplings for example - are probably the best I've had and when you think about a simple dumpling is made - you have to admire that somewhere in the process, PPP does something spectacular.  The shrimp balls, shumai, pork buns, sticky pork buns - all have a little extra something that sets them above the rest.  The restaurant itself is quaint. You can see the kitchen from your table, and the a lot of what, in most places, is normally behind closed doors. Goldcoast is not the most glamorous of casinos... and the restaurant itself is still a good ways from the parking garage. But if you don't mind walking through the casino and the smoke that comes with it, the location may work for you.   Plus, if you are a dim sum for breakfast person like me, they do open a bit earlier than a lot places around town 10:00am.  So if you enjoy dim sum, PPP is definitely a must-have on you're list. You just have to, even if it's once.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum!

n2LyvTN-2iPR84boaYGjig.text: Overall, this is a decent dim sum. From a lot of the rave reviews, I expected it to be great, but overall, it was good...a few better spots I've personally tried in town. We ordered a little bit of everything here, and mostly everything was good and fresh. I always like the pork buns best...and the shrimp balls were all great! Pic 1 : yelp.com/biz_photos/ping... Pic 2 : yelp.com/biz_photos/ping... A few items, like the salt and pepper shrimp, felt like they were sitting for a little while, and not as hot as they should be. Noodles felt a little undercooked or old. But overall, it is a good dim sum here...just not the best I've ran into. Pic 1 : yelp.com/biz_photos/ping... Pic 2 : yelp.com/biz_photos/ping... Dessert was great...tofu pudding! One of my favs! Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/ping... I took many more photos...just click the picture link on the top of the review if you would like to check them out. They are located inside Gold Coast Casino! Check it out for late afternoon dim sum!

HwHV8Z_DdTB47jjpYuiI7A.text: Besides the name being cute and funny there wasn't much else.  There was like only one waitress that was working the table and the carts coming aroubd were pretty slow.  Dim sum variety were pretty typical and looked liked it was frozen, defrosted and put in the steamer for display.  The tastes of the dishes were mediocre. The unexpected delicious treat was the coconut bread which was sweet and filled with coconut gooeyness.  Other than that, I have had better dim sum in la that were bigger in size and fresher in taste.

Ead9ocBM3VBBv1o2vGrK6w.text: very enjoyable dim sum . likely best for the money of any casino restaurant dim sum. but pricing still was significantly higher than the equally good dim sum at hong kong garden , and hkg has more varieties including a great fried shrimp wonton choice

04mA5kSxCsSMCRYLXLSQfA.text: I ate here June 15 during dinner service. The food here is delicious. I really liked the salt & pepper pork and the scallops. But what I didn't like was the service. It took the server approximately 22 minutes to take our order and another 20 minutes for our order to arrive. What I also don't get is why the server didn't give us knives after serving us our porkchops. How were we suppose to cut it? It took another 10 minutes for them to give us our knives. I was already starving. The server was also cranky.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange steak, salt &amp; pepper pork, egg fried rice, and scallops.

4XwrujfJMZ-lOoDS5wTfXA.text: It was my first time eating here and the food was absolutely delicious!! My girlfriend and I ordered the chicken fried rice, fried calamari, Mongolian beef, and wanton soup. The chicken fried rice had a different flavor and wasn't a bad thing. The Mongolian beef was a bit salty for my taste but it wasn't that over powering. The fried calamari was probably my favorite dish. The wonton soup was just as good. The portions are pretty large so choose wisely. My complaint about this place was service. Servers weren't attentive and it took forever to get refills and what not. But the food did come out pretty quick and they're open til 3am. If you have a late night craving for Chinese food, come to Ping Pang Pong.

I_EF3xuTw7s2VaNkHbbfcA.text: Definitely a wonderful experience!  Took a trip to Ping Pang Pong last month and it was a great experience, the servers were very helpful, always stayed on top of seeing if our table was doing well. Our group was really big, we took about 8 tables and it was never a moment where there was not any dim sum on our table. The servers did phenomenal job in providing a vast amount of dishes to our table and to the rest of the tables.First time at this dim sum location in Vegas and it is definitely one of the top choices in Vegas to eat great dim sum.

8H5d7FYf6onwVqV6aCSQ1g.text: Food was great. Service was awesome. Clean and neat. Delicous siomai. Luv it! Highly recommended place to eat. Will go back again soon.

K5fKDGgpMaw51Pna87YgtA.text: Great food, lovely atmosphere, incredible place to dine when celebrating with family, however, the service could be a little more friendlier. Miss yannie Wang was our primary waitress and came off a bit rude and made a rather insulting remark to my mother-in-law. However had it not been for such a distasteful waitress this experience was good in all!

ixyHbN3XK6IdFeeWoJH5Tw.text: I went here for simple egg drop soup. If you like good egg drop soup don't go here. If you want to spend 8.00$ on crap filled with tomatoes and random crap this place is perfect. Icing on the cake is I'm allergic to tomatoes,  never in my life have I seen it added to egg drop soup. Complete waste of time and money.

i7uYsRC32sG3oFu-Rft9yg.text: PINGing with excitement, we were thrilled to try out some dim sum while in Vegas. We ate here with some friends that had lived in Vegas and said this was one of the best places for dim sum. We arrived here around noon, and there was a bit of a wait, since there is limited space in the restaurant, especially for large parties of more than 4. Ignoring our PANGs of hunger, we waited patiently. It probably took us about 20-30 minutes to get seated.   While the selection is more limited than other dim sum restaurants, they do you have your standard dim sum items like shu mai, sticky rice in lotus leaf, fried taro cake, chicken feet, spare ribs, congee, and bao.   The items were hot, and fresh tasting. The carts went by at a decent rate, but we were warned that you should get any items you wanted while the cart was there, since you might not see that cart again. Prices were a bit high compared to other restaurants I've eaten at (3-4 dollars per item average), but that was to be expected for dim sum in a Vegas casino.  Service was a bit spotty, but to be expected since the restaurant was filled to capacity with hungry diners. Waiters were buzzing back and forth, like a ball in a PONG game, filling water, getting more tea, and getting people's checks.  So if you're hungry for dim sum, this restaurant is a good choice. If you are with a larger party though, it helps to come here before noon when it's less crowded.

dENIb2ga8dM0zSMHy_J9TA.text: The food was good however the customer service was horrible. Our server did not check on us to see if we were ok or wanted a refill, we had to ask the JUAN for everything he was great. the server also failed to order one of our entrees. Alot of the employees seem like they dont know the menu.

kRl3qqr0U53yjcnobxiXBA.text: Very good food, reasonably priced. Fast service. Would come back again. Beer and wine only. Only criticism is the menu could be more extensive

bNp9eLCDmum09lahQ59xbg.text: Yes, they have unique dim sum that you don't find in a usual dim sum restaurant, but the quality of the food is not the greatest.  Here, what you pay is what you get. The restaurant itself is pretty small, so we were lucky to get the big round table. Tea is good (we got chrysanthemum ). The staff was nice and they weren't mean like typical Hong Kong staff. However, the Chinese restaurant in Rio has way better dim sum, and the quality is a lot better.   Here's a summary of what we ordered & what I can recall :   Chicken wrapped in Lotus Leaf - Only get 1, and it didn't taste fresh/moist. Rice was a little hard. Sausage Bun - Bun wasn't soft and sausage was not the greatest.  Chicken Feet - Probably the best thing we ordered - Came with 5  Ha Gow (wrapped shrimp) - Small - We ordered 2, and 1 came with 4 pcs, and another came with 2 pcs. Inconsistent. Turnip Cake - OK. Same as everywhere else - A little dry. Beef rice rolls - OK. Same as everywhere else Baked Pork Buns - OK.

V2lujzTfd33-q5He0Qz3lw.text: If you hungry don't come here it about 1 hour for bring your food out but if u like duck bone this restaurant it good for u :/ never again....

gR1x7FjIZZ1JYXUl5vPW7Q.text: Impressive prices, authentic Chinese food with a few Taiwanese flares... and, attentive service. We're no longer driving to Chinatown when we're in Vegas - we're coming here. Great spot!

VpvAMmjvCIs6IbvO9A8jkA.text: I love dim sum, but there are definitely other places I would rather go to. They got us in right away and the service was good but they're kinda passive aggressive

sS1PR_9vYSIcsvV-a5MB9w.text: I've been here only for dinner and also ordered to-go a few times and they've never let me down! Old school Cantonese food and heart warming meal.  Har Gow (Shrimp dumpling) is my favorite, good thin but chewy outside part, it's perfect texture.  I'll be back to try Dim Sum Lunch someday!

fVJMU1X5IpaG_O5Q_DZ41A.text: Takeout Chinese!!  On a Friday!  Before it gets busy!  The best!!  Quick! Enough food for several days!!  This place is super awesome!   Order before u get there & remember the ticket number (Chinese food plus a memory test at the same time)  The get:  plenty of food 1. pork filled potstickers x7 - huge size & good with tasty dipping sauce $7.95  2.  classic Cantonese beef tendon brisket stew aaaahh can't go wrong with nice beefy tendon $13.95  3.  orange chicken - well this hits the spot $12.95  4.  mandarin beef filet - comes on a bed of white onions so u get some veggies & again done just right  $16.95  Overall, this is Chinese food executed as well or better than most places.  Even though it's in a casino, don't let that deter you from grabbing & going.  1 dish is plenty for 2 persons unless you want more variety or just are super hungry.  Then get a minimum of 2 dishes which reheats well for later or in 2 hours if you feel hungry again.

Rjssgjbyxg4Ah_PUCwuj0A.text: Located inside the casino this is the go to place for many asians looking for dim sum. We stopped by for lunch on a Saturday. It gets busy fast and people are waiting as soon as it opens.  Good quality. Lots of variety. Flavors are good but also what you expect.   The cart attendants are friendly enough. If there is something you are looking for make sure you ask a dining room manager.  About what you expect for value for dim sum but not outrageous. They can accommodate big groups too.

NGk1AhCWyaQadXrF-r1XKA.text: Came today for lunch before heading home from Vegas. This place was recommended to us by one of our Uber drivers during the weekend. I was kinda skeptical because the restaurant was located in a hotel and didn't seem very authentic but it was actually really good! We came Sunday during lunch and there was NO WAIT which is basically unheard of for dim sum even more so in Vegas. It's cart style Dim sum which is the best and only way to go. Prices were fair we paid about $120 after tax and tip for 4 people. We ordered A LOT of food lol. Service was above average for a dim sum restaurant. They came around pretty often so I didn't feel like I had to wait so long in between. I will definitely be back!

wiukLkzyg7zNeTyQ_yq83A.text: The food was good and love the decor. If you don't know your Chinese dim sum dishes, ordering can be a little confusing. The wait staff were friendly.

g9nAIZX_TmYo2HxUVv4Ofw.text: This unusually named restaurant has morphed into one of my must-visit places to eat whenever I come to Las Vegas.  It is located within the Gold Coast Hotel and Casino on Flamingo Blvd.  It is a new location within the casino which allows them to have more customers at once.   This recent visit, there was a line to get in, but it moved pretty quick as we were going there for lunch.  They have items you can order ala carte, but dim sum is what we came for.  The carts didn't come around as fast they usually do, but I think it was because they were kinda busy that day.  If you don't know what it is on the cart, they will describe it to you and even show it to you.   The pork buns (or manapuas as we call them in Hawaii) were warm, soft and tasty.  The pork hash and shrimp drumsticks are very good and worth a return visit.   I would recommend getting there when they open for lunch and the turnover is faster to get a table.

8Qiqf5WOMym5JK7lVFK_WQ.text: Okay, I really did like the the interior part of the restaurant, because it made me feel like I was in a Rush Hour movie. It's definitely a beautiful restaurant!   We were one of the first tables that arrived when they opened and to my disappointment, not all the dim sum items were out yet. Therefore, we had very few choices. The dim sum here was definitely more expensive ($4-$10), but it was delicious!   Um, I'm not a huge fan of the service. It all felt very passive aggressive and no one smiled. Our waitress had a RBF (resting bitch face) the whole time serving us.   Overall, It was a decent experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MOOn8Hz59iSRbd8JXpFn4Q.text: My wife, in laws (who are Taiwanese), my dad and my family came to eat dim sum here on Tuesday around 11am.  The first thing to know is that when I called to ask for the wait time, the host just said that lunch is served from 10a till 3pm and repeated it again when I asked to clarify my question.  When my wife called to ask this question about 1 hour later because of an unforeseen delay, she got the same response.  We both asked in English.  The authenticity factor just went up before even getting there.  Lots of again people were eating here which is a plus.  The dim sum is good.  I know there is a China Town here in Vegas but for something this accessible just off the strip, it's pretty good. They have a good variety. Everything is standard of what I would expect.  The food comes on carts and stays warm.  The red bean sesame ball was still warm when biting into it which was lovely.  They also had a savory Shanghai style pork bun.  I'd like it to have a bit more frying in the top but it was cooked well.  The minced pork in fried mochi could have had a little more pork.  The cha shu bao baked was great.  Sweetness with a stick bun filled with barbeque pork is baked well.  I've had bigger, but not at a dim sum place.  The kicker was dessert.  We had the doh hua, soft warm tofu in a ginger syrup.  The consistency should be soft and melt in your mouth.  It should just fall apart with the slightest pressure of your tongue.  They nail it here.  My father in law says this was the best since he was last in Taiwan.  It even prompted my mother in law to try some and she usually doesn't eat sweets.  She really liked it.  Like all dim sum, go with a party of at least 4 or you'll be full by the 4th dish.  Happy eating!!

HicPKWBeSQQunGZZsZCbpw.text: My coworkers wanted to try this place so we came here around 10:40 about 40 minutes after it opened. The lines were extremely long, and the majority of the people eating here are mainly Chinese.   The service was pretty phenomenal and the food was pretty good. When we wanted specific items the wait staff hurried along and grabbed it for us.   Tea was always refilled whenever we opened the pot lid and sauces were grabbed for us when requested.   Ha Gao: I liked this a lot. I thought their wrapper and their shrimp were really springy and delicious.   Sumai: they put some fish roe on it which I thought was nice.  Gai lan (Chinese broccoli): was nicely steamed or poached. I greatly enjoyed this.  Chinese Noodles wrapped Beef/Shrimp: The beef was amazingly delicious.   Fried Calamari: Needed a tad bit of salt but otherwise very good.  Fried Fish: This was one of our favorites, highly recommended! I think they were fried anchovies.   There was also a bunch of other stuff that I can't recall but I had a really good meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried fish
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gai lan aka Chinese broccoli
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried tofu

CD74ijs9_X3OpvSuuQ-E6Q.text: We ordered the gobo beef, salt and pepper pork and Westlake beef soup. All were excellent and tasty.  Service is as efficient as most Chinese restaurants are. Staff has no time for small talk as they take orders and bring the food without much "is everything ok" follow up. Not a big issue as they still stop every time we need something.  The entree prices are up there in the higher range of a typical Chinese restaurant. But come on- $3.99 for fountain drinks?!?!?!?!  No joke.  Good place and good food all the way around.  Will come here again and drink water or tea next time.

T35VjkOG0zKxWtOQy-XCYQ.text: Came here for a weekend trip some friends and decided to give this place a try since we were all craving some authentic Chinese food.  First off everything seemed alright. The staff was welcoming and decent. I had a party of about nine people but we all ordered small dishes to share. After eating we waited almost an hour to pay for our bill despite asking for it multiple times. After getting irritated we decided to pay up front.   So I ended up ordering a Lobster dish they had at market price to split and although I understood the price might be a little pricey I couldn't believe what they charged me for it.  A single Maine lobster stir fried in some ginger sauce.  Final cost. $136 for 1 dish.    This one dish cost more than everyone else' meals COMBINED at the table.  I was in disbelief but had to leave so we just paid and proceeded to leave.  But before we could leave, the waitress yells at us and says, "no tip?!"   Keep in mind we already left money on the table not including the money from everyone else.  This place is scammy and they know it.  Save your money and don't let this place hustle you.  Lesson learned.

vCFN-TsxQIdDt9Tgm7SB0Q.text: July, 2013 -Ping Pang Perfection. Despite our reluctance about the service complaints, we decided to eat a late dinner here. Although the place was very busy, the service did not suffer. We had black peppered beef, shrimp fried rice, and dim sum. The dinner was very good, Our server was pleasant and patiently answered all our menu questions. If you're looking for a quite dining experience, this is not your cup of oriental tea. If you want a good meal in a loud and busy casino, try it. Next time in Vegas, we will dine here again.  Sept, 2015- Second meal: Had the King Du pork chops (get them boneless) and fried rice. A great meal...one of the best sweet and sour dishes we have ever had. This place is now one of our favorites. If just the two of you, one entree and rice will be as much as you want to eat.  9/4/2016 - The Spicy Orange Chicken is a show-stopper.  8/30/2017 - The remodel has improved the experience - and still the same great food. Had to take our guests to experience the "Best Chinese Food In Vegas".  After eating here half a dozen times, I have bumped the rating to a 5 based on consistently great food.  Mar. 2018- Can't pass up the Spicy Orange Chicken. Have eaten oriental food all over the country, and this place is the standard we use to judge by. Yeah it's loud and busy...yeah the service can be brusque, and yeah it's in an off-the-strip casino, but man, is the food good.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Du Pork Chops.
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xcu4Uc0OMjbxS_5g1fLZ6A.text: UPDATE: went here with some friends on May 1, 2019-- still a crappy SERVICE! We also got the su-mai very late for some unknown reason.   2 stars because of the crappy service. The server or whoever doesn't even bother to check on us if we need something, were doing okay, or we are due of refill of our drinks. The lady with her tablet (our server) just passing us and doesn't even say anything or look at our table-- note this is a party of 10. We literally have to shout at her, because she doesn't make eye contact at us. She only smiled at the end of the service when we're about to pay LMAO because its an automatic gratuity for large party yeah  Foods are okay they are large portion good for 2-4 people. Shumai is alright, not the best one (imo)

XIWfgU_Fs43-TSvrWr1aBA.text: Not your average Chinese restaurant inside a casino in Las Vegas. Ping Pang Pong (I laugh a little every time I say it) is legit dim sum and a la carte Chinese dishes located inside the Gold Coast Casino.   We met friends who are regulars there and we really enjoyed our Sunday brunch. We ate siu mai, hargow, shredded pork dumplings, pork ribs in black bean sauce, sesame shrimp dumplings, house special fried rice and bbq pork buns. It was all good and I was surprised at how good the food was. I usually avoid eating Asian food inside a casino because it's usually a poor interpretation of the original cuisine but Ping Pang Pong is certainly the exception. Good, fresh dim sum served in carts the way they should be. There was a line to get seated but our friends were already there so we didnt have to wait, thankfully.   I really enjoyed all the things we had. They were mostly the typical things we order at dim sum restaurants we frequent in LA & SF except for the sesame shrimp dumplings and the shredded pork dumplings. Those 2 I havent had before and I really liked them both. The sesame shrimp one was little shrimps stuffed in rolled puff pastry. It was great. The shredded pork dumplings were like stuffed to the brim potstickers. They were tasty and were perfect with a soy sauce dip.  Service was friendly. We didnt feel rushed and our table was attended to at all times. Our drinks were refilled and anything we requested (chili sauce, lemon, etc) were brought to us rather quickly.   I highly recommend Ping Pang Pong when you're anywhere near the Gold Coast. Free parking and open til 3am!! What?!!

g6w28estoAVyGa2Er9GplQ.text: Sometimes you get a wonderful unexpected surprise... today was just the day! Came into my worlds best Dim Sum restaurant to see my worlds best server (LaLa), but she was not there. Ten minutes later, she and her 4 year old daughter Candace came in... just to see me on her day off! On top of that she brought me a gift and bought me lunch!!!  This just does not happen! What a kindhearted sweetheart! You have become a very special friend!!

GHPP6ZP6-DpCiw9KHFW5BQ.text: Forget about dimsum in Chinatown. Ping pang pong has the best dimsum in 702! Everything is so fresh, so flavorful and nice portions. This has been my go to spot since 2009 in vegas and I'm surprised not a lot of my friends know about this spot in Gold Coast Casino. Try it, you won't be disappointed :)

HeLk5jV7Lf0j-pRpO4t7Ew.text: This has got to be one of the best dim sum and Chinese dishes I've had in a while. I'm also visiting from Salt Lake City, UT where Dim sum is limited,  so trust me on this one. This brightly lit restaurant will catch anyone's eyes when walking through Gold Coast Casino. For a party of 5 around 845pm Saturday night, we were seated within 10 minutes.   Maybe the carts only come around during lunch, but for dinner services, you order from the menu. We ordered family style to try a little bit of everything.   ----Entree---- Singapore noodles: a little too salty for me, but overall, great flavors. Beef flat noodles: saucy and soft pieces of beef. Delicious!  Three mushrooms: my favorite dish because of the shiitaki mushrooms. Calamari with lotus root in XO sauce: calamari is great, but I wasn't a fan of the lotus root. It's got the crunchy texture of a water chestnut, except it's bigger. Salt and pepper pork chop: just order this. It's so good! Crunchy texture on the outside and soft pork. Just be careful you don't chomp down on the bone thinking it's the crunchy layer......like me   ----Dim Sum---- Shu mai: oh it's the best I've had!  Chicken feet: it almost melts in your mouth. Then you gotta spit out the chicken bones. Har gow (shrimp dumpling): can't go wrong ordering these Steamed pork buns: these are my dessert when I eat dim sum!

PS8dBUIdobdb3SWAItYz4g.text: I was disappointed my 1st visit here at Ping Pang Pong.  The fried cart was full of stale fried items like shrimp claw and my favorite egg tart and seaweed roll. I ordered Haw gaw (shrimp dumplings) the shrimp was also mushy.. that means its pretty old shrimp. I was offered beef and brisket in a bowl.. that was also below room temperature. Black bean spare rib rice was not hot either.. SMH I really don't understand how they could serve food below room temperature to customers especially to Chinese people because they are usually known to be complainers!  I ordered shanghai fried noodles thank goodness the kitchen prepared it and it came to my table hot.. It was good.  I don't think I will be back.

P3f4x-pntF-NSZq8SvTkMA.text: If you want to stay near the strip and not drive toward the "China town" or the "Asian area" when you're craving dim sum, ping pang isn't bad. The food here is just as good. I typically get chicken feet, rice noodle rolls with shrimp, and the beef tripe stew. Yummmm.

VPCs8-59BgpK_o-y3TQ9qA.text: Really enjoyed the vibe of this place. The food was really good and though the staff seem standoffish, they were all very attentive. Service wasn'tamazing, but wasn't horrible. First time I came here I ordered lobster and it wasn't good but the second time I got crab and it was fantastic. Oh, their coconut drink is to die for.

nRsAlT5vT-lIqYjb2CDR-g.text: Awesome food, reasonable price. Pretty good service for asian restaurant. But since this place is popular, so...be ready to wait in line for a very long time before you got the seat.

IbSLzwpKMIoH3-PPATMwbQ.text: I've been visiting Vegas many times and had passed by this place before (I even stayed at Palm Hotel last time which is just across street) but never thought about trying this place out. But this time when I was searching for a good Dim Sum restaurant this place just pop up. Coming from Bay area where we have so many good Dim Sum places, my expectations for dim sum are higher than just standard.  My husband and I went there on a Sunday and since they are open at 10am we planned to be there by 10am to avoid the crowd. And when we got there at 9:50am there was a long line already. But once they are opened we were seated accordingly so actually it was not too bad.   The food on the small carts came out hot (not the fried ones) and I was very impressed thay they even have my favourite dessert "Mango Sago with Pomelo" (it's a mango dessert drink that I had before in Hong Kong). All the dim sum items we ordered taste great,  their service staffs are very friendly and their dim sum prices are very reasonable. They don't make you feel that they are trying to rush you to leave like some other places.   Overall, I liked this place a lot and had enjoyed our meal. Will definitely return when in Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very reasonable prices for Dim Sum!

R-vjmtFp-OUi6hto3GcLPA.text: This just became my favorite Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas. The Sea Bass was amazing, salt and pepper pork chop was filled with spices and tasted so good but yet not too oily.  Can't wait to come back.

UIFKOhHvjlfFBvt4MkJGcg.text: A great dim sum place and still using the old carts instead Of ordering off the menu. It has the traditional menu items like hai gow and Siu mai as well as other old favourites. Being a tourist in town it was great but not that great as you can get the same value in Canada. I hope they have rice noodle dishes as it was kinda of a hit and miss. I will come again in the future.

8KxLGNBQ1aV6uOr4tewKsA.text: Food is good. For me most dishes can feed 3 or 4 people.   Dim sum are great appetizer.   4 dim sum plates and 3 main course items , $85.00

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And finally page 5. Now you can see what is really on the menus.
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page 4
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page 3

rx66_53ryq7Clvx2o-u75w.text: Quality of service does not match with its reputation  My boyfriend and i came here on a Monday. It wasn't a very busy time but apparently they didnt care about customer service. Too bad if you were seated near the cashier, because the food cart will never come to you. Their pad see ew was far less than satisfactory but was priced as an E($7). The seasoning wasnt mixed equally with the noodles. It's 100% not worth coming if you have to lyft here.

0JDv4IVxafGpNQTJz7eZeA.text: Slow horrible service. We were seated in the "VIP" section for dim sum on Sunday morning. Dim sum cart only came by once during our time there. Food was Ok. Never coming back here again. Dim Sum at Rio is at least 3 times better.

pggJngycZJHK79BPVhfRUw.text: This is my go-to Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas.  It's a casual atmosphere and has good tasting food.  It's similar in style to Sam Woo's in California if anyone is familiar.  The Pork Bao tastes great and so does the orange chicken.  It's not in one of the glamorous casinos on the strip so it may put people off.  Don't let that deter you though.  I

CmilvZhehXPegcm00NdMfg.text: I had good experience with this restaurant couple of years ago so I decided to visit again with my friend. And it was absolutely fantastic again!   However, When we got there, the host lady speaks chinese to us (we're not chinese) After we sat on the table,the server speak chinese again. Hmm wonder they thinks every Asian is all Chinese? lol  Anyway back to the story, The server was really helpful she explained about menus really friendly.  The food was little bit salty but after few bites, you will get used to it haha  In overall, food&service was good:)

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LEOWDxiS7fvKcPGaJWWXvQ.text: This is my first time in the Gold Coast. I was invited to eat here for mother's day dinner. The food, according to my youthful cohort, is thumbs up.  We all enjoyed the chicken feet and the three mushroom soup.  There were so many plates in the spin table to choose from, and I tried them all.  They were all tasty and interesting. Pricing is low for the quality and my party of seven had a good time.

hX_SFXpUz8yEvg86M1zEaQ.text: My family and I LOVE coming here. Hands down, the best dim sum in all of Vegas.  Ping Pang Pong is located inside the Gold Coast Casino. The restaurant is extremely big and can accommodate large parties pretty easily. Depending on the day and time, the line can get pretty long. My family and I usually come here on the weekdays to avoid the long lines.  Food is bomb. If only I knew the names, or even how to spell the names of the dishes we order. Most of the time we just point to what we want, if we don't know what they are technically called. Here are a few that I remember and that I would recommend: Siu Mai, Har Gow, Shrimp Ball w/ Sugar Cane, Chive Dumpling, BBQ Steamed Bun, Coconut Bun, and Egg Tarts!   The reason why I'm only giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's pretty pricy compared to other dim sum places.. and the service is sometimes bad.

Qq9ugwDXuH-S7fYrqn0bUw.text: Went there around 1pm in a Saturday afternoon.Q for 30 mins for a party of 3. Not much variety of dim sum left and the lady who is pushing the cart tell us no more choices and hard selling those in the cart. There is much better dim sum place along spring mountain and one inside Rio casino just next to it.

4bpsIY-WWPTB9cDwwpjnSA.text: Not many dimsum locations at Vegas. The dishes were good not much to complain , food came in carts pretty fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VowDl7bKCZRxExORrMfxYg.text: Not memorable dim sum.  Dim sum was priced at different levels (A,B,C,D,E) but menu wasn't clear in which ones were what price level. It seemed a little arbitrary when they stamped the card and although we ate what we thought were ordinary items, we didn't have any "A" items stamped.   It was almost an hour wait, so don't think we'd be back for dim sum that was just so so and somewhat overpriced.
