They should call this place Ping Pang Pow, because I was about to slap the dam mgr upside his fat head.  I gave a 20% tip anyways, our server was ok and I am not a monster.

uM3Vw9WwByITb_PoK-wIHg.text: Quick service, big variety reasonable prices.  My favorite dim sum place.  If you are new to dim sum, the big deal is to go between 10 am and 3 and ladies will come up to you with carts and tell you what dishes they have.  You might only take two favorites per cart, because you might not want to fill up before you have been offered a big variety.

jf3yWK9OXMPnGmTevyp05w.text: Compared to other dim sum places we've tried in vegas, PPP was pretty good. The carts come by often and there was good selection both times we've come. Only thing we tried that I didn't like was this spicy chow fun dish, it was flavorless. Also I wish they offered sate chili oil instead of red chili paste. Knocking off a star because they don't use sprays when wiping down tables, just the same gross rags (luckily I always have baby wipes on hand to wipe our table). Knocking off another star because it's in a casino and I hate having to come through smoking areas just to dine and leave smelling like smoke.

BojrhYQbdCZrk7Hbp9L9yQ.text: We were looking for a Chinese Restaurant that serves Dim Sum late.  We stumbled across this restaurant in the Gold Coast Casino around 1:30 am.  At first we didn't know if they were closing.  No one acknowledged us for a good five (felt like 10) minutes, and nobody else was waiting.  There was no staff in sight to welcome us or take our name.  Right before walking away, someone finally confronts us.  Because we were hungry and lazy, we ended up waiting another 5 minutes since the place was packed.    Once we sat down, service was tolerable.  Our drink refills came frequently, and the food was prepared quickly.  We got our Dim Sum fix with Shu Mai and Hargow...pretty average.  Everything else (Fu Chow Fried Rice, Black Pepper Beef, Kung Pau Chicken, and Walnut Prawns) exceeded the standard except for the Hot & Sour Soup.    Bad start...but good finish..

5-b3jtSrWL4N7EVACTI2_w.text: Best Dim Sum in town.  I will never eat calamari any place else as I have never found it anywhere else even half a delicious.  Prices are very reasonable.  The establishment is very clean and staff is friendly.  I recommend an early lunch about 10:30 or 11 as there can be a long line depending on the time you arrive.

d93f6FYZirUJqCM4r_qYxg.text: We had just had a disappointing Dim Sum experience at another place the night before- the other place had received a very good review too, so this shook our faith in the good ol' yelp system. Fortunately, it was a fluke. Ping Pang Pong was DANG near as good as our usual haunt in Portland. The service was good, the food was great, and specialty items were quickly cooked and served to us if they weren't already on the carts. My favorite little indulgence here was the coconut custard bun. Ambrosia! Another of our favorite dim sum stables is the stuffed eggplant, har gow, and sui mai- Ping Pang Pong delivered on all of them!

1mjgXJg_fQ6szkrDUS3DHA.text: One of our family's favorite place.  Love the food but menu doesn't seem to change.  Also food taste different even though we order same items almost every time.  IMO, food used to taste better before but changes for the worse over the years..  We still like it, just not as much as before.  My daughter loves Har Gaw skins..  Wish I can just order the skins only, Lolzzz.  I like the Walnut prawns and sauteed Green beans.  One thing I hate is that it is not closed in so you can smell cigarettes smoke from casino area

AC-TgdmAQ9l98Ni778i92w.text: Highly recommend this place for Chinese Dim Sum.  It is small, hidden away inside the Gold Coast Hotel and Casino.  Very well worth it to come and visit.  Their Dim Sum is so delicious.  I love all the foods there...chicken feet, hai cau, siu mai, dumplings, porridge, tofu, mango deserts, and on and on.   Seriously, who knew you can go to Vegas and get authentic Chinese Dim Sum.  Yummy!

mBJeMusjLued3WKNKFJjow.text: Great place if you are craving  for dim sum.  It's not far from Las Vegas blvd. They have all kind of dim sum like any other Chinese restaurant. And they taste good too.

cqRd19YuCk6m7ZOPLjpgmg.text: Food is okay, but like a lot of typical dim sum places the service is garbage. I've been to enough dim sum places in San Francisco, Seattle, and Vegas to know that they don't have enough carts going around to service everyone in a timely manner. We got there well before 3. The cart arrived once without some of the "basic" selections like Shu Mai and Har Gow. We specifically asked for the items, to which they said they'd be back with them. We then waited 20 minutes, and when we asked for it again they gave us the excuse that they weren't doing dim sum anymore. It took a chat with the manager for us to finally get some Shu Mai that looked like it was under a heat lamp for an hour. I posted a picture of it so you can see for yourself.   At dim sum places you usually have to be patient and go with the flow as barely controlled chaos is how they get things done. Usually, the experience is fun and more than satisfying. However, even with that said, I'd only recommend this place if you were hard up to find an alternative.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dried and wrinkly. Gross.

PWKbkEmScwAVGjkmYY1z7A.text: The best dim sum in las vegas. Always come here for fresh hot dim sum. Anyplace that has a wait, you know it will be good.

M85uqSS9moenK2Crfh1OQA.text: Second best dim sum I've had in Vegas :) their beef noodle is second to none. And their chicken stir fry as well as won ton soup is da bestest!

fWNkaFeINuz3Vx5UQxsICg.text: On the pricey side for Dim Sum. Lunch time on Wed, no waiting in line, but crowded. About 3-4 cart stops during an hour dining, so-so greasy food; got a lecture for complaining about bad rice with chicken without the chicken but shattered bones, etc. The usual Chinese-crap shit service. Tried it, now I can move on to another.

7k3cgdQC6j9jyZKenFxRkA.text: As usual typical Chinese service, when we first went there, they snapped at us twice, WE ARE CLOSED! We went back the next morning but they weren't open and then we went back a third time and then had to wait a while and they did not notice anyone in line waiting for a table. We ordered out as it had gotten busy with all Chinese people celebrating the day after Chinese New Year. The food took quite a while (we could have eaten a lot if we had just sat down), a few dishes I wanted like egg tart, sponge cake, leaf wrapped rice, they did not have but overall their dim sum was really good. They have won best Asian 2009 which is quite a feat for most restaurants.   Their baked BBQ pork buns were so fresh and tasty I had dreams about them only 1/2 hour after eating them. Because of these buns I am willing to take a bit of abuse from lousy service. Their pineapple  buns and custard baked buns were also really fresh. Their steamed BBQ pork and custard buns were good too. Their beef rice roll was small but good and their beef balls were only OK.   They had tons of authentic style dishes that my parents would love (but I don't), in fact I will tell them to stay at this hotel so that they can be close to their own food as they always complain they can't get any decent chinese rice anywhere.  I will definitely be back to try more and actually sit at a table when it's not so busy.

xhsHFW7EFBtTCqAwS_JIGg.text: Ping Pang Pong is definitely one of my top choices for dim sum here in Vegas.    First, the restaurant is small so it doesn't take too terribly long for the carts to circulate and deliver piping hot dim sum foods to you!  I am not a fan of luke warm dim sum.  This is often a problem when a place isn't busy and things circulate for too long or when a place is too big and the carts have travel vast distances from kitchen to patron.    They offer all of my faves like chinese broccoli with oyster sauce, baked char shiu bau (sp?), shrimp and chive nuggets, crab balls, chow fun, shiu mai (sp?).  OK, OK I admit I have absolutely no idea how to name or spell most of the hot tiny treasures but I love to eat them!  One complaint here at ping pang pong, is that they serve the oyster sauce on the side of the chinese broccoli....I must prefer a heart drizzle evenly over the top.    They are friendlier than most but still the service is abrupt, semi-angry, and without any normal pleasantries.  This is to be expected from most Chinese establishments, especially dim sum.  But the attitude adds to the experience if you ask me!    If it is your first crack at dim sum, this may be the best place to try it.  The ladies pushing the carts even explained what was in some of the items!  Revolutionary.    Dim sum at ping pang pong is better than most here in town but not the best ever, but definitely worth a try!!!

epMJibDeLSgE2ltIOGPkgA.text: I have eaten here many times, however I never ordered any entrees. Instead, I always go for the Dim Sum lunch....it is very good, and on par with anything you would find in Chinatown

FoW4iAzkWFveAGShQJ9kEg.text: It's okay.  Sorry I grew up on San Francisco's Chinese food.  I rather go to Orchid Gardens on Sahara!

mAWm6v-mFsQu0hPi3Sva9A.text: Here for a bowling tournament and found this place, right in the middle of the casino! This is one of the best Chinese food restaurants I have been to. Had Dim Sum and was not disappointed in the least! Everything fresh and delicious!

dlvzIs_wdVAAVCa_Vy-Hlw.text: I want to give  3.5 stars here.... food isn't bad at all for dim sum, and there aren't very many places that are off the strip that is good around here. This place has been renovated and much cleaner now and dim sum are tasty. Been here several times now and everything we've order were all HOT and tasty. Doesn't lack any flavors. Services is not too bad, but every now and then you'll need to get up to get someones attention and or retrieve food yourself. If you don't see what you're looking for in the carts please be sure to just order it and they will bring to you when its done.  This place is great for large parties as well, as they do have large tables near the back of the restaurant.   Check it if you're looking for something away from the strip and prices are reasonable.

xCcuBhjgJBrstya4R8ZzSQ.text: Awesome dim sum! I think this place is one of the best dim sum in town. It is crowded, so you may have to wait.

k4Y3Ofxr9HdWFW7sL8oxQQ.text: Came for Dimsum for breakfast on a sunday morning. The line quickly gets long so we arrived a little early so we wouldnt wait long. The way it works for those who have never been is the servers push carts with items, you ask for the item you want, they stamp your paper and at the end you get your bill. Everything we had was delicious especially chrysanthemum flower tea. Its a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half roast chicken
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

og-1WD9X9R5Sl4614KnGfQ.text: Not sure about all the hype for this place..... dinner wasn't anything special compared to other Chinese restaurants. Service was good and liked the Lazy Susan on the table for easy sharing:) :) Might come back and try the Dim Sum lunch one day hoping that bumps up the rating!

z-xzdF_4c1UAvVxENOo_aQ.text: Giving this place 3 stars due to the shitty customer service ! The waitresses are no where to be found. I ask for something & they cant bring you what you ask for. Other than that the food was good. They have to work on their customer service

RJfML6lP7Vtn3TaE4oATFg.text: The most authentic Chinese restaurant ever. This place serves a whole variety of Chinese food! It is the only place I go to when I stop by Las Vegas. On weekends they serve dim sum, so come early and expect a line cause there will be many others waiting for service to start.  If you gamble here in this casino, you get comps for this restaurant which is a bonus.

l-jy3fSqzs2T9rvyPjpw2Q.text: First visit after reading many positive reviews. Definitely not disappointed. Had the scallop and shrimp combo there and enjoyed a leisurely meal with a friend with two types of tea. She had a fried shrimp dish with a wonderful sauce. I took a shrimp fried rice meal to go. Good stuff. Great variety for me. Fed me the entire weekend. I'll be going back.

ETVDqK3fARQwBk48WfUk8w.text: A very nice place as a Cantonese Dim Sum restaurant! But just make sure you know that you have to WAIT for a long long time if you do not show up when they just open. A lot of people decide to order and pick up the food, it saved a lot of time for sure. You will see staffs who know how to speak Cantonese, Mandarin, and English push the dim sum carts around the restaurant and you get chances to try different food! It is not very cheap, but definitely worth to try!

Sv1EoL5RLm9cY7q3gHX-bw.text: My favorite dim sum spot in town!  They have a neat variety of items that you don't see at other dim sum places in town.  For example, they have this chicken rice cooked in tea and served in a bamboo container, fish paste balls mixed with cilantro and chives or green onion (I was such a piggy scarfing everything down that I can't remember exactly), and a fried Chinese doughnut stuffed with shrimp paste and then wrapped in a long rice noodle sheet! Say what?!  There is always a line, but it is worth the wait to try new dim sum foods!  The line don't lie.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The King Kong of chicken feet!
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm, silky, housemade tofu with a light ginger syrup!
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish paste balls topped with a goji berry, sitting atop some enoki mushrooms

3okabj1ZfpIB3PDCd90ojw.text: We love love love the General Tso's Chicken and the Kung Pao Chicken.  It's our favorite and every time we think about it, we start thinking about when we can fly back to Vegas to eat it at Ping Pang Pong.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mn4hPxdwjoeTrZmqHS2oDw.text: So far the best food I've eaten so far. We waited about 20 minutes to be seated because it was packed. Service was quick, food nice and hot and delicious. We had the sesame shrimp rolls and potstickers as appetizers. Biggest potstickers I've ever eaten and the sesame shrimp delicious. We shared a Mongolian beef and Yang chow fried rice also delicious. The portions are big enough for sharing. Didn't have dessert because they only had mango pudding and creme brulee. I was stuffed anyway, had no room for it.  We liked it so much we are going back tomorrow  Went back today and as the first time the food and service didn't disappoint

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R4jGUHBvRKWZ5mqnzURPbw.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I make it a point to stop by this place. The seating is always immediate and no matter how busy the place is the food quality is always excellent.   What I ordered today: salt and pepper porkchop- was hot, crispy,juicy and had the right amount of salt.  Walnut shrimp: sweet,savory and juicy not too salty like some other places and the shrimp were pretty big this time and the sauce was creamy and not watery like at other places.  Salt and pepper fried tofu: crispy, perfect seasoning and moist inside  Pan fried noodles with beef: the sauce was amazing,thick and there was a good amount of Beef and bok choi.  Would totally recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and pepper fried tofu
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan fried beef noodles
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and pepper porkchop

kwAfv0Aly9fb4xcXVagcjA.text: This is my favorite place in Vegas to eat. I'm currently here at 1am with no shame. I absolutely love this place. Prime example of a hidden GEM.

DFX260wb5g7t4gnbpMZu9Q.text: Not a bad place to stop for dinner. Located inside of the Gold Coast, this restaurant has a wide variety of authentic Chinese cuisine. They even have the menu options written in Chinese.  I had the Kung pao chicken. It was not similar to the Kung pao I've had in the past, as the sauce was thinner and there was not a lot of vegetables or peanuts in the sauce. Other than that I did think it was tasty, but I was not blown away. I must say the service was very good here. The servers came to the table often and you did not have to wait long for a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kung pao chicken
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fx47U5nJqnOsD8Y2fv5Rsw.text: Located in the Gold Coast casino, PPP is a good spot for dim sum if you're in the area. We arrived around 11:00 am and had to wait 30-40 mins for a table. You are seated based on the available table so a whole bunch of folks behind us were seated before us. I guess a party of 5 is too small for a table of 6. Dim sum is good with the typical offerings you would find elsewhere. Service was so-so as the place is pretty busy. I'd eat here again IF we're close by. Otherwise, I'm not convinced this is our go-to and will continue our search for our favorite LV dim sum joint.

J-_OXjPTfWpSpd1H4G0vUw.text: This is a review for Togo only! As a Gorl growing up in a Chinese family, I should be accustomed to bad service at Chinese restaurants. WRONG! Customer service is terrible. I've never been this upset at waiters and waitresses. They were rude and even when I explained I was just following what the other waitress had said, the guy and another waitress have me the look like I was trash and proceeded to make me feel even worse. Never coming back again.   As for the food, I came to try the shumai, the pork ones and har gow which are the shrimp dumplings after reading many good reviews and my friends telling me about this place. Aside from the service, the food itself was nothing outstanding. The taste was alright for the shrimp dumplings but for the shumai, it was like chewing malleable rubber. Each dumpling was like a small toy! I think that surprised me the most. For those who want to try dimsum and absolutely can't get any better, this place is okay, but for sure, there are much better options for me here in SoCal.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork shau mai

7BRHB7fthAzNZG2bdeWp8A.text: This is an excellent place for dim sum. Ping Pang Pong is a top choice to go to if you are in the mood for dim sum.

4aee63pAD3Jw9CIpzauZdg.text: We sat down and they started swarming like bees trying to slang their goods by placing them on our table. We had to ask for soy sauce and chilli which is weird cause it should be a given.... NO SIRACHA. The Chinese broccoli and shrimp dumplings were cold. Calamari was soggy, and salty.   I hit the Paigow table, 20 minutes later my stomach was mad rumbling.. Literally almost had an accident running to the bathroom.   This was the only thing I ate for 12 hours I am laying blame. Do not eat here, not worth fear of sharting all night ...especially in Vegas.

JBtome2NISfNOVyakdPc0A.text: Dimsum heaven that is near the Strip. It is located inside Gold Coast Hotel. Love their new deco and ambiance. They have a great selection of Dimsum and Chinese food. We enjoyed our meal. It satisfied our Dimsum cravings. Price is very reasonable. Servers were really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e4oPhxX8iy36sKGO3v1q-g.text: Recently went here and the dim sum was amazing. We showed up roughly 20 minutes before opening. There was a line already forming and we were probably the 6th table or so.   Right at 10, we were seated, carts were being pushed already. Service was great, water was constantly full, tea was refilled constantly, our table always had food and carts coming to make sure it stayed that way.   We had shumai & hargow. Obvious must gets. They were fantastic. Our tables favorite was the shrimp with the sugar cane and mayo dipping sauce. We ordered beef ribs, chicken feet, a rice dish with Chinese broccoli chicken feet & ribs, and we also tried some dishes I haven't seen at other dim sum places. Everything was delicious. We got fried tofu which was my least favorite but even being a non tofu eater, it was enjoyable. We got mango pudding and a coconut dessert shaped as fishes. Those were delicious. If you are planning to go here early, I would eat here slow. All the options aren't ready right at opening so when we were super stuffed and ready to leave, we saw fried turnip, chow fun and a bunch of other goodies.   For a table of 5 really stuffed people, we spent just barely over $100 which was a pretty decent price. Would definitely recommend and come back if I'm in Vegas.

MqZech8EIboQf8Fx2W01Xw.text: Can't come here for Dim Sum lunch. Way too busy. Wait forever. Although the Dim Sum is excellent. Dinner time is not as busy or crazy. All dinner items on the menu are awesome. The taste and seasonings are perfect. Nothing is too salty or overly spicy. Absolutely perfect food. Full recommendation for dinner. Service was also excellent tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken with black bean sauce. Again. Awesome. Very tender chicken and excellent flavor.
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese Broccoli with ginger. Perfectly cooked. Still some crunch. Great taste.
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian Beef. Excellent flavor. Highly recommend.

kMlhuhY4Bu54RR7gGCLEuQ.text: Not a fan of Chinese / Cantonese / Japanese foods as of lately but checked this place out because it's open soooooo late these two items are my FAV and I get them every single time , yes I've tried other dishes but man my taste buds callllll for these two dishes . The shrimps are BEYOND MEEEEE Ingredients are so simple but the taste surpassed any thought I had about eating food that I'm not too interested in clean quick FRESH latenight they need more stars the shrimps are wok tossed which makes them a little crunchy like which I LOVE you have your choice of shell on or off ( I keep them on for the flavor " and I don't even peel them THEY ARE JUST THAAAAT GOOOOOOOD must try !!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Flat Rice Noodles
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. San Pan Prawns

zJcNgRaHo2lyyjVyxQj8bQ.text: Bruh, I can't even explain how horrible the service is. As I sit here eating my meal I can only give the ladies who push the carts around any kind of gratitude. The servers and whoever controls everything besides the cart pushing has no type of customer service skills at all. None. Horrible. No water service for 15 mins. No markings for my dishes. Nothing. Thought this place held a higher standard than everywhere else considering it's inside a casino. Nope. Sike.  I'll keep going to Orchid Garden.

wWqyCBygOzdyA4GJcsp4TQ.text: Ping Pang Pong renovated to the larger location you see now, and oh man, it's way better now than when I went pre-renovation. It's like the classic Chinese restaurant that you go to when your family is in town and they're craving classic family style dishes.  The dim sum in the morning is pretty decent with average prices for each dish. The staples (shu mai, har gow, etc) are pretty good. The wrapper for har gow was slightly chewy with some bite to it while the shu mai had a good interior texture. It's warm, steamy, and savory-- everything you could ask for in dim sum.   For the dinner menu, we got the salt and pepper pork chop and string beans. The pork chop had a crispy exterior and the meat itself wasn't overcooked. No complaints from me about the salt and pepper pork. The price point is a little high for what you get though.   Overall, Ping Pang Pong is a good restaurant when you're looking for class family style Chinese dishes. If you're looking for American Chinese food (orange chicken, broccoli beef, etc), this place may not be right for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese sausage bun
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner dim sum

Ob2TZP73ejlKmzhoVPf-5Q.text: We stopped by here for breakfast before heading back to CA. This restaurant is inside Gold Coast Casino. It was quite busy when we came, however, taking 20 mins to get water is not acceptable. Moreover, the service here was bad. It takes a loooong time for our foods to come and no one push the cart to our area. When we called a waitress- she kept saying that it is not her section and left. Until I noticed the manager that we have not been served then we got some foods. The foods were alright. I like their egg tarts and shu mai. The Haw Gao is a bit tough.  Moreover, we came in as a family of 20, in 2 slit checks and they had a mistake on the 2nd check, where they over charged. It took us extra time to have that fit too. I would not come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SHU MAI
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. EGG TART

tTRYQhuS6EtX3T-F4OPJRg.text: The restaurant has a nice authentic ambiance and cleanliness. Easy parking, easy to find in the casino & we were seated immediately. Excellent food, fresh to high standards! I'm from LA, where we have a reputation for competitive yum cha. They do the traditional server carts, which I prefer. With this style, I expect the dishes not to always be piping hot but the freshness, quality and taste is everything. Every dish we ordered here was made exquisitely. Not too oily, not too salty.. all taste was well balanced. The tea is super hot and delicious to wash it all down. The staff were super hospitable and actually friendly! It's refreshing to experience attentive staff and approachable. We will recommend to all of our friends & family and be sure to return next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Like a candy coated bun! Baked Char Siu bao
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sU_1wZei6XNVpMxvYfba8g.text: I wasn't expecting to get a good Dim Sum in Las Vegas, but boy! I was wrong. Their foods were much better than I get in my area, Orange County, California. They are more authentic and fresher than most places I know. I would definitely recommend anyone to go. Oh, they don't have chicken feet by the way. LOL

jS2EZHOoR0foSyyp5jpOxA.text: It hit the dim sum spot although service could be better.   Located in the Gold Coast Casino.  We were seated immediately luckily since we got there about 15 minimum after they opened on a Sunday morning.    The line gets long so go early or prepare to wait.   Got our drinks quickly but several carts later we were still waiting for the shu mai carts to make it's way passed us.   Saw the egg custard lady about 3 times in 5 minutes.    Finally flagged her down, but by then she ran out of shu mai!  At least we got our shrimp har gow and put our order in.    Ordered off the menu as you can't eat Chinese food with the house special pan fried noodles!   Get the gobo beef too and you won't be disappointed.     My brother kept raving about these almond cookies which were not on the menu.  They actually have them at the front desk.   The cookies are legit.  Order some to eat there and a pack of three to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DpjI8Ih-Z4u_rd9Qqgov5g.text: My grandparents invited me and rest of my family here. Brand new place Gold Coast renovated the whole casino and this restaurants is one of the places they opened up. The place was awesome and very clean and decorative.  For starters we have Pork buns which were soooo good. My grandparents ordered his usual order chicken Lo Mein and Bitter Melon with Beef. The rest of my family and I did ordered Singapore Noodles and Orange Chicken. The food was delicious I loved the Orange Chicken and Lo Mein. I didn't eat too much of of the Bitter Melon, apparently its a thing in some asian cultures I personally didn't like it.  We had hot tea but I saw on the menu they made Guava Green Tea I gave it a try it tasted delicious.  My family and I are definitely coming back. The best Chinese restaurant that I think it's the best in Las Vegas. I highly recommend coming here!

7x5gZ_R_3Lcw1gRfQPcatw.text: I was skeptical of this place. Idk why but the staff was amazing super attentive. The food selection was awesome. They have free parking. The restaurant is located on the ground floor.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork rib rice pot
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork bao
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2PetkFvZC1sjNt22SRd8Dw.text: Really amazing restaurant. The food was all so flavorful and great. This is off the strip yet still has all the glam of a strip restaurant. I did my order any of the food but everything in the pictures were delicious and very authentic Chinese food.   Parking is free and there is a 2 story parking garage right in front of the casino

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sJuGS46N0dwGZp35tAlVJw.text: This review is more about their service than food and ambiance. In all of Vegas, this restaurant has the worst customer service, hands down. I was never offered a refill for water. I had to ask for napkins. When I went to pay I had to ask 3 times. And this was with no line! In addition it was towards the end of the dim sum shift!  Now on to their food, in Vegas they have the best dim sum. Their congee is clean with no heavy MSG. Their Ha Gow has good shape: when you poke your chopsticks into it it doesn't crumble easily. (Sign of a good dim sum chef) the spare ribs had the right blend of pepper and texture. One of their delicacies, the pork stomach was surprisingly flavorful without the usual slimemeness of animal organs. Overall, dim sum (not dinner) is top notch despite bad service and being 15 percent more expensive than their competitors.  Today was the first day I have been here since their remodeling a few years ago. It's more spacious, more classy and the lighting much better. Definitely come here for dim sum, but don't expect service.

EUnOWlN_5ThX9uwVe_h1_g.text: Located in the gold rush hotel, the little carts push around hot goodies! Sugar cane shrimp, shumai, ha grow, etc. Haven't been able to find dim sum as good yet in Vegas.

t0g28q1MxmFfptAWFTraGw.text: This place is soooo goood.  I drove here to meet my step dad and he recommended it (hes cantonese) and it was the best!! What we ordered:  -dimsum (shrimp and scallop) -shumai (pork) -Chinese broccoli -chicken feet -rice with chicken (kinda taste like tinola-filipino dish) -pork bao -sesame balls -some kind of pastry (did not try. Not sure what it tasted like)  Everything tasted good!! Love the shumai, dimsum, chicken feet, rice with chicken the best.   Pork bao was good just was not wow'd.  Now i know where to go eat dimsum when im in vegas :)   Btw: they serve everything from a cart and we went at lunch time.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shumai, Chinese broccoli, dimsum, pork bao, sesame balls, chicken feet, rice with chicken, pastry

qMKymCuqfKRcByObfXxGGw.text: Was good to see a line at a restaurant isn't it? Dim sum here is great! Hagow is one of the best I've ever had. It just the texture of the wrapper is on point!! But Congee is bland. Looking for good dim sum? Just come here to try it out. Make sure you're not too hungry cause they always have a line.

xSUa0VKEse9xVQ4oOMdBeA.text: Food was good. We tried the shu mai and the bbq pork buns. Not a lot of options for dim sum compared to most places. Also shared the beef stir fry noodles and some green beans. They were alright. Dim sum prices are standard maybe even on the cheaper side and food overall was fair pricing. Service really sucked though. Dim sum ladies came and then disappeared for fifteen minutes. There were no servers around to take our order for off the cart foods. Kinda sat there for a bit with no food waiting for someone to take our order

WKxtsihn6qU-12YVjbCtNA.text: I came here for noon time dim sum on a Saturday and was not disappointed.  I always knew this place existed, but never gave it any serious thought because at first, I thought the name sounded racist. It reminded me of the derogatory term, "ching chang chong," which initially turned me off. After speaking to some friends who recommended that I should give it a try, I decided to finally check it out due to my dim sum cravings.   The quality of the food here is exceptional, and the dim sum carts come frequent and fast. It got to the point where I had to constantly tell the cart aunties "no" on numerous occasions because they were so frequent. It didn't feel pushy though. It felt more like they wanted to make sure you got everything you needed and craved.   The highlight of the meal was the custard bun I had at the end. I'm not a huge fan of sweets, but oh man, these buns were heaven sent. They were so good that I had to order two more plates of them to take home and eat and savor in private later in the comfort of my home.   The fact that it was inside the Gold Coast was a nice addition. I spent the rest of the afternoon burning some of the food off bowling and playing countless hands of baccarat.   If you're craving good old fashion dim sum via push carts, come here and check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum goodness.

TWKg3kgfpShBrVFD2SyItA.text: This restaurant runs like a well oiled machine! Service is top notch and the food is delicious. Just ate there again last weekend. So many choices on the menu!

K9ibEIgr45WV0R01CTo3IA.text: PPP is still a decent place for dim sum in a VERY sketchy casino. Security was throwing a 'working girl' out, during my visit. Vegas baby!  The good news is the place opens at 10:00 am, which was perfect for my jet lagged body. I arrived around 10:15 and was promptly seated. By 11:00 there was a waiting line.  I got spring rolls for appetizer which easily rated a 4 star. And black bean chicken for main course (pic included). It had green peppers and scallions, but the veggies were luke warm, guess they didn't get stir fried enough. Solid 3 star. Service was ok. But could understand the dim sum servers getting burned out by dinner time as 1001 folks said no, after they explained what was on their cart. Most of my fellow dinners were Asian and heard a fair bit of Cantonese.  Nothing to do with the restaurant, but how I got there was an adventure. I am staying at Caesar's, and decided to walk the mile to PPP. Busy flamingo road and you cross the expressway at busy intersection. Several street people sleeping on section of the sidewalk that curves away from the road. Sad to see. Decided to take a cab back.  PPP is shadow of it's former self, but still deserves a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Bean Chicken

dZ4W2PFxW7AoWIhlmZyH-Q.text: Went to this restaurant for lunch based on a friend's recommendation. Food was adequate but not great.  Server never came back to see if we needed anything. Dining room was basically a very loud cafetetia. Prices are much higher than the food, service or atmosphere warranted. Had it been cheap eats, I would say we got what we paid for.

rvjLHahzHBX6HKPrfA4UTw.text: I really like this place & returned for dim sum when I was in Vegas. Tried a lot of their dishes, including garlic baby bok choy (which was better than Chinese broccoli), eggplant shrimp, and shrimp look fun. The only thing that I didn't really like was a chow fun dish that we ordered. Everything else was well worth the wait. Service isn't the best but what else do you expect for dim sum in the Gold Coast hotel

3uOGUFHE1PgWvfAqruXdmg.text: Havent been here in 3 years, came on a Sunday waited in line for a hour finally got seated ordered my food and the quality and size of the food items went down while the prices went up and no i wont be coming back

ZvWydbNm6Xe_mVH9UdYQmQ.text: Always excelent food quality and taste. Wonderful customer service specially from the manager Christy. We celebrated my sons birthday yesterday and they sing Ang gave him a special dessert. New reo-opening location is beautiful. My favorite plate us the hit and sour soup, there no place that makes it as good as them. Other great plates are Gobo beef, Walnut prangs, Cantonese rice.

f1GI1r4uVn82NPLEimpkqA.text: Decent place for a sit-down meal late night. Had wor wonton soup which had a nice flavorful broth. The veggie spring rolls, however, were not so great.

vawqtONFinH4YzZCZoZH6g.text: Food was very good. We had the Singapore noodles, Chicken lo mein, Har Gao, Pot stickers, and Orange chicken. All fresh and properly prepared. If you want the hot oil and mustard just ask them to bring it for you. Ambiance is nice, open kitchen so it can be a bit noisy. Plenty of Asian cliental so always a good sign. Prices are reasonable given the venue. A classy place with great food.

rzPS9gxKj3iJ6Nrepn1EGg.text: We had dinner here one night and had a very good meal. The Orange chicken was excellent. The hot and sour soup was ok. The lettuce wraps were very good. Service was excellent. I would recommend because the price was also very reasonable.

5nHcou2Yf-ygz_ktnnsHcQ.text: We often come here for a fine sea food dining. Their seafoods are always fresh and declious. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9c6Tp8v0sveqFbXbl0uV1g.text: We had a late night 4th meal....frog legs at midnight for the win! It was delicious as well as the claypot rice. The dim sum was nothing extraordinary but a lot of their dinner items that I snuck a peek at other tables looked good. Service was fine, on par with other Chinese establishments.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt pepper frog legs

hZhBSgc4OEKDGzANNzxTGA.text: Poor customer service as we waited for 30 mins for the server to return our check. I can only vouch they have decent dim sum selections but it was hard to be patient with their service while our phones' receptions never work in this restaurant. Hope another place would open up to take over in this town with good customer services.

PA_A9ksa2niyTCK91rd9Pg.text: We love this place. We make a point to come here every time we're in town. The service is prompt and friendly and the food is consistently delicious. You definitely wouldn't expect to find a gem like this in a casino. Their Kung pao chicken is sweet with the perfect amount of heat. The soft fried chicken noodles are down right yummy. Prices are fair and the portions are big enough to share.

1tpX6W9rjUjCd2l4r_2v3g.text: A cross between Panda (good) & Chinese food from New York's China Town (absolutely repulsive) surprisingly equals excellent Chinese food. A must stop for the wife and I every time we go to Vegas.

VpXbTjtA5ucDor5Dgv2eEw.text: Best place in Vegas for Dim Sum and authentic Chinese food! No reservations you wait in line. Tip: I call in my order to go skip the line and pick it up. The walnut prawn shrimp and house rice to die for!

YNcBCXedUd66E2L_n1Y8Kw.text: Love the place. They had assorted dim sum I can think of and the flavor was quite authentic. The wait time was about 25 minutes at 11am.

W29IIYrFzU1YRLbM_lF4LA.text: This place is great for dim sum! I love going here when I'm in town. The food is exceptional and the only downside is the wait! But trust me, it's worth it. There's nothing I've eaten from here that I haven't liked. My family and I love it, and we're pretty critical when it comes to dim sum. Would definitely go again and highly recommend if you're nearby and looking for some good dim sum!

t5UqMw-p7sTJlVfj2rs7sw.text: Good food although a little overpriced. For a plate of Gai LAN, Chinese broccoli, costs $8.99! Crispy pork was $9.99. We ordered total of 10 items and cost us close to $60 after tips. Good dim sum but overpriced.

0hltF3qvAZDIKXBQySuZaQ.text: Bad service, worst hostesses and the food was horrific. Wor wonton soup blah, dim sum pork ribs ay and shanghai noodles with pork never again. Do not eat here. It was so bad I had to say.

2kots2EM1__Q1dhAKigyYA.text: We arrived at Vegas past 2pm and was starving!!! Of course ... yelp to the rescue ... just a quick search ... whatever is open at that time! Found this place, hesitant at first but ... food was good! Descent enough for a chinese restaurant... not too pricey. Did ibsay food is good? Service was quick and our waiter was attentive. Definitely coming back to this place.

gUTSokudb8fEosn_2SLfuw.text: This is probably one of the best dimsum place in the USA. We went there for lunch and ordered the most amazing dim sum from the cart lady. They can speak minimal English but the taste is so authentic and worth the long queue. Don't bother ordering from the lunch menu. GET THE DIMSUM!!!

IrahoorwrSaoYWygddq6LA.text: Too much hype on this place. Service is mediocre, waited for a long time for almost everything. Dim Sum around 1:30 and we were towards the end of the rush so no reason not to be tended. We have to ask for refills on drinks, food cart stop rolling for some time, other ala cart orders came way late... just not what it used to be. Can get better service somewhere.

OizYX7iHCOJh4fRvYFRKug.text: It's good, esp considering since there's really no other place I know of to get good dim sum around the Vegas area. We ordered the shrimp har gow, the siu mai, some chive thing that is first steamed, then fried on both sides.  BF got his steamed pork buns and ate every last one.  I got some porridge since I had been sick, and it was helped me feel better, love the crispy wontons. I was pretty stuffed.  Dimsum for two.. about $30, pretty reasonable, or average, depends on how you look at it, and how much you eat. It was nice to have dimsum in LV, but it was just okay.  Nothing to rave about.  Maybe I'm just jaded by the plethora of dim sum restaurants I live by.

SJLgldeJBxfKCxlpGSOIwg.text: I usually don't go to restaurants in casinos for authentic Chinese food, but I read the reviews on Yelp and wanted to give it a try.  We went to PPP on Friday evening for dinner.  We were seated right away and I like the modern decor of the restaurant. It is clean and neat. We ordered some spring rolls, HK style wonton noodles ,and shanhainese pan fried noodles.  They are all so delicious. I like them being not too salty.    I will definitely come back again and try out their dim sum as I read that they are pretty awesome too.

5vJlhzjLm0mtEq3zuK1V_w.text: The dim sum choices here are pretty nice. A lot of varieties that you usually do not see in regular dim sum places. The prices are good. Medium item runs $2.88 while large item adds another buck. Service is pretty nice.  We came early around 10:30 am. There is already a short line. They quickly opened another room. The room was soon full. I wonder if it is because of it was Sunday. Anyhow, come early to avoid the line. The place open daily at 10 am

nPEvlv-wjKtNQva5IE7vDg.text: Wrapping up dinner now. Basically a repeat of others. Food is solid, not exceptional. However service is pretty abysmal. The only people that are hustling are the bus boys. The servers are aloof and disinterested. I think they've grown way past complacent. The place is dirty - the side plate had old rice stuck to it still. Server could have cared less when we pointed it out to him.  I won't be coming back here.

P7tjdyJI0mvujiIK90H3ZA.text: I love this place! The dim sum is amazing!! I love the food from the carts...no need to order off the menu! Your imagination is the limit the carts offer everything from chicken feet to seaweed salad!!  The staff is friendly and helpful!

-zMZlOz4HYaIcRVKcEQ76A.text: It's convenient if you're staying at Gold Coast Hotel....they have cheap & good dimsum in there!    The only downside...service is slow if you're gonna order from the menu or waiting for your check...server takes a while before you can get there attention.

yR4lVk01xntYcDys79rPaw.text: Currently this is my favourite Dim Sum in the US. The prices are dirt cheap in comparison to LA/SF/NYC, and the quality is top notch. The servers with the carts are quite pushy, and you'll need to learn to say no and keep looking for what you want, but it's worth it. Also, there can be some serious language barriers at times, but if it looks good it probably is good and eventually you'll learn what everything is. I never miss this place when in Vegas and I suggest you don't either. Even if you don't have a car with you, it's worth the cab ride.

DsvBOimWbg7BReIa27VviA.text: Staying at Palms Place, this joint was just a short walk. Our Lyft driver from the airport recommended this place, and he was spot on. Walk through the casino at Gold Coast past the slots, and there it is: super tasty Chinese food. Definitely not PF Changs! The braised chicken was nicely fried with a delicious sauce and the anchovy rice was perfectly seasoned. Round it out with the stuffed tofu and one of the soft noodle dishes, and you're set. Yes, you''re surrounded by the sound of slots, but it's worth it.

bnUfKICbnhoS46dJsVuvzQ.text: Overrated. Rated the best chinese restaurant in las vegas 2011? Are you kidding me?? Slow service, lazy server, absolutely outrageous price and very very slow dim sum cart. Who wanna wait half an hour outside and another half an hour to get a chicken feet??  I am sorry ping pang pong, you just feel like a ping pong then a True pang for my buck!

2apAYLWw5oeojUCItqNqig.text: Pretty good dimsum at affordable prices.    Selection is limited if you want beancurd wrap.    We came here at 11am on Sunday morning and did not really have to wait.  Rolling carts at two sections.  Negative - facing the casino so you breathe the smoke.  Fish eel soup was good.  $9/bowl.

o_m_ts-thzruQNsESyZ7bg.text: Had friends staying at the Gold Coast, we ate at the restaurant, great service, great food.  I'm not much on Asian cuisine, but this was great, lots of food and even my friends commented how great it was, and they found their new favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas..  The waiter was very informative and helpful, took the time to explain things on the menu we didn't know about or understand.

vHhSiLfazcWaQaoc3pW4Zw.text: A cabdriver recommended this place, and specifically,  the Mandarin duck.  He was right on!  It was a 1/2 duck, and chopped so it could easily be eaten.  The skin was crispy and the meat very tender.  The sauce was divine.  We also tried the moo shoo pork and the shrimp fried rice, and both were very good.  The only downside for us, was that this is an "open wall" concept eatery so you are right at the casino floor, and the cigarette smoke does get to you. We saw a lot of take out orders, so maybe next time we will try that.  The prices were very reasonable and the dishes were generous and tasty.  They serve until 3am, and since we came in after a show, there was no wait. The service was fast and the wait staff very friendly.

Yx01ooJw11EbADF_Uj06GQ.text: Do I even have to give a star? In Australia we call this style of dining yum cha.    Firstly, They say the kitchen closes at 3pm, and we arrived at 2pm. The dim sum cart came around once, then we were told to order from the menu if we wanted more food. The service was SHOCKINGLY BAD, they would ask you a question, and then ignore the answer, only to ask the question again, only to get caught up in a conversation with another server, only to ask the question again.  I can't even be bothered telling you all the other issues here, because I want to clear my head space from people/businesses like this.  NEXT!

3zzkfCE7Gb3QBJ72UbbNJA.text: Black bean chicken - Sucked Shrimp fried rice - Salty Sesame Shrimp Rolls - Excellent  We tried this place because they advertised on their billboards how their restaurant won all these awards and they were right across the street from our hotel (the palms). The food is definitely authentic tasting, but it was very salty for my liking.  The black bean chicken was recommended by the manager waiting on us, and it was a bad a call. Sounded good, but it turned out not to be so great. Nonetheless when we ate all three items together the food didn't taste so bad.  Still, its definitely not AWARD winning like they paint themselves to be. I wouldn't mind eating here again: as long as I order something different.  I think our biggest mistake was ordering the fried rice. If we had white rice instead, and ordered two other meat dishes other than the black bean chicken it would have been fine.  Maybe i'll do that next time.  This restaurant definitely has potential, we just made poor choices in ordering our food.  Our fault. Service was good. A-Ok.

UnpMSUWFZAO8WpJ2aON_TA.text: This is where I go for dim sum when I'm in vegas.   I would give them four stars if they had more variety.

L-x0My8_OPNFXyRzHSP--g.text: The best Chinese Food in Las Vegas, no other restaurant comes remotely close.  The chicken fried rice, beef broccoli with Chinese broccoli, chicken kung pao, orange chicken, and lemon chicken are all excellent.   The lamb chops are an excellent appetizer, full of flavor and unlike any others I've ever had.

ebOrOizGuzUryPYwp2sUOw.text: The place was crowded and the service was so-so. They need more carts but no much room. However, the dim sum was actually good. Prices is more than other places off the strip but it's cheaper than dim sum on the strip. Free refills on soda, I haven't been to any places that serves dim sum where you can get free refills on soda.  I would only came here if I lived here, but a few places to visit before coming back.

PlcS3Y3kstremGTIs1GIGQ.text: found my new favorite Chinese restaurant. not only the dim sum..but we tried the noodle omg it was so yummy. still have long way to go to try their menus. the price is bit pricey when you only go there for 2 lol.but that's because they have big portion on their plates. next time we''ll come with more people and just order few items and share it. that should be perfect! overall it was a great experienced and the food came out fast.

a8VPbOC5mlDze5IexdtAeQ.text: Tourist trap. Food is bland. Customer service is awful. Selection is poor. Prices are EXTREMELY HIGH for dim sum.

ZH_dlTZ5eeZbGaqdKeWdtQ.text: We love this place! This restaurant is inside the Gold Coast Casino..  Generally when we go to Las Vegas, we stay at the Gold Coast and we eat at Ping Pang Pong.  The price is very reasonable and the food is fresh.  We usually order:  Salty fish fried rice with no meat Gailan with garlic sauce Steam seasoning chicken feet Peking Duck Pea Sprout with garlic sauce  So far we were not disappointed by any dishes we ordered yet.

j-DYRh_l3sv6MKhfaiidXA.text: This place to me is not all that great dim sum I've had better. The only thing that is good here is the walnut shrimp and the portions is great enough for a family of 5.   The time I came it didn't seem like the dim sum carts wanted to go to the other side of the restaurant. When you asked what it was in the cart the cart lady  had a hard time speaking english. Which was a boo for them.  How can you serve someone when you can't even tell them what it is.  Service is whack... can't get water or the check. FAIL..   So thank you for the yummie walnut shrimp but no thank you for not giving me my check when I asked for it 3 times.

vm3sqdn-i6DG2quGhSEhsQ.text: Ok I refused to believe that this is voted the best Chinese food in Vegas!!! Food is mediocre at best. Guaranteed stomache ache after. In an old casino and smelled every bit like one!!  Dont think I will go back....

xXhhw_tcSGvbB5ZTh3Y2cw.text: Expect to wait in line, but most places worth eating should have a line. I like this place because they have dishes other dim sum places don't. Some of their dishes are better and some are average. The service kills me though. By the time we're seated, we're starving. We stare at the ladies pushing the cart hoping they see us and come to us but they turn some place else or return their carts. I don't have an enjoyable meal here because the way the food comes around. We see the same carts over and over so grab something and by the end, that's when we see our favorite dishes but we're already full. It's frustrating the service because I do like the food.

HGE_h6gowukZp2sqpzZ8sQ.text: White guilt told me this was some kind of racial slur against chinese people. Yelp told me it was actually a killer chinese restaurant. Yelp was right! So so so so good!

etaYWnP8HojsXq3D3BGOxg.text: Best dim sum I've ever had. The environment is not upscale. Service is slow especially when it gets busy and that occurs on a regular basis. expect to wait in a line. It's not unusual. Best time to go is right before 3pm when they stop serving dim sum. Again, I go for the food and its worth it.

qD3FH8mzSnWtyW4iJedGUA.text: Me & some buds tried the dim sum buffet for lunch on the advice of a cabbie. Glad we did. You know you are getting quality, reasonably priced Asian food when you are surrounded by almost total Asian diners & wait staff. Service was steady; there were some minimal communication issues. Dim sum was better than most i've tried. Cheap too. I'm ready to go back.

DLi_ICyohyFTgHCiug_QsQ.text: Absolutely enjoy dining in an atmosphere that reminds me of HongKong as a child vacationing with my Mom & Dad. The wait in the line to get a table and seating is not bothersome as watching the activity in the restaurant and seeing the Chinese cooks in their crisp white chef garbs before chinese woks and hot fire, all viewable in the open cooking area. These Chinese cooks whip up authentic Chinese menu! The food servers there to serve and aid in choosing from the menu and answer meal questions. Authentic Chinese cuisine, in that it is not Americanized Chinese food. From seafood, to vegetables, soups, main meat meals and dessert, it could never been any less filling. Best recommendation is to try each and every entree in the menu. In as much as I return dining in this restaurant located inside the Gold Coast Hotel and Casino of the west side of Entertainment City, I have a constant pick which you may want to try. For starters, savor the taste of Savory Minced Squab and Pork Tenderloin (served with hoisin sauce). A Provincial favorite dish is Double-Braised Scallop Hot Pot (whole seared scallops simmering in garlic oyster sauce served in a sealed clay pot) which is just tasteful. A favorite dish is the Singapore Rice Noodles with a taste of curry that reminds me definitely of SIngapore (with vermicelli. shrimp, BBQ pork, onions). Serve me Duck and it sticks in my palate even after it's off the plate into the tummy filling: Plum-Orange Braised Leg of Duck or the Cantonese Roast Duck (Half). The Lobster and Vermicelli Clay Pot steaming in broth, or the Emperor's Seafood Stew (sun-dried abalone, fish maw with supreme sea cucumber all simmered in flavorful broth) or the Manila Clams with Black Bean Sauce definitely sends me to seafood heaven. Develop a taste for the very appetizingly filling Clay Pot & Congee meals is a definite choice: Ginger Mushroom Chicken Rice or the Sausage Duck Confit Rice. For Rice dishes, I always order Cantonese Curry Beef Brisket Stew, or the Chow Fried Rice (with BBQ pork, green onions and shrimp), or the spicy Night Market Fried Rice (with sliced beef, fresh Thai chilies, diced tomatoes, bean sprouts), or Fu Chow Fried Rice (mixed seafood sauteed in a light scallion gravy) or the Pineapple Seafood Fried Rice (which reminds me of being in the islands). A vegetable favorite is Sauteed Lotus Root (thinly sliced in an sweet and pungent sauce), or the Snow Pea Leaves with Roasted Garlic. Highly recommend "Dim Sum" as it is for me the best bang for your bucks in this entertainment city! A wide array presented in rolling carts pushed around by chinese-garbed food servers all too willing for passing it on to your table from the dim sum cart. Ready for small eats that leaves you wanting more, go Dim Sum! Dim Sum dining is at lunch time. As I have experienced dining here as often as possible, see for yourself why it's been voted many times as "one of the top 10 Chinese restaurants in America" by Travel + Leisure magazine and "Best Asian Restaurant in Las Vegas" by readers of the Las Vegas Review-Journal! China has never been closer at Ping Pang Pong! Ha, that's a hit!

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. authentic Chinese cuisine at Ping Pang Pong
Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum is yummm

aWgFp30rDZy7ntt92wZEsg.text: So highly rated yet really disappointing. Named one of the top 10 Chinese restaurants in America by Travel + Leisure magazine and  "Best Asian Restaurant in Las Vegas" six times by readers of the Las Vegas Review-Journal? Really? They sure did not sparkle on 8/13/13. My date said "They must be resting on their laurels". The food was just ok. Nothing special there. The floor was sticky. Gnats buzzed around our table all visit. Uniformed employees ate at the table next to us. The thing that stuck in my mind is the terrible service. The (Spanish?) server who took our drink order did not know the name of the only chardonnay on the menu. Our meal server never returned to ask us if everything was ok. In fact she disappeared for good after our order was placed. Eventually we had to flag down some one who was serving other tables in our section to help us. It is not like they were over busy at 8pm on a Tuesday night. I even passed on dessert, completely un-heard of for me, due to the lack of attention we received.

OydCwiuY-1u5F4AcNTkC6g.text: Update 2009:  another year and another good visit for dim sum.  still not a fan of the funky name or location.  the menu is somewhat limited nothing too fancy, just honest old fashioned dim sum.  tasty ja leung, siu mai, har gow, crab claw,... (see pics)  --------- While in Vegas earlier this week, we were craving some authentic dim sum and trusted that the YELP community would steer us in the right direction.  After some reading we decided on Ping Pang Pong.    I will be honest, the name gave reason for hesitation... the location (gold coast casino?) lead to some more doubt...  Boy were we wrong! This place was good!  Thanks fellow yelpers!!!  This place would be 5 stars if the service was a little better.

bPqyQaBO-bS8jXRmFI7j-g.text: The food here is delicious better then a lot of the ones in LA love this place their deep fried salted fish is amazing and the fried tofu food here is made with love! luv this place!!!!!  hands down the best chinese food place in lv!!! Reservations. Needed!!!

YRthHqX8z-Qh5wOGfQpgkA.text: The restaurant is inside the Gold Coast Hotel/Casino. I've only been for lunch so far. The food and prices are decent. It's pretty good for reasonable chinese food. They have the standard dim sum items for lunch. The place gets pretty hectic for lunch, but it's the standard for any dim sum place that is busy. If you go for lunch and only have an hour, I suggest you definitely get there before 11:30am.

STF1qH2gMYiF6VxEZFJoZA.text: great food!  been here for both dim sum & just a dinner.  its usually REALLY busy & there's almost always a line out the front door. but honestly, its worth the wait. the prices are very reasonable & you get a lot for your money.  definately a place to take company when you want some good food! oh and they do close for an hour or so after lunch. BUT, open until 3am! =)

gxIE-Kw4at33m2qXbQgdJw.text: I love Ping Pang Pong. It is the best dim sum in Vegas. Sometimes the service can be a little slow, but the food is delicious and the prices are so reasonable.

rcIDojhH2RjI13EH9z3pKQ.text: If you are looking for good chinese food. Ping pang pong is one of the best chinese restaurant in town, I had a steamed cantonese Princess chicken and Stir fried Lobster with ginger. it was delicious. I am looking forward to back there again.

gmbVAWjGI5-a-_N8kmmvHQ.text: Coming from Los Angeles, I'm completely spoiled with awesome dim sum places, so maybe you should take my review with a grain of salt.   First off, the seating procedure is absolutely terrible. You wait in a line with a bunch of other people, whose parties can range from a small group of two to a large group of eight. Yet no one comes to sort out these groups and so because that group of eight is going to wait forever, you're waiting forever with them.   When you're finally seated, you notice that there are two different rooms. If you're lucky, you'll be in the room near the kitchen, and you'll get your food. If not, you'll be waiting forever only to realize that those ladies with the carts are only going around the first room.   However, I will say that their food is pretty good. Of all the dim sum I've tried in Vegas, this is probably the best one. They have a pretty good selection of dim sum, although I would say that their tripe is not that great. But I do really like their other dishes.  All in all, a good place for the food but you're going to have to suffer through the terrible service.

emT2EUZspiei8AKVwi6-Pg.text: Five stars for Ping Pang Pong. Price, late-night hours, and excellent authentic Chinese food overcome the flaws with the rude, slow and often non-existent service. I recommend sitting at the counter where you can watch the cooks turn out the dishes and easily get the attention of one of the servers.   I've eaten here three times now and have yet to walk away disappointed with the food. Highly recommended.

Ai6O-j4laUQrmp9gWPVw9w.text: This restaurant is known for their dim sum, but we came here and ordered individual dinner plates.  This restaurant was very packed and on top of that, it's located inside a casino.    Overall, the food was okay and just like any other Chinese restaurant out there.  I will definitely come back for dim sum the next time I'm in town.

8JH_5lJVXNBqkLkWF4o_zg.text: Best Chinese in Vegas, and voted so. Super traditional, super delicious. The duck is to die for.

GE0R5tsFm8nmv2ibh4RrhA.text: Good authentic Chinese food! Only reason I'm giving it 3 stars is because of the service, you'd think that since this restaurant is located inside a hotel in VEGAS they'd handle diversity well! The food is great, best fried rice in Vegas here, and shrimp cakes are perfection.

RyzmxCkxeMy7ol4Yb47jfw.text: Authentic Cantonese dim sum. Setting is open to the casino, but not noisy at all. We went on a week day around 10am, more people came in afterwards. It was pretty much full by the time we left. If you are a Cantonese cuisine lover, and tired of the heavy American food, this is the one for you. The price is reasonable too.

4MHZ9BKrr510RX4eV5Hn8w.text: Why all the hate ? At first I thought the name of the restaurant was some kind of joke haha (I have a sense of humor with this kind of stuff). But they accommodated a last minute birthday party for a large party and even assisted with bringing out the cake and singing happy birthday. The food was decent, fairly extensive menu, and the staff was attentive. Very pretty decor AND they were open pretty late too.

photos.caption: Photo of Ping Pang Pong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TllBmJr8S5_WPMxanZHOuQ.text: Came here with a friend for a dim sum lunch late Monday morning, and it was already packed with a short line of customers waiting.  The wait was about 15 minutes before we were seated at a table.  Service here is decent, with about 4 to 5 carts of dim sum items to choose from.  Selection was good, but the quality of the dim sum is both good and bad.  Good is good, not great, as the dishes we enjoyed didn't wow us tremendously.  The bad dishes, unfortunately, left a lasting impression.  The included the following:  - Roast Pork - Though the skin was rather crispy, you can tell by the color and texture of the meat that it was reaheated.  It was not fresh despite the fact the cart lady chimed that the roast pork just came out of the oven/fire.  - Siu Mai - These steamed dumplings are traditionally made with seasoned ground pork, shitake mushrooms and shrimp.  There was no shrimp in these, and some of the siu mais were prepared in the way where a couple of them were dense, dry and hard to the chew.    - Chinese Broccoli - The dish we got had broccoli that was not as thick as the ones on the other dish.  Chinese Broccoli, as it grows older, the stalks get thicker and the inside turns from translucent (tender) to white (old).  We needed some greens to balance the meal and tried this.  Aside from the issue with the age of the broccoli used, the preparation was fine.  But older broccoli is harder to chew through and can be awfully fibrous.  - XO Sauce Pan-Fried Rice Noodle Rolls - Seasoned well, but could have used more XO Sauce to give it a spicy kick.  The problem with the dish we got was that it was the last of it's type on a cart, uncovered, and must have sat on that cart for awhile.  It was cold, not as flavorful, and cold rice noodles dry up and harden.  Best to ask to test the temperature of the plate or dish these more exotic dim sum dishes are served on so that you can figure out if it's relatively fresh, or if it's been sitting around for a while.  Prices are higher, as expected, since this is a hotel restaurant.  With other dim sum palaces in Vegas, we probably won't be back.  It's OK to good, but there are better.

wivYULOUV-vzFyHd_5wh9A.text: Food is great, my family love and enjoy it. Dim sum, definitely, you don't want to miss this place.

Wif6xxfv0o3sv4Z06dPzfw.text: Average service. They have many different dishes but the taste is also average. The fact that Many people waiting in line can't hide the fact that the quality of food is not that good.

9MfKq3VCVVSvz3Lr8JKFjw.text: This is probably the best Chinese food I have tasted in the entire valley. We made a reservation for Christmas day for a round table of 10 and we were seated promptly.... the service was very efficient even though there were crowds of people waiting to get into this packed restaurant that day. Our favorite dish is the walnut shrimp, but all the dishes we ordered were delicious. The spring rolls and the dim sum potstickerswere excellent.  One thing I really like is the fact that the food is never oily or greasy and definitely freshly-made. this is our third visit to this restaurant and we have never been disappointed. We will keep coming back four more good Chinese food.

eQVWAOcv_seqQbq7unqQpw.text: The location was beautiful and the staff was very attentive and the food was served super fast. The waiter had full knowledge of the menu because we asked him a lot of questions and he had a great attitude. I am a potsticker fan and get those whenever I can but I did not like these potstickers , they were very bready ??? It did not have a thin light wrapping and it was not crispy it was just sort of thick on it and had an unusual texture , they were absolutely stuffed with meat but for some reason I didn't like the meat it was too solid and chunky like I was eating a sausage wrapped in a cover. The fish fillet with a black bean sauce was amazing the shumai was really really good !!

dBLfRWU92IvFeiUKuV0LmQ.text: Always hearing about this place so decided to go for lunch.  First of all I'm used to eating at Chinese restaurants in Hawaii.  Not really into dim sum but we were going to order from the menu.  No line, sat down then there was a 2-3 ladies with their carts, that hovered over us wanting us to get something from their cart!  Never had a chance to see what was on there then one of them started grabbing a few plates and placing them on our table when I asked what it was!  I finally got to get a word in and told them for the 3rd or 4th time that we wanted a menu.  Ordered chow fun and black bean spareribs which was good, but I still haven't found any place here that reminds me of the great Chinese food in Hawaii.

UiJOUjmRNz4Q7CXSaZSbFA.text: Before I came to Las Vegas, I did lots research and many people had recommended Ping Pang Pong for breakfast! It didn't disappoint me. We got there around 12:30, so it pretty busy hour for this place. But the waiting time for us is only about 10 minutes. The decoration of the restaurant has lots Chinese elements in there, very gorgeous! Food are very variety and delicious! Definitely five stars!!

fOOCE--TODh419KjNisC1A.text: Service really sucks. None speak English. Rude people. Don't waste your time. Hope and pray they get new management.

qFznOt-ESvlNfHLYOtTeqA.text: Brought the entire family here for dinner and everything from food to service was excellent! We'll definitely be back. Yes, the food is expensive, but you pay for quality. Our waitress was on top of everything; drink refills, napkins, etc. Best Chinese food in Vegas!

stZ9II7a7nrI-7Cz5dI9MQ.text: It's the best dim sum place. Their service is good and quick! I come this place every time when I visit Vegas :)

rx5udGikH0ZLUKQojXrxlA.text: Kristy S. Is an amazing server she suggested the crispy shrimp stuffed chicken in place of our crispy chicken. She made our visit an exciting and fun dinner with the family. Thank you so much kristy we will be back. If I could put ten stars I would.

DovVIPuj8Ixzj3vcaXRrQg.text: Located inside the Gold Coast Casino. The place has moved to the former dance hall. Wider and nicer than it's previous location. We were seated immediately this time (probably because it's not the weekend). Wait staff was okay. Food was good... my 2 favorites, lamb tenderloin with scallions and onions was good... The other was a 3 Mushroom dish which was also good. Been here several times before and I always liked it. The prices are reasonable. 3 stars today because somehow, the dishes seemed to lack flavor which I like during my previous visits. I liked them but something flavorwise, seemed to be missing today. I will definitely return snd re-assess the food flavors...

nL8CLvmX3uWOR9Wy5jP3Cg.text: It was a solid dim sum place. I would say it is a notch above those dim sum places in Chinatown LV. The service was good for a Chinese restaurant. There was no wait for us when we went there closer to 11.

eoFwK8D89VzVz98tNz1X8g.text: BW  Inside the casino.  It's right across the slots and a soup noodle spot.  At first glance, it looks very fancy and it's packed.  The carts start coming  but then (crickets... ... .. . ...)  Why are the  carts empty? Why are there no beef balls or congee available? Then we ordered and I am a huge DIM SUM advocate and I rarely say bad things about restaurants.  But the attitude from the cart pushers are bad.  Our congee came in old tasting and chunky.  We had to ask for it to be changed.  Also, the portions  were small and it did not look fresh. The prices here are ridiculous.  Maybe it's because you are paying for the restaurant location.  The restrooms are outside the restaurant around the corner which is an inconvenience.  I love that the carts have the same food and no one is ordering.  They do not look fresh at all.  Uber small and super expensive.  I rather go to Spring Mountain for food.  But the only plus is that the parking lot is 1 mile away but free (so you get a nice workout to burn off your food).  Overall, this place get's no love from me.  I will not be back.  I hope this was just a bad day.  Sorry guys I don't like this place at all.  By the way did I mention you will be overcharged for something that should cost $1.25 to $2.55 for a dim sum dish.    * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

3dwcwf1tkthoE3CQBeSdrA.text: Passable Dim Sum. Probably the best Dim Sum in Vegas but not in the Western United States. I know it is not fair to compare to LA standards but it has to be compared to some standard.  A lot of the items were cold, such as XO sauce rice noodles and Chinese broccoli. The roast pork tasted reheated. The Har Gow and Shrimp Cheung Fun were good. If you are dying for dim sum in Vegas, this is the place to go.

EznuVEuM7DlZcvyInSWA1w.text: How do you say "Delicious" in Chinese? It's Ping Pang Pong! For years, my family and I enjoyed everything about this place ---delectable and savory. It was a busy day but all of the food that we ordered came out hot, generous family- style portions and on time.   This would have been a 5 star review except for the fact that we have to find our waiter every time  we need something. But it's peak hours and busy so I completely understand. All our food  are palatable.. we're happy!  The steamed Flounder was well-seasoned (you can have them deep fried btw) as we have devoured every edible part of it.. the pork chop and orange chicken are our "all time family favorites" along with the must-have- Mama's fave: bitter melon. They offer toothsome Asian deserts as well.  Y-U-M-MY for our tummy! Always come famished when you bring your big appetite to this place!

c0H_ijwjdM4ZTLutuZmSPA.text: Delicious salt and pepper pork chop.  Try their seafood soup bowl (serves 5 people).  Har gaw, pork shu-mai were good too

65huk_AUj2nsgydHg2pZJg.text: We came to eat dim sum here and it's not a disappointment!  They have so much variety of things to eat here from dumplings, chicken feet, tripe, spare ribs, congee soup, and the cart comes by all the time.  If you are looking for a certain dish you can ask the worker and they will find it for you.  I feel like they were extremely accommodating and what made me happy was they had hot oil.  I went to a previous dim sum place inside the rio and it was horrible. They don't use hot oil but a peanut sauce.  Everything taste horrible there but that is another review I will share.   This was prob one of my favorite meals in Vegas with the girls.  We had shrimp dumpling, shumai dumpling, chicken feet, tripe, soup, shrimp noodle, congee soup, sweet tofu with ginger.  Everything was delicious and did not make me hungry.  I wish this place was brought to my attention earlier of our trip.  We are a lot and paid $60 bucks for a bunch of food.  Next time I'm in Vegas I will be back here!

_t2TbSoo2st5QPoU-Pxz4w.text: Surprisingly good dim sum. Traditional cart rolling around restaurant. Prices were not unreasonable either. Had all of your usual shiu mai, pork buns, all sorts of shrimp, pork, and beef dumplings. No soup dumplings. Service was good. They sat us quick and turn around seemed quick.  Venue itself was spacious. Located in Gold Coast casino... big surprise for us but we enjoyed ourselves and again very affordable prices. Nothing was surprising about the bill which is always good.   We would definitely be back to try more dim sum. Happy eating!

Woulda taken pics but forgot to do so before diving in.  Lol.  Check it out.  Honestly, one of the best Chinese dinners I've had.
